loans.name: Juana Palomino De Baez's Group

texts.es:
Juana, Damiana and Paulina belong to the Banco Comunal Bonanza.

Juana is married, is 69 years old and has three children. Juana has a small grocery store in her home. In addition she offers public telephones.

On the other siD., Damiana is a widow. She is 72 years old and has six children. Damiana purchases milk and cheese from the Alpachaca community and later sells it in the markets of Ayacucho city.

Meanwhile, Paulina is married, is 42 years old and has three children. Paulina sells school supplies and candy from her home which is close to a high school.

Juana, Damiana, and Paulina need loans of 400 soles each. This money will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, cookies, cheese, milk, gas and sweets.

The dreams of Juana, Damina and Paulina are that their children become professionals, to improve her business, and manage her business better.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Juana, Damiana, Paulina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Bonanza

Juana es casada, tiene 69 años y 3 hijos, Juana tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, además tiene teléfonos públicos.

Por otro lado Damiana es viuda, tiene 72 años y 6 hijos, Damiana compra leche y queso D. la comunidad D. Alpachaca y posteriormente lo venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Mientras que Paulina es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Paulina venD. útiles escolares y golosinas en su casa que esta cerca D. un colegio.

Juana, Damiana, Paulina necesitan préstamos D. 400 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, galletas, queso, leche, gaseosas y dulces.

Los sueños D. Juana, Damiana, Paulina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio e implementar más su negocio.

loans.use: Juana, Damiana, and Paulina need loans of 400 soles each. This money will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, cookies, cheese, milk, gas and sweets.

loans.name: Vidalina's Group

texts.es:
Vidalina, Virginia and Juana belong to the Pantipampa Communal Bank. The Pantipampa community is located two hours away from the city of Ayacucho.

Vidalina, 31 years old, lives with her partner and has five children. She has a store where she sells groceries and produce. She also buys small animals, which she fattens and sells at the community fair.

Virginia, 29 years old, also lives with her partner and has four children. She buys small animals and cattle, which she then sells at the community fair.

Juana, 34 years old, is married and has two children. She buys cereals and tubers at her community fair and sells them at the market in Ayacucho.

Vidalina, Virginia and Juana need loans for 900, 300 and 900 soles respectively. They will invest this money in the purchase of rice, sugar, pasta, candies, potatoes, wheat, barley and pigs.

The dreams of Vidalina, Virginia and Juana are to buy a strip of land, improve her house and provide a good education to her children, respectively.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Vidalina, Virginia y Juana pertenecen al Banco Comunal Pantipampa, que lleva este nombre porque todas sus socias son de la comunidad de Pantipampa, ubicada a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Vidalina es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 5 hijos. Vidalina tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes y verduras. Además compra animales menores que luego beneficia y vende en la feria de su comunidad.

Por otro lado Virginia es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 4 hijos. Virginia compra animales menores y ganado vacuno, que luego vende en la feria de su comunidad.

Mientras que Juana es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos. Juana compra cereales y tubérculos en su comunidad y los vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Vidalina, Virginia y Juana necesitan préstamos de 900, 300 y 900 soles respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, golosinas, cerdos, papa, trigo y cebada.

Los sueños de Vidalina, Virginia y Juana son comprar un terreno, mejorar su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, pasta, candies, potatoes, wheat, barley and pigs.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Isabel Teofila

texts.es:
Isabel is a partner of the Comunal Pantipampa bank. She carries this name because all of her partners are from the community of Pantipampa which is located two hours from the city of Ayacucho.

Isabel is married. She is 40 years old and has four children. Isabel has a small grocery store in her house. She also makes bread that she sells in her shop and also through other shops in her community. In addition, Isabel has a small café in the high school of her community where she sells candy, food, and fruit. Isabel also is devoted to farm work and the rearing of animals.

Isabel needs a loan of 2,500 soles which will be invested in the purchase of flour, candy, rice, sugar and vegetables.

Isabel’s dream is to have her own money, that her business prospers and that her children obtain a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel es socia del banco Comunal Pantipampa, lleva este nombre porque todas sus socias son de la comunidad de Pantipampa que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Isabel es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Isabel tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, también elabora panes que vende en su tienda y reparte a las tiendas de su comunidad. Además Isabel tiene un cafetín en el colegio de su comunidad donde vende golosinas, comidas, frutas. También Isabel se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, golosinas, arroz, azúcar y verduras.

Los sueños de Isabel son tener capital propio, que su negocio prospere y sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: Isabel needs a loan of 2,500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of flour, candy, rice, sugar and vegetables.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Janeth's Mtakwa Group

texts.en:
Janeth is 48 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages19-28 years old. Janeth owns a small shop and is a livestock keeper. She started in 1998. Every day, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Merry, Agness, Rahel, who have tailoring and liverstock businesses.

loans.use: To buy more animals to increase her stock.

loans.name: Amina's Tailoring Group

texts.en:
Amina is 37 years old and is a married woman with an 8-year-old child. Amina is a tailor. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Victoria, who sells items in the market.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is 27 years old and is a married woman with a 2-year-old child. Khadija is a tailor. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales. She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring  items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Elika's Ushirikiano Group

texts.en:
Elika is 45 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 24,18 and 15 years old. Elika sells soft drinks. She started in 1998. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more soft drinks for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Agness, Kesia and Digna, who have tailoring businesses, and sell maize and clothing.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks items for her business.

loans.name: Aziza's Mapambano Group

texts.en:
Aziza is a married woman with 4 children, ages 13,10, 5 and 3 years old. Aziza owns a small general store, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Jenifa, who sells food.

loans.use: To buy more more items for her business.

loans.name: Lightness's Leaf Group

texts.en:
Lightness is 50 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 7, 3, and 1 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 50 and 66 years old. Lightness has been selling vegetables since 2003. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Husna, Rosemary and Aurelia, who sell livestock and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Rose's Leaf Group

texts.en:
Rose is 39 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages11, 6, and 3 years old. Rose sells fish. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6.30am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $10 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwaija, Eliza, Anna and Zubeda, who have cooking businesses and sell clothing and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Angela's Yawezekana Group

texts.en:
Angela is 38 years old and is a married woman with a 2-year-old child. She and her husband also take care of a 20-year-old person. Angela owns a small tour company, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $700 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to expand her tour company. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Agness, Naomi, Grace and Joyce, who have a cafe and sell clothing.

loans.use: To expand her tour business.

loans.name: Rose's Mbele Kwambele Group

texts.en:
Rose is 36 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 13 and 5 years old. Rose has been selling food since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Joyce, Tatu, Hamida and Mary, who sell milk and soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy more food itemsfor her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with 2 children, ages 22 and 18 years old. Elizabeth owns a small general store that she started in 2001. Every day, she works from 6.30am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Elizabeth has already taken out and repaid two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Grace's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages15, 13 and 11 years old. Grace owns a small herd of cows. She started her business in 1996. Every day, she works from 6am to 6.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

Grace has already taken out and repaid a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business by buying cows. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her cows. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Pili and Mwanahamisi, who raise poultry and sell clothing.

loans.use: To buy more food for her cows.

loans.name: Pepetua's Leaf Group

texts.en:
Pepetua is a married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 7 years old. Pepetua owns a small flock of chickens, which she started in 2001. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Natalina, Salome and Rispa, who have livestock businesses, and sell vegetables and milk.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for her business.

loans.name: Veronica's Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 31 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 13,10 and 2 years old. Veronica sells clothes. She started in 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Rehema and Gudila, who have a shop and sell vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Emmy's Songambele Group

texts.en:
Emmy is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 5 and 2 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 20 and 18 years old. Emmy owns a small general store that she started in 2002. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $700 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Ndeshi, Stella, Elieka and Magdalena, who have a tailoring businesses and sell vegetables, clothing, and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long N., 61, is a widow with three children, two sons and one daughter. One of her sons is married and lives outside the family home. Her other son one runs a motor taxi, and her daughter weaves silk at home. The family lives on an Island on the Mekong River about 15 km from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Long has been a weaver for 45 years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh. She has two looms in the family; one is for her daughter and other is her own. Though she is in her early 60s, she is still strong enough to work.

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for weaving and buy a motorbike to replace the old one for her son's motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and buy a motorbike

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Mrs. Hour H., 44, and her husband, Peng Phoeun, 43, were married in 1985 and have six children, four sons and two daughters. Two of their sons sell coconuts and the others are in school. The family lives across the Mekong River and about 17 km from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Hour has been in the business of selling fish for two years. She buys them from the market to resell in the village. Her husband has been a fisherman for over 20 years and also sells cows. Through their business they can earn between 20,000-30,000 riel/day.

She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase cows for her husband to resell.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn M., 42, and her husband, Kong Chey, 45, were married in 1984 and have five children, four sons and one daughter. Two of their sons work full time and the others are in school. The family lives across the Mekong River and about 17 km from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sorn has been in the business of selling fish for two years. She buys some of them from the market and some from her husband's fishing to resell in the village. Her husband has been a fisherman for ten years. Doing this, they can earn between 20,000-30,000 riel/day.

She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase lattices for repairing her house.

loans.use: To purchase lattices for repairing her house

loans.name: Rum

texts.en:
Mr. Rum R. (pictured with his mother) is single and lives with his mother. He has one brother, who is a wooden house builder, and one sister. The family lives on an Island on the Mekong River about 12 km from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Rum has been in the business of wooden house building for four years. It’s a skill he learned from his neighbor. His mother is a farmer.

He is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a construction crane for use in his business.

loans.use: To purchase a construction crane for home building

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kea M. and her husband, Mr. San Bo, were married in 2005 and have one daughter. The couple lives with their parents. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 km from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Kea has been a weaver since she was 14 years old. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a fisherman and also runs a horse cart.

She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for weaving and buy one horse for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and buy a horse

loans.name: Atha Hal Haq

texts.en: Atha Hal Haq lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his own family. He just finished school and started working because of economical problems. He has a retail shop and he wants to take out an individual loan to complete his lease purchase for a premises for his business. He is very happy with this loan process  in Afghanistan he would like to thank Kva lenders who help poor people.

loans.use: To complete his lease purchase

loans.name: Rahm Din

texts.en: Rahm Din lives with his own family in district 14 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a student and he has a retail shop where he works together with his father to support his family. He would love to expand his business so he requested an individual loan to complete his stock and improve his business. He is happy with this loan he would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
p> Investment of First Loan:

With his first loan, Evaristo could buy all the necessary agricultural supplies to attend to the demands of his clients. That is to say, he was able to buy everything in time, finishing his crop as expected and marketing all his product.

Development of Business:

The 4 hectares that he possesses have permitted him to have sufficient land to cultivate not only rice but also related products, as for example corn. Twenty years of experience vouch for the quality and quantity of his products.

Personal information:

Evaristo is 59 years old. He is married. He has 1 son, that has already graduated secondary school. His dwelling is of mixed construction; cane and wood. One of his aspirations is to buy more hectares of land to have more production

Use of Second Loan:

With this new loan he will buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to take advantage of the winter season and to save irrigation. The advantage of his location is that it is in the high part of this coastal region.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=11783

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Inversión de Primer Préstamo:

Evaristo pudo comprar todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para atender la demanda de sus clientes. Es decir que compro todo a tiempo, terminando su cosecha como el esperaba y comercializando todo su producto.

Desarrollo de Negocio:

Las 4 hectáreas que posee, le han permitido tener terreno suficiente para cultivar no solo arroz sino productos afines como por ejemplo el maíz. 20 años de experiencia avalan la calidad y cantidad de sus productos.

Información Personal :

Evaristo tiene 59 años. Es casado. Tiene 1 hijo, que ya es bachiller. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta caña y madera. Una de sus aspiraciones es comprar mas hectáreas de tierra para tener mas producción

Uso de Segundo Préstamo:

Con este nuevo préstamo comprara abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, equipo menor, alquiler de maquinarias, contratación de mano de obra, y otros insumos necesarios para aprovechar la época invernal, y ahorrar el riego. La ventaja del sector es que esta en la parte alta de este sector costero.

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
Investment of the first loan:

Angel could buy all necessary agricultural supplies to satisfy the demands of his customers. In other words, he could buy everything in time to finish his harvest as planned and sell all of his products.

Business development:

His stable has allowed him to own land in order to grow rice for the most part. 20 years of experience attest the quality and quantity of his products.

Personal information:

Angel is 43 years old, single and has no children. His home is made of reed and wood. One of his aspirations is to buy more land in order to produce more.

Use of the second loan:

With this new loan, Angel will buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies. He will also rent machines and hire labour in order to profit from the winter season and to save irrigation. The advantage of this business is that it is situated in the highlands of this coastal region.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Inversión de Primer Préstamo:

Herleen pudo comprar todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para atender la demanda de sus clientes. Es decir que compro todo a tiempo, terminando su cosecha como el esperaba y comercializando todo su producto.

Desarrollo de Negocio:

Las 2 hectáreas que posee, le han permitido tener terreno suficiente para cultivar no solo arroz sino productos afines como por ejemplo el maíz. Casi 10 años de experiencia avalan la calidad y cantidad de sus productos.

Información Personal :

Herleen tiene 25 años. Es Soltero. No tiene hijos. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta caña y madera. Una de sus aspiraciones es ayudar a su familia a mejorar la calidad de vida.

Uso de Segundo Préstamo:

Con este nuevo préstamo comprara abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, equipo menor, alquiler de maquinarias, contratación de mano de obra, y otros insumos necesarios para aprovechar la época invernal, y ahorrar el riego. La ventaja del sector es que esta en la parte alta de este sector costero.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=11688

loans.use: To buy necessary supplies to cultivate a winter crop.

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Investment of First Loan:

Willy could buy all the necessary agricultural supplies to attend to the demand of his clients. That is to say he was able to buy everything in time, harvesting his crop as expected and marketing all his product.

Development of Business:

The 7 blocks that he possesses have permitted him to have sufficient land to cultivate not only rice but also related products, such as corn. Ten years of experience vouch for the quality and quantity of his products.

Personal information:

Willy is 20 years old. He is Single. He does not have children. His dwelling is of mixed construction; cane and wood. One of his aspirations is to buy more hectares of land to have more production and to market in other places.

Use of Second Loan:

With this new loan he will buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to take advantage of the winter season and to save irrigation. The advantage of his location is that it is in the high part of this coastal sector.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=12649

Graciela could buy all the necessary agricultural supplies to attend to the demands of her clients. That is to say that she could buy everything in time, harvesting her crop as expected and marketing all her product.

The 5 blocks that she possesses have permitted her to have sufficient land to cultivate not only rice but also related products such as corn. Five years of experience vouch for the quality and quantity of her products.

Graciela is 21 years old. She is a single woman. She has 1 son, that still is small and does not go to school. Her dwelling is of mixed construction; cane and wood. One of her aspirations is to improve the quality of life of her son and to improve her house.

Use of Second Loan:

With this new loan she will buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment, rent machinery and contract labor to take advantage of the winter season and to save irrigation. The advantage of her location is that it is in the high part of this coastal sector.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment, rent machinery and contract labor to cultivate a winter crop on her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to continue successfully cultivating her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to continue working her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To continue investing in her salon and add a line of cosmetics in order to better server her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To continue investing in merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for his store and to add new items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand one of the classrooms in her school

loans.name: Sam Vai I Village Bank Group

texts.en:
There are 38 people in Chheur Teal I Village Bank in Kandal province. Mr. S. V. is the Village Bank President. He is a house constructor and farmer in the local village. In his plantation, Mr. S. V. does not have enough money to purchase more fertilizers and fuel for his pump in order to make his crop more productive. So he now H. decided to apply for a loan for this purpose.

Mr. S. V. is 46 and the father of eight childR., two of wH. are construction workers while another three are enrolled in school. One another helps mother on the field and the two remaining are too yO. to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Soklon K., is a subsistence farmer. Previously, Mr. S. V. had obtained a loan from Amret Co., Ltd to bU. fertilizer and hire a laborer to plow on his field. In the last three months, Mr. S. V.’s child got tuberculosis and he had to be sent to hospital. Mr. S. V. spent $150 for his treatment.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and fuel to run a pump in order to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Proeng

texts.en:
Proeng C. is a 28-year-old farmer who earns around $2 per day farming and selling rice in her village. Her husband makes about $3 per day grinding rice for his customers and selling ground rice. They have no children and live in Kork Morn Village, Siem Reap Province.

With growing family expenses, they need to improve their income by expanding their business. C. is seeking a loan of $400 to purchase more rice to grind and sell. This loan will help her to expand their business and earm more income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more rice

loans.name: Suryanah

texts.id:
Suryanah is one of Yamida's clients who lives in Bogor, West Java. This 31-year-old woman is married and have 2 children. She has been a tailor for 10 years, but because of her limited capital, Suryanah is having a hard time to expand her business. With her experience and her existing record of earning $8 daily, Suryanah is requesting a loan of $125 from Kiva to buy fabrics and threads.

Translated by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Suryanah adalah salah satu client Yamida yang tinggal di daerah Bogor, Jawa Barat. Wanita berumur 31 Tahun ini telah menikah dan memiliki 2 orang anak. Selama 10 Tahun menjadi Penjahit, akan tetapi dengan modal yang sangat kecil Suryanah kesulitan mengembangkan usahanya, maka dengan pengalaman dan pendapatan 8 dollar perhari suryati mengharapkan pinjaman melalui Kiva sebesar 125 dollar ,Untuk membeli Bahan-bahan kain dan benang.

loans.use: To buy fabrics ($100) and threads ($25)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Yamida (Yayasan Mitra Dhuafa) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Khean

texts.en:
Khean T. is 19 years old and lives in Khneas Village, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. T. makes about $0.60 per day farming, making wine, and designing small bamboo baskets. Her husband, Mr. Meach Mao, makes about $1 per day farming and charging customers to use his CD player. They have three children, all of whom are young so that they cannot earn income for the family.

To increase her income, she needs to expand her business. T. is seeking a loan of $300 to purchase small pigs to breed. This loan will help her to improve her income and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs to breed

loans.name: Preak Tanop Ii Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheourn P. is the Village Bank President of Preak Tanop II which consists of 27 members in Kandal Province. She is a Khmer cake maker in the local village and is now requesting a loan to buy pigs in order to stA. a pig breeding business. The rest of the money she will use to build a piggery in the back yard. 

Mrs. Pheourn P. is 48 and the mother of two children, one of whom is a Khmer cake vendor in the village while the other is attending school. Her husband, Mr. Suon C., is currently unemployed, but will operate the new business. Last year, he suffered from lung disease on which he spent $500 for treatment. Unfortunately, Mr. Suon C. is ill again, so the family faces additional expenses for medical care.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for breeding and to build a piggery in the back yard.

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth P. has a machine that grinds rice. He earns about $6 per day working from his house. His wife, Mrs. Lot Vay, earns about $3 per day making wine and selling ground rice. They have two children, all of whom are young, and live in Phkar Rumchek Village in the Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia.

To increase their income and make it easier to operate their business, they are seeking a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike to use for business. With the remainder of the loan, they will buy rice to grind and sell. This loan will help to expand their business and improve their family income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and rice

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
Art figures are made from bronze, stome or wood. This business needs persistent, as shown by Siti B.. Siti has been in this Art Figure sales for 4 years, and she is grateful that until now her business is still there. The consumers who buy Siti's art figures are from Jakarta, and almost every month order art figures in large quantities. Because of good quality some were even exported. Siti likes to increase her business capaital. She hopes this loan could be used to add business capital. The obtained profit from her sales is enough to meet household needs, together with husband Adol Kadir who is in sales profession too.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Patung arca identik dengan perunggu, batu dan kayu. Usaha ini perlu ketekunan seperti yang dilakukan oleh Siti B.. Sudah 4 tahun Siti menekuni usaha jual arca dan Siti sangat bersyukur karena sampai saat ini usahanya masih bertahan. Konsumen yang biasanya mengambil arca Siti berasal dari Jakarta dan hampir tiap bulan memesan arca dalam jumlah yang besar. Karena kualitasnya bagus, biasanya arca ini bahkan ada yang di ekspor. Karena usaha ini dirasa memiliki prospek, Siti sangat ingin menambah modal usaha. Diharapkan, dari pinjaman kali ini bisa dijadikan tambahan modal usaha. Keuntungan yang didapat dari hasil usahanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya bersama suaminya Adol Kadir yang berprofesi sebagai pedagang.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Ratna

texts.id:
Art Figure sales business of Ratna W. and husband is until now expanding quite well, since its stategic location at Teuku Umar barat streer, which is close to famous tourist locations of Legian and Kuta. The customers are not only local tourists, but also foreign tourists, even many become permanent customers. The profit obtained are used to pay for house rent, and household expenses. Ratna W. expects that with this loan her business could further expand.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha jual arca yang ditekuni Ratna W. bersama suaminya hingga saat ini cukup berkembang, dikarenakan letaknya yang strategis yakni berada di Jl.Teuku Umar barat, yang berdekatan dengan lokasi pariwisata terkenal Legian dan Kuta. Para pembelinya bukan saja para wisatawan lokal, tetapi juga dari mancanegara bahkan ada yang sudah menjadi langganan tetap. Keuntungan yang didapat dipergunakan sebagai biaya membayar rumah kontrakan, dan juga untuk kebutuhan rumah tangga tentunya. Ratna W. berharap dari pinjaman kali ini, usaha yang ditekuninya bisa lebih berkembang.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
Siti Y. is a 39 year old lady who is in the food stall business for almost 10 years. The items she offered, include drinks, indonesia fruit salad and vegetables with boiled leave covered rice. Her daily activities started by going to the market at 7:00 AM to buy ingredients for her food stall, like: vegetables, tofu, peanuts, etc at the Adat Market in Pamungan village. After all food items to be sold are finished, Siti Y. opens her food stall at about 9:00 AM. Usually busy time are between 9:30-11:00 AM, where her food stall is filled with good ladies customers from mothers and young ladies who like to taste the indonesian salad, and other customers who like to taste the vegetables with boiled leave covered rice. From this business Siti Y. could save part of her profits for additional capital. She likes to enlarge her food stall, therefore needs additional business capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Siti Y. adalah seorang wanita berusia 39 tahun yang menekuni usaha warung makan selama hampir 10 tahun. Adapun makanan yang dijualnya seperti minuman, rujak buah dan lontong sayur. Kegiatannya sehari-hari adalah dimulai dengan pergi ke pasar pada pukul 07.00 untuk membeli bahan-bahan untuk keperluan warungnya seperti sayur, tahu, kacang dan keperluan lainnya di Pasar Adat Desa Pamungan. Setelah semua makanan yang akan dijual telah siap, Siti Y. baru membuka warungnya pada pukul 09.00. Biasanya antara pukul 09.30 sampai pukul 11.00 merupakan jam sibuk, dimana warungnya dipenuhi pelanggan baik dari kalangan ibu-ibu dan remaja putri yang ingin menikmati rujak, dan pelanggan lain yang ingin menikmati lontong sayur. Dari usahanya ini, Siti Y. bisa menyisihkan dari sebagian keuntungannya untuk dijadikan modal lagi. Dia berkeinginan untuk membuat warungnya lebih besar lagi, karena itu ia memerlukan modal tambahan.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Manambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Nazar Hussin

texts.en: Nazar Hussin lives in district 10 of Kabul Afghanistan. He is married and has 2 sons. He is new in the retail business, and he has little shop. He is requesting a loan to enlarge his shop, which will enable him to help more customers. His loan will complete his lease materials. He is happy to receive this loan, and he would like to thank the lenders.

loans.use: To complete his lease materials

loans.name: Hama

texts.en: Hama lives in district 10 of Kabul Afghanistan. She is married and has a son and a daughter. She has a beauty salon, and has good experience in her business. She is requesting a loan of $625 for the term of 12 months to change the designs of her beauty salon and attract more clients. This will help her make a good monthly income to help her family..

loans.use: To change the designs of her beauty salon

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun K. is 57-year-old and her husband, Mr. Leng Sam Ay, is 47 years old. They both sell groceries and make about $2 per day. They live with their four children in Sneng Krabei Village, Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. Two of their four children are in school and two others work by shoveling sand for a private entrepreneur.

With growing family expenses, K. needs to expand her business to earn more income. She is seeking a loan of $250 to purchase more groceries for her business. This loan can help her to expand her business and improve her income so that she can pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Abdul Latif

texts.en: Abdul Latif lives with his own family in district 5 of Kabul Afghanistan. He has a general store which he started in Kabul one year ago. Before that he was involved in this business in Pakistan. His experience in this business is good, and he would like to expand in Kabul. He is requesting a loan to complete his lease purchase to expand his store and be able to handle more clients.

loans.use: To complete his lease purchase

loans.name: Lucrécia Paulo

texts.pt:
Lucrecia Paulo N. was born in Inhambane. She is single, 46 years old, has 4 sons, and finished the 6th grade. She grew up with her parents and siblings, went to school, and in her free time helped with household chores. She also had the privilege of learning to be a seamstress from her aunt, which enabled her to make clothing articles to order as way of helping her family. In the 1980s Lucrecia married and moved to the neighborhood of Benfica in Maputo. Years later she and her husband separated, and she and two of her sons moved to the 25 de Junho neighborhood.

In 1992, Lucrecia took on work as a seamstress in a boutique. In 2001 she moved to Khongolote to a lot loaned by her brother, where for the last seven years she has run a shop selling a range of products. The shop opens at 8:00 a.m. and closes at 9:30 p.m. Products are purchased in Maputo, and Lucrecia rents a car to transport the goods.

Lucrecia learned about Hluvuku through a client at her shop. With her loan of 16,000 MT she intends to purchase rice, sugar, wheat flour, corn flour, oil, drinks, and soft drinks. She currently employs one worker who helps in her absence and on busy days. The most productive periods are the summer months, the weekends, and the ends of the months. Her daily revenue is 1,500 MT, and the products that generate the most profit are drinks and soft drinks. Lucrecia keeps a record book of products coming in and going out, as well as existing stock. The monthly profit margin is 6,000 MT, which she uses to support her family, build her house, and increase business.

Lucrecia is very happy with her loan because it helped her increase her business and improve the appearance of her shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucrécia Paulo N., solteira maior de 46 anos de idade, nasceu na Cidade de Inhambane tem 4 filhos todos rapazes, estudou até 6ªclasse.

Viveu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais e irmãos, estudava e nos tempos livres ajudava nos trabalhos domésticos e também teve previlégio de aprender corte e custura com a tia e isto permitiu que ela fizesse artigos por encomendas para venda como forma de ajuda á família.

Na década 80 casa-se e passa a viver na cidade de Maputo no bairro Benfica e anos mais tarde separa-se do marido e dois filhos passam a residir no bairro 25 de Junho, começa a trabalhar como custureira numa Boutique na Cidade isto no ano 1992 e trabalhou durante 3 anos.

Em 2001 transfere-se e reside em Khongolote no terreno cedido pelo irmão onde tem o estabelecimento comercial onde vende uma gama diversificada de produtos e faz este trabalho a sensivelmente 7 anos.

Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku através dum cliente de seu estabelecimento e abre-o as 8:00horas e encerra as 21:30mn e compra os produtos em Maputo e aluga carro para transportá-los.

Com o presente crédito de 16.000MT pretende comprar Arroz, açúcar, farrinha de trigo e milho, óleo, bebidas e refrigerantes.

Emprega actualmente 1 trabalhadora que lhe auxilia na sua ausência e quando há muita clientela.

A época mais produtiva é a de Verão e aos fins de semana e final do més pois a procura é maior a receita diária é 1.500MT, os produtos que dão maior lucro são bebidas, refrigerantes.Tem livro de registo de entradas e saídas de produtos bem como do stock existente.

A margem de lucro mensal é de 6.000MT e com os rendimentos sustenta a família, construir sua residência e aumentar volume de negócio.

A cliente está bastante feliz com empréstimo pois ajudou a aumentar volume do negócio e melhorar as condições da mercearia como forma de dar um aspecto diferente aos clientes.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her shop

loans.name: Gonçalo Dos Santos

texts.pt:
Gonçalo dos Santos N., 51 years old, was born in Catembe-Maputo, is married, supports eight people, and has a degree in Theology.

He was born and raised with his mother. He explains that he never knew his father, and that's why he had to enter an orphanage when he was five years old. He entered the Father Alves Martins Children's Home orphanage in Infulene in 1962. He studied, and in his free time he raised livestock, did sports, and finished fourth grade in 1969.

In 1971 he went to study at Alvor School, in the teachers training school, and finished his studies in 1975. He had to intern in the liberated zones of Cabo Delgado, and years later in the Salamanga School, from 1976 to 1977.

He recounts how he worked in various schools and in 2000 had the opportunity to attend the Instituto Magisterio Primario of Maputo and in the following year finished without trouble. Likewise, from 2003 to 2006 he attended the Instituto Superior Mother Africa, where he acquired a degree in theology.

Currently he works in the primary school Saul Filipe Tembe as a teacher, and lives in his own house.

He has been a client of Hluvuku since 2006, having been disbursed his first credit in the amount of 12000 meticais for the purchase of construction materials, which he repaid without trouble. With a loan of 20000 meticais, he plans to buy cement, iron bars, stone, and fine and coarse sand. The space where he will erect his house he acquired through a contract. He buys the construction materials at a local metalworks, and he has rented trucks for the transport of materials.

The progress on the project is reasonable, and the constraint that he faces is the masons, who don't work on the project every day.

The loan substantially improved his life. In the future, the goal is to start raising small livestock.

Translated by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Gonçalo dos Santos N., de 51 anos de idade, nasceu na Catembe-Maputo, casado maritalmente, sustenta 8 pessoas e é licenciado em Teologia.

Nasceu e cresceu com a mãe pois relata que nunca conhecera seu pai, assim foi obrigado a viver aos 5 anos de idade no orfanato lar da ciança Padre Alves Martins no Infulene em 1962, estudava e nos tempos livres practicava agro-pecuária, desporto e concluiu a 4ª classe em 1969.

Em 1971 foi estudar no Liceu Alvor- Escola de habilitação de Professores do Posto Escolar e concluiu o curso em 1975 e teve que estagiar nas zonas libertadas de Cabo Delgado e anos mais tarde foi afecto no Centro Escolar de Salamanga em 1976-1977.

Ralata que trabalhou em várias escolas e em 2000 teve a oportunidade de frequentar o Instituto do Magistério Primário de Maputo e no ano seguinte concluiu sem sobressaltos, assim em 2003-2006 frequenta o Instituto Superior Maria Mãe África onde fez a licenciatura em Teologia.

Presentemente trabalha na Escola Primária Completa Saúl Filipe Tembe como Docente e reside em casa própria.

É cliente da Hluvuku desde 2006, tendo desembolsado o primeiro crédio no valor de 12.000 para compra de materiais de construcão o qual concluiu sem nenhuns sobresaltos. Com o crédito de 20.000,00MT pretende comprar cimento, varrões de ferro, pedra ¾, areia fina e grossa. O espaço no qual está a erguer sua casa e conseguiu-o por trespasse e o materiais de construção compra-os nas ferragens locais e tem alugado viaturas para o seu transporte.

O nível das obras tá razoável e o constragimento que enfrenta é dos pedreiros que não se fazem á obra todos dias e o crédito melhorou substancialmente sua vida. No futuro o alvo é iniciar a criação de animais de pequeno porte.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family's house

loans.name: Isménia

texts.pt:
Isménia S. is 44 years old and married. She was born in Maputo, has 5 sons, and attended school until the 6th grade. She lived with her mother until she was 19. In 1980 she got married and moved to Malhampsene.

In 1994 she began a business of selling shoes which she acquired in Swaziland and in the RSA. She made her sales on foot in the city of Maputo. After some time the business wasn't yielding as well as when she first started so she decided to switch to selling staple products in 2004. Currently she has 2 small commercial establishments.

She came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of Hluvuku. She solicited a loan for 22,000MT to grow her business acquiring more products and soft drinks.

Isménia opens her business at 7:00am and closes at 7:00pm. She purchases her products from warehouses in Maputo and uses rental vehicles to transport her and her goods back home. Currently she employs one worker, a father of 2, who cares for the second stand.

The most productive times for her business are weekends, end of the month, and the summer when the average daily receipts varies from 900MT to 1,200MT. Her most lucrative products are the soft drinks and alcoholic beverages. She uses a book register to control her inventory and sales receipts.

Her monthly profit margin is 9,000MT, and with this income she can pay off her loan, the salary for her worker, school expenses for her children, replenish her stock, and transport her goods. The other expenses, especially household expenses, are covered by her husband.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Isménia S., de 44 anos de idade, nasceu em Maputo tem 5 filhos rapazes, estudou até 6ªclasse. Viveu com a mãe até aos 19 anos e em 1980 junta –se maritalmente e passou a viver em Malhampsene Até então. Em 1994 inicia o negócio de venda de sapatos os quais adquiria na Swazilandia e na RSA . A venda era feita de uma forma ambulatória na cidade de Maputo , passado algum tempo, o negócio já não rendia tão bem como começou, dai que decidiu mudar de negócio passando a vender produtos da primeira necessidade, tendo a contecido este facto no ano 2004, conta actualmente com dois pequenos estabelecimentos comerciais. Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku através duma amiga sua que é cliente da Hluvuku, tendo desta forma aproximado e solicitado um empréstimo no valor de 22.000,00mt para a ampliação do seu negocio aquirindo mais produtos da primeira necessidade e refrigerantes. Isménia S. abre o seu negócio as 7.00h e fecha as 19.00h, os produtos que vende adquire- os nos armazéns da cidade capital-Maputo e para transportar usa viaturas alugada que lhe levam até ao destino. Emprega actualmente um trabalhador pai de dois filhos para cuidar da segunda barraca. A época mais produtivao seu negócio é no fins de semana, fim do mês e no verão onde a receita média diaria varia de 900,00mt a 1.200,00mt sendo os produtos que dau mais lucros os refregerantes e bebidas alcólicas . para controlar o fluxo da mercadoria e o registo das vendas usa um livro de registo.. A margem de lucro mensal é de 9.000,00mt e com este rendimento paga o empréstimo, o salário do empregado, as despesas escolares dos filhos e o reabstecimento e o transporte de mercadorias sendo que as outras desepesas, sobretudo as domésticas são suportadas pelo marido.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her business

loans.name: Tho

texts.en:
Mrs. Tho C. is a 36-year-old widow who makes around $6 per day selling chickens and scanning photographs. She has one daugter who is attending school and they live in Slaket Village, Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia.

C. is seeking a loan of $200 to purchase more chicken to sell. This loan will help her to expand her business, support her family, and pay for her daughter's school expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken stocks for selling

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is a 32-year-old entrepreneur and mother of two daughters, who are 5 and 16 years old, respectively. Three years ago, Claudia started her own business where she cooks fried dishes. Claudia produces her goods at home, and she then sells her goods in the public place because she does not own a separate establishment from which to operate the business.

The entrepreneur plans on using her loan to buy more materials in order to produce more specialty fried dishes and to thereby increase her income. Claudia hopes that, someday, she will have enough money to buy a small house where she and her family can live comfortably.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials in order to continue to produce fried dishes.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Fior Daliza

texts.en:
Fior Daliza started down the path as an entrepreneur ten years ago, when she began selling clothing in the Don Gregorio community of San Cristobal. Currently, Fior Daliza has amassed a healthy clientele, which keeps growing and growing. Fior is a well-educated woman, and she is studying French and English at the public university of Santo Domingo, the capital. In her opinion, she believes that a good education is the only thing that can help her rise up out from poverty and improve her living conditions.

Fior Daliza has already taken out four loans from our organizations, and she has used them wisely. With this fifth loan, the entrepreneur would like to buy clothing in bulk in order to replenish her stock and to increase her sales volume. Fior Daliza plans on buying a house within a couple of months.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing in bulk to add to her business' stock of clothes.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Perseverancia Group

texts.es:
The Perseverancia Microfinance Institute is a bank that is just starting out with 20 members.

The members partake in different businesses, such as food, firewood, grains, clothing, provisions, small animals, maize beverages, flowers, and bread.

The members need varying loan amounts, from 300 to 600 Peruvian Soles, totaling 9,000 soles in loans from this bank.

They will invest the loan money in the purchase of pants, polo shirts, blouses, wheat, barley, pigs, firewood, rice, sugar, cooking oil, fruits, and vegetables.

The members’ dreams are for their businesses to grow, their children to become professionals, and have their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Perseverancia es un banco que recién inicia con 20 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comida, leña, cereales, ropa, abarrotes, animales Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. pantalones, polos, blusas, trigo, cebada, cerdo, leña, arroz, azúcar, aceite, verduras y frutas. menores, chicha, F. y panes.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 9,000 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. pantalones, polos, blusas, trigo, cebada, cerdo, leña, arroz, azúcar, aceite, verduras y frutas.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus negocios sean grandes, sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase of pants, polo shirts, blouses, wheat, barley, pigs, firewood, rice, sugar, cooking oil, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Sagrado Corazón De Jesús Group

texts.en:
“Sagrado Corazón de Jesús” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari project, which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and is a very challenging place in which to live because it is a very mountainous area (altitude ranges from 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level), it is very cold, it is a difficult place to grow crops, and the area lacks an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems. BCR “Sagrado Corazón de Jesús" is located approximately 3,500 meters above sea level in the community of Puca Cruz, the district of Rosario, and the province of Acobamba.

The main activities of the people in the region are related to agriculture. For instance, many people grow potatoes and a variety of cereals, and most people raise small cattle, cows, and bulls. The small town of Puca Cruz, which is on the main road from Huancayo and Paucará to the province’s capital of Acobamba, has some shops but because it is a central location on the main road to Huancayo, it has many major sellers of potatoes and cereals.

Currently, the bank is starting its first loan cycle with 16 female borrowers and a total loan of 8,300 soles (approximately $2,950). The individual loans range from 200, 400, 600, and in one case up to 1,200 soles. As the group is just starting its first cycle, the group was not able to save money except for the initial loan to start their operations, but all of the group members agree to save in the future. The members of the new village bank have various hopes and dreams in connection with the requested loans, ranging from their desire to be trained in marketing (e.g., how to improve their businesses with better marking) and in being responsible from a financial standpoint.

One of the members of the community bank is Ideana C. M.. Ideana has the biggest loan with the bank. Because she left another village bank to be in the new one in her own village she does not have to travel anymore to assist fellow borrowers, thereby making it a lot easier to assist such individuals. And, because she is an “ancient” client who exhibited her financial responsibility with her excellent credit history during her first loan cycle, she is able to receive a loan of 1,200 soles. Together with her husband she runs a business where they buy and sell cereals; in addition, she and her husband operate a small gas station. Ideana would like to use the requested loan proceeds to buy more gasoline. Although she has already been with FINCA Peru for one cycle, she is still eager to learn more and to continue to save money for the future.

Another group member is Bertha P. T., who sells vegetables and fruits in her shop in town. With her 600 soles loan she is hoping to buy more products for her shop. Bertha hopes that her experience with FINCA Peru will teach her to save more money and to be more financially responsible in order to pay back her loan.

By way of further example, another group member is Sihela Herminia D. J.. Sihela is also seeking a 600 soles loan which she will use to make special stiches for traditional clothes, especially dresses for the women of her community. And, as was the case with Bertha, Sihela would like to learn to save more money and to be more financially responsible.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for the group members' various businesses

loans.name: Villa Pachamarca Group

texts.en:
“Villa Pachamarca” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari project, which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and is a challenging place in which to live because it is a very mountainous area (the altituD. ranges from 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level), it is very cold, it is a difficult place to grow crops, and the area lacks an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems. BCR “Villa Pachamarca” is located approximately 2,500 meters above sea-level in the community of Pachamarca and the province of Churcampa. The small town of Pachamarca is at the end of a road that winds through the mountains, but the road is not continuous and, as a result, transportation is very limited.

The main activities of the people in the region are related to agriculture. The valley of Pachamarca has an excellent climate for agricultural purposes because of the relatively low altituD. and the availability of water throughout the year. In fact, the climate makes it possible to grow a great variety of fruits and vegetables such as corn, beans, tara, avocado, pacay, lucuma, banana, cherries, oranges, cucumber, carrots, and lettuce. In addition to cultivating all of the aforementioned foods, most people dedicate a good portion of their time to raising small animals such as guinea-pigs, chickens, ducks, and rabbits, as well as bigger animals such as cows and bulls.

Currently, the bank is starting its first loan cycle with 12 female borrowers and a total loan of 5,900 soles (approximately $2,100). The individual loans range from 200, 500, and up to 600 soles. As the group is just starting its first cycle, the group was not able to save money except for the initial loan to start their operations, but all of the group members agree to save in the future. The members of the new village bank have various hopes and dreams by virtue of the requested loans, ranging from their desire to be trained in marketing (e.g., how to improve their business with better marketing) and to receive technical assistance in raising small animals like guinea-pigs, rabbits, and chickens (e.g., how to avoid diseases).

One of the members of the community bank is Marcelina L. P.. Marcelina is seeking a loan of 600 soles and she has been elected the “president” of the new village bank. She runs a small restaurant where she also sells clothes and soft drinks. With the proceeds from her loan she will increase her merchandise by purchasing more clothes, soft drinks, and meat. Moreover, she raises guinea-pigs. Marcelina´s dream for the future is to utilize her farm for raising guinea-pigs and rabbits, to have a bigger (and better) restaurant, and to make improvements to her house. Further, due to her involvement with FINCA Peru, she would like to learn and to continue saving so that she can improve her business.

By way of further example, another group member is Paulina S. B., who has her own shop in town; in reality, Paulina's shop is more of a mini-market where she sells almost everything: tools for the kitchen and for cooking, all kinds of groceries, and shoes (her husband has a shoe-repair shop!). With the proceeds from the 600 soles loan she is seeking she would like to buy more goods for her shop. Much like Marcelina, Paulina hopes that her experience with FINCA Peru will teach her to save more money and to be more financially responsible in order to pay back her loan. The loan she is seeking will be used to pay for her children's education because her dream is to see to it that her children become professionals!

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for the group members' various businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 47777

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana is a very hardworking woman. She opened an internet café within her house with which she not only provides a very important service to her community, but also helps support her family (made up by her husband and their two children). It has been three years since the business started, and the computers require maintenance so that Viviana is able to provide a better service to her clients and that way have satisfied customers. With this objective in mind she is requesting a loan that will allow her to achieve her objective.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Viviana es una dama muy trabajadora. Con diligencia y empeño viene sacando adelante su negocio y con ella a su querida familia que la integran su esposo y sus 2 hijos y ha logrado adecuar un pequeño espacio de su vivienda para abrir un espacio de internet y prestar este importante e indispensable servicio a su comunidad.Actualmente y a 3 años del funcionamiento de su negocio sus computadoras necesitan mantenimiento para brindarles una buena y rápida atención a sus clientes y así estos queden satisfechos por los servicios.Con ese objetivo se presenta ante vosotros para solicitarles un préstamo que le permitirá concretar sus planes.within

loans.use: To obtain working capital in order to provide appropriate maintenance to the computers.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is a woman who’s very happy and dedicated. Ever since she set up household with her dear husband Máximo, she has undertaken innumerable activities with the idea of bettering her economic situation. Several years ago she decided to buy herself a sandwich cart and offer salchipapa (a typical dish comprised of French fries and fried wiener sausage) and salchipollo (a typical chicken dish) to everyone with the desire to eat these delicious dishes. Currently her business is in a strategic location in her hometown of Juliaca, and because of that she sells around 90 to 100 meals daily.

Francisca’s wish is to increase the size of her stand so it is more comfortable for her clients, to offer a larger quantity of her delicious fast food and, with the benefits she receives, to improve quality of life for her and her four children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca es una dama muy alegre y dedicada, desde que formó su hogar en compañía de su querido esposo Máximo se dedicó a innumerables actividades con el fin de mejorar su situación económica, hace ya varios años decidió comprarse su carrito sanguchero y ofrecer salchipapas y salchipollos a todos los que desean consumir estos deliciosos platillos.Actualmente su negocio esta en un lugar estratégico de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, es por ello que diariamente vende alrededor de 90 a 100 platos. El deseo de Doña Francisca es ampliar su puestito de venta para mayor comodidad de sus clientes y ofrecer en mayor cantidad sus deliciosos potajes al paso y con los beneficios que obtenga mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus 4 hijos.

loans.use: Injection of business capital to make improvements to a food stand

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes is a woman devoted to her family. When she married her faithful and enterprising husband Guillermo, they decided to open a workshop to make metal furniture. Thanks to the valuable knowledge ingrained in her children, they now make the perfect team to do this beautiful work. Their workshop has now been open for 10 years and during that time has stood out for the refined and innovative models of furniture they produce as they try to accommodate each one of their client’s requests.

At this time, seeing the strategic location of their home, she decided to foray into another business and opened a cellular telephone store. With these two businesses, she is striving to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Translator.

María Mercedes, es una dama consagrada a su familia, desde que contrajo matrimonio con su fiel y emprendedor esposo, Guillermo, decidieron abrir un taller de muebles de metal, gracias a los valiosos conocimientos que inculcaron en sus hijos ahora hacen el equipo perfecto para realizar este hermoso trabajo.Su taller ya tiene 10 años de funcionamiento, durante ese tiempo siempre se destacaron por los finos y novedosos modelos de muebles que realizan, así tratando de complacer cada uno de las solicitudes de sus clientes.En esta oportunidad viendo el lugar estratégico de la ubicación de su domicilio decidió incursionar en otra labor, y aperturó una tienda de venta de celulares. Con estos 2 oficios trata de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Increase capital to finance new cellular phone business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena works as a seamstress, sewing things like bedspreads, cushions, and shawls, according to the season. Her home is located in the Alto Pasankeri zone of the Ladera Oeste of the city of La Paz. She is single and lives with her parents. She pays for food, her education, and other living expenses with the wages earned from her job because she is independent. This is the second time she requests a loan from Impro. She will use this loan for the purchase of materials (fabric, lining, pellon fabric, thread). Her work and the desire to excel allow her to request this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena trabaja como costurera y realiza costura de edredones, almohadones, y mantillas, de acuerdo a temporada. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto Pasankeri de la Ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.Es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres y los gastos de alimentación, educación y otros los cubre con su trabajo ya que es independiente. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, Forro, Pellon, Hilo) Su trabajo y las ganas de superación le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, lining, thread, etc. for sewing workshop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: San Andresanas 1 Group

texts.es:
The San Andresanas women come from a small, friendly town called San Andres Semetabaj located on the shores of Lake Atitlán.

The San Andresanas are going to use the money they borrow in different ways. Nine of the women are going to purchase thread to make traditional woven items. Another four women are going to buy thread to make beautiful embroideries. One is going to invest in a small hair salon. Another woman is going to invest in cosmetics that are sold through catalogs. Meanwhile, two others are going to use their money to purchase American clothing to resell.

This group of women believes that their businesses are doing well and it’s for that reason that they want to continue to invest in them. They are confident that with the money they receive, their businesses will grow and they will have the ability to repay the debt without any problems.

Within this group there are three women who are very enterprising because they have two businesses. Two of them work principally making and selling woven goods and in addition to that have a small store that helps with their families’ income. Similarly, one of the women has a hair salon. She currently has a person that helps her with the salon. The fact that a micro business has an employee is an indication that the business is doing well.

The women believe that ever sense they signed up with Friendship Bridge and received their first loan, their family finances have changed. Now they can help with family expenses because they can buy supplies and school uniforms when their children need them. Besides that, they can buy food with their money when they think it is necessary.

The San Andresanas are happy to work together in a communal bank because they can share. The dream of many of the women is that of having a successful business because that way they can leave an inheritance to their children. We must lend a hand to this group of extraordinary women so they can achieve this dream that’s so pure.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Las mujeres San Andresanas provienen D. un pequeño y acogedor pueblo llamado San Andres Semetabaj, que está ubicado a las orillas del lago D. Atitlán.

Las San Andresanas van a utilizar su crédito D. manera distintas. Nueve mujeres van a invertir su crédito en la compra D. hilo para elaborar tejidos tradicionales. Otras cuatro mujeres van a invertir el crédito en comprar hilo para elaborar bellos bordados. Una va a invertir en su pequeña peluquería. Una van a invertir en cosméticos que venden por medio D. los catálogos. Mientras que otras dos van a invertir su crédito en la compra D. ropa americana para su reventa.

Este grupo D. señoras creen que les va bien en sus negocios, es por eso que ellas quieren seguir invertir en ellos. Ellas tienen confianza que con el crédito que van a recibir su negocio va a crecer y van a tener la capacidad D. repagar la deuda sin ningún problema. Dentro D. este grupo hay tres señoras que son muy emprendedoras ya que ellas tienen dos negocios. Las dos elaboran y venden tejidos principalmente y encima D. ese negocio tienen una pequeña tienda que les ayuda con el ingreso D. la familia. Asimismo, una señora tiene una peluquería. Actualmente ella cuenta con una persona que la ayuda en la peluquería. El hecho que una microempresaria tenga una empleada es un indicio D. que su negocio le va bien.

Las mujeres creen que desD. que se enrolaron con Friendship Bridge y recibieron su primer crédito las finanzas D. la familia han cambiado. Ahora ellas pueden ayudar en los gastos D. la familia, ya que ellas pueden comprar los materiales y uniformes D. colegio a sus hijos cuando ellos lo necesitan. Además, pueden comprar alimentos con su dinero cuando ellas piensen que es necesario.

Las San Andresanas se sienten contentas D. trabajar juntas en un banco comunal porque pueden compartir. El sueño D. mucha D. las mujeres es el D. tener un negocio exitoso para que así ellas puedan dejarle una herencia a sus hijos. Hay que darles una mano a este grupo D. extraordinarias mujeres para que así ellas puedan lograr este sueño tan puro.

loans.use: Purchase thread to make traditional woven items and embroideries, cosmetics, American clothing for resale and products for a hair salon

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Friendship Bridge - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina lives on Pasco Street in the Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto. She is divorced and lives with her 16-year-old son. She sells rice, noodles, cooking oil, and other goods for a living, allowing her to receive daily income.

The loan being requested will be used to repair the front part of her house and to build a small general store, where she will sell her products with more comfort.

This is the client’s first loan with Impro. Her credit evaluation qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelina vive en la Calle Pasco D. la zona D. Rio Seco ubicada en la ciudad D. El Alto. Ella es divorciada y vive junto a su hijo D. 16 años. Se dedica a la comercialización D. arroz, fideo, aceite y otros al por menor, por lo cual recibe ingresos diariamente.

El crédito requerido será destinado para la refacción D. la parte frontal D. su casa y la construcción D. una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en donD. expenderá con mayor comodidad sus productos.

Es el primer crédito que Impro le otorga a esta clienta, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Remodelling and construction

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luís lives on Ricardo Bustamante Street in the Alto Chijini zone of the city of La Paz. The home belongs to his in-laws, but he lives there along with his wife and 3-year-old son.

Jose Luís owns a small printing shop where he creates all types of invitations and wedding announcements, which are sold in shop that he rents in downtown La Paz.

He will purchase cards and other supplies for his printing business with this loan, his second with Impro. His good credit history qualifies him for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Jose Luís vive en la Calle Ricardo Bustamante de la zona de Alto Chijini ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. El domicilio pertenece a sus suegros, además, él vive con su esposa y su hijo de 3 años.

Jose Luís es dueño de una pequeña imprenta donde elabora todo tipo de invitaciones y partes matrimoniales, productos que son vendidos en una tienda que tiene alquilada en una zona céntrica de la cuidad de la Paz.

Con el monto crediticio comprará cartulinas y otros insumos para su negocio Este es su segundo crédito con Impro, sus antecedentes lo califican para otorgarle un nuevo préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase printing shop supplies

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jheny

texts.es:
Jheny lives on Arturo Valle Street in the Los Andes zone of the city of El Alto. She is a single mother who lives with her 2-year-old son.

She makes sportswear (pants) for a living, especially for children. She will use this loan in order to purchase wholesale fabric, thus allowing her to reduce her costs. This is her first loan with Impro. Her credit evaluation qualifies her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Jheny vive en la Calle Arturo Valle de la zona de Los Andes ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Es madre soltera, vive junto a su pequeño hijo de 2 años.

Se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva (pantalones), especialmente para niños. El crédito le servirá para adquirir tela al por mayor, de esa manera podrá reducir sus costos. Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase fabric

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
Arminda lives with her daughter and son-in-law on Eduardo Avaroa Avenue in the Chamoco Chico zone of the city of La Paz.

She makes bed sheets for a living, which she sells to her neighbors in the nearby markets.

She will use this loan to purchase fabric for her business. We are proud to state that this is her seventh loan with Impro. Because of her good credit history, this client qualifies for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Arminda vive junto a su hija y yerno en la Avenida Eduardo Avaroa D. la zona D. Chamoco Chico ubicada en la ciudad D. La Paz.

Su actividad comercial es la confección D. sabanas, las cuales son vendidas a sus vecinos en mercados cercanos.

El crédito será destinado para la adquisición D. telas para su negocio. Orgullosamente comunicamos que este es su séptimo crédito con Impro, debido a sus antecedentes la clienta esta calificada para obtener el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase fabric

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
The business of buying and selling Andean products became the most important and vital activity for Hilda’s family. She acquires her merchandise from the fairs in small villages near Juliaca, the city where she lives. She then distributes them wholesale to later be sold in Lima, the capital city of her country. With this business she manages to cover the costs of the most urgent needs of her family and the education of her three children. Her dear husband Wilber also actively participates in the business, and along with him she puts forth her greatest effort in order to expand and increase her family’s income day by day. Her desire is to increase the amount of capital invested in her business and they both believe that by achieving this, they will grow their revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

El negocio de compra y venta de productos andinos se convirtió en la actividad más importante e indispensable para la familia de Doña Hilda. Ella adquiere su mercadería los días de feria en los pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca, y los distribuye al por mayor para ser vendidos en la ciudad capital de su país – Lima. Con este negocio logra cubrir las necesidades más urgentes de su familia y la educación de sus 3 hijos, en este su negocio también participa activamente su querido esposo Wilber, con quien en todo momento pone su mayor esfuerzo con el fin de ampliar y aumentar día a día sus ingresos familiares. Su deseo es ampliar el monto de inversión en su negocio y ambos creen que concretando este propósito mejorará sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Injection of business capital to increase product sales

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 47787

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Since more than three years, Carmen buys and sells clothes in wholesale quantities. This mindful and responsible mother buys her merchandise in the city of Juliaca and sells it during market days in the surrounding villages.

Carmen had started to sell in small quantities because she did not have much capital. Thanks to her perseverance and dedication, she could increase the variety of her offer.

Her 3 beloved children are the main reason for her to progress. With the profits she earns, she is able to provide well-being, serenity and an education to them.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace más de 3 años doña Carmen viene dedicándose a la compra y venta de ropas al por mayor. Esta diligente y responsable madre adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Juliaca y las oferta los días de feria en los pueblitos aledaños a dicha ciudad.

Carmen, se inició vendiendo prendas de vestir en pequeñas cantidades, porque en su momento no contaba con suficiente capital, ahora con empeño y dedicación pudo ampliar y aumentar la variedad de su mercadería, con las ganancias que adquiere tiene la satisfacción de brindarles bienestar, tranquilidad y educación a sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motor que la impulsa a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Investment in order to increase the variety of her offer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
As Ronald comes from a family with little economic resources, he could not finish his secondary education.

However, he did not let the circumstances get in the way of his energy. He decided to fight for his personal development and for his beloved children. Since his kids were born, he had to work hard. He sells sweets and a large variety of books.

With this business, he manages to cover his most urgent needs and to send a considerable amount of money at the end of every month to his beloved children who study in the city of Arequipa.

The wish of this father is to buy selected books in large quantities in order to sell them to students, teachers and the general public according to their respective needs. Ronald believes that this investment will considerably increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Ronald es un hombre que proviene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos, es por ello que no pudo concluir sus estudios secundarios.

Sin embargo no ha dejado que las circunstancias aplaquen su ímpetu y ha decidido seguir luchando en busca de su superación personal y la de sus amados hijos. Desde que nacieron sus retoños tuvo que trabajar arduamente, se dedica a la venta de dulces y una gran variedad de libros en forma ambulatoria.
