Con este negocio está logrando cubrir sus necesidades más urgentes y enviar cada fin de mes una determinada cantidad de dinero a sus queridos hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la ciudad de Arequipa.

El deseo de este padre es adquirir libros de colección y en mayor cantidad, con el fin de ofertarlos entre los estudiantes, docentes y público en general de acuerdo a la solicitud de cada uno de ellos. Ronald cree que haciendo esta inversión logrará mejorar considerablemente sus ingresos.

loans.use: Investment to increase the offer of books.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
Maria Ester is a woman with a lot of character and a great personality. She was exclusively a homemaker until one of her sisters gave her a carrito sanguchero (a mini kitchen on wheels) so that she could work. For six months she has been selling salchipapas (typical Peruvian food with potatoes and sausages) by night, at first with the help of her brother but now on her own. Still, Maria does not count solely on the income from her kitchen cart. She and her husband, who works as a chauffer, have succeeded in building extra rooms in their house as rental units. Additionally, they rent a car which is used as a taxi.

Maria Ester's plans include paying off the loans that she and her husband both owe so that they can buy a bus to rent out. Ultimately she would like to change to another district in order to have a better quality of life, since at the moment she cannot count on having a network of water-drainage nor on having potable water for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Ester es una mujer con mucho carácter y gran personalidad. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a su casa. Hasta que una de sus hermanas le regalo un carrito sanguchero para que lo ponga a trabajar. Es así que por seis meses ella ha estado vendiendo salchipapas por las noches, al inicio con la ayuda de su hermano pero ahora lo hace sola. No obstante, María no solo cuenta con el ingreso de este trabajo. Ella y su esposo, quien trabaja como chofer, han logrado construir su casa con habitaciones extras para poder rentarlas a inquilinos. Muy aparte de ello alquilan un automóvil para ser trabajado como taxi. Dentro de sus planes esta el terminar de pagar los préstamos que adeuda con su esposo, para comprarse un bus y alquilarlo también. Así también, quisiera mudarse a otro distrito para tener una mejor calidad de vida, ya que actualmente su casa no cuenta con red de desagüe ni de agua potable.

loans.use: Business expenses - sale of fried foods

loans.name: Efigenio

texts.es:
Efigenio has always been tied to the textile business. His family has been working in clothing manufacture and sales for several years. One of his brothers holds a sales position in a large commercial center. It is for this reason that, after leaving behind his business of selling groceries for one and one half years, Efigenio contented himself with the manufacture of hats and pouches. He has spent three years already in this line of work. It is not his first foray into the textile industry; before he worked selling groceries, he bought and sold ready-to-wear clothing. Efigenio lives with his wife, who is employed as a domestic worker, and with his twenty-year-old son. In the future he plans to continue with his clothing manufacture business, making it grow and contracting personnel when he installs more machines in his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Efigenio siempre ha estado vinculado al negocio de textiles. Su familia ha estado dedicada al negocio de la confección y venta de ropa durante varios años. Uno de sus hermanos tiene un puesto de venta en un gran centro comercial. Es por esto que, luego de dejar su negocio de abarrotes en el que duro año y medio, se animo a invertir en la confección de gorras y canguros. Hoy ya lleva tres años dedicándose a esto. Aunque no es la primera vez que esta dentro del negocio textil, antes de haber trabajado vendiendo abarrotes el compraba y vendía ropa ya confeccionada. El vive con su esposa quien trabaja brindando servicios domésticos y con su hijo de veinte años. Más adelante tiene planeado seguir con su negocio de confección, hacerlo crecer y contratar a un personal de trabajo cuando implemente su taller con más máquinas.

loans.use: Purchase of machinery for manufacture of clothing

loans.name: Leonida

texts.es:
Leónida R. began working at a very young age. Her first job was as a domestic servant in a home, which she decided to resign as a result of physical mistreatment by her employer. In this way she began a job as a salesperson for a warehouse. She worked there for ten years until she separated from her husband and decided to become independent.

Now, she has a store in her home. By night she sells anticuchos (shish kebab) and salchipapas (fries with sliced sausage) with the help of her youngest daughter, who is her only company now that her other children are out of the house. In the future, she would like to convert her store into a mechanic shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Leónida R. empezó a trabajar desde muy joven. Su primer trabajo fue de empleada domestica en una casa; sin embargo, decidió renunciar puesto que recibía maltratos físicos de su patrona. Fue así que encontró un trabajo como vendedora en una bodega. Aquí estuvo trabajando por diez años. Hasta que se separo de su esposo y entonces pensó en independizarse. Ahora ella tiene una tienda en su casa. Por las noches vende anticuchos y salchipapas con la ayuda de su menor hija quien su única compañía, pues sus otros hijos son independientes. En un futuro ella quisiera cambiar su tienda en un taller de mecánica.

loans.use: Completion of store construction

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina y Paulino, are both very industrious and enterprising parents, since they formed their family they have dedicated themselves to countless activities so their 3 beloved children do not experience economic constraints.

Paulino, purchases and sells building bricks while Bernardina has a country store. In addition, 2 years ago the couple purchased a motorcycle taxi to rent it and earn extra money for family expenses.

The couples wish is to increase the amount of capital for their brick business; both believe that by increasing their capital they will also increase their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Bernardina y Paulino, son padres muy laboriosos y emprendedores, desde que formaron su familia se dedicaron a innumerables actividades con el fin de que sus 3 queridos hijos, no pasen limitaciones económicas.

Paulino, se dedica a la compra y venta de ladrillos de construcción, mientras que Bernardina se dedica al negocio por campañas, adicionalmente a sus labores hace 2 años adquirieron un mototaxi con el fin de alquilarlo y obtener ingresos extras para el gasto y sustento familiar.

El deseo de esta pareja es aumentar el monto de inversión de su negocio de ladrillos, ambos creen que aumentando su capital incrementarán también sus beneficios.

loans.use: Increase in capital to raise the production of bricks.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.es:
Despite her age, Marcosa is in charge of looking after her household and her husband, who has retired. Five years ago, she worked at a vegetable stand in a local market. However, when her husband retired, their monthly income was not sufficient. Her husband’s pension was too small, and her vegetable business did not generate enough income, which is why she decided to open a general store in her home a year ago.

She has three grown-up children. For now, her plan is to expand her business and later set up another one, since the idea is to always advance.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

A pesar de su avanzada edad, Marcosa se encarga de mantener su hogar y a su esposo, quien es ya jubilado. Hace cinco años ella trabajaba en puesto ambulante de verduras en un mercado; no obstante, cuando su esposo de jubiló los ingresos mensuales de ambos no eran suficientes. La pensión de su esposo como jubilado era muy pequeña y su negocio de verduras no producía lo necesario. Fue por ello que decidió hace un año abrir una tienda en su casa.

Ella tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores. Por ahora su plan es crecer en su negocio y más adelante poner otro. Pues la idea siempre esta en progresar.

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is from the town of Antauta – Asillo department of Puno; 10 years ago she gathered her beloved children and moved to the city of Juliaca.

Since then with determination and diligence she has been able to open a small grocery store in a strategic location. In addition, Alejandrina knits beautiful clothing; this foray into new business is beginning to have successful.

This diligent mother’s wish is to purchase wool in order to continue designing and developing a variety of garments to be offered in greater quantities in the city of Juliaca. With your contribution Alejandrina will realize her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina es natural de la localidad de Antauta – Asillo departamento de Puno, desde hace 10 años junto a sus amorosos hijos radica en la ciudad de Juliaca.

Desde entonces con empeño y diligencia logró abrir su tiendita de abarrotes en un local estratégico. Adicionalmente a esta labor se dedica al tejido de hermosas prendas de vestir, negocio en el que esta empezando a incursionar y tener éxito.

El deseo de esta diligente madre es adquirir lana con el fin de seguir diseñando y elaborando variedad de prendas que serán ofertados en mayor volumen en la ciudad de Juliaca.Con vuestro desinteresado aporte doña Alejandrina concretará sus planes.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase production of clothing.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde, is a very happy and enterprising mother who has always been hard working and diligent; she was not able to complete higher studies because her parents did not have the economic resources to take on such a responsibility.

Since she married her husband Jerson, who is a chauffeur for an urban transportation company, Matilde buys and sells American clothing. At the start her business did not seem profitable because she was constantly failing, but now with the experience gained in this business she is pleased to get good results. Matilde now purchases her merchandise by bales in the city of La Paz- Bolivia and sells her merchandise in the cities of Puno, Cuzco and her hometown of Juliaca.

Thanks to the benefits she has received, she is now able to cover all her needs and offer her 2 beloved sons a better quality of life. Matilde’s wish is to increase the amount of her investment and use those earnings to finally build a home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Matilde, es una madre alegre emprendedora que siempre demostró ser muy trabajadora y diligente, no pudo concluir sus estudios superiores porque sus padres no tenían recursos económicos suficientes para sumir esta gran responsabilidad.

Desde que contrajo matrimonio con Jerson quien trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transporte urbano decidió dedicarse a la compra y venta de ropas americanas, en un inicio este negocio no parecía ser muy rentable porque constantemente salía fracasando, pero ahora ya con la experiencia ganada en este negocio tiene la satisfacción de obtener buenos resultados.

Matilde, adquiere su mercadería por fardos en la ciudad de la Paz- Bolivia y los vende en las ciudades de Puno, Cuzco y su ciudad natal Juliaca, gracias a los benéficos que obtiene está logrando cubrir todas sus necesidades y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 queridos hijos.El deseo de Matilde es aumentar su monto de inversión y con las ganancias que obtenga podrá finalmente construir su domicilio.

loans.use: Increase in capital to offer more clothing options.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Felícitas

texts.es:
Ms. Felicitas, is one of the best seamstresses in the city of Juliaca, she inherited that talent from her beloved mother who with much ability and diligence was able to create beautiful clothing.

Currently, Ms. Felicitas’ small tailor shop located in her humble home is frequently visited due to a high demand in services from her customers. Once her customers see the well designed and highly detailed creations they are very satisfied. That is why she now enjoys a large quantity of orders, yet she still has one problem, she does not have enough materials and work tools.

Ms. Felicitas’ desire is to finish establishing her tailor shop, and she is very confident that with your support she will be able to make this a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Felicitas, es una de las mejores costureras de la ciudad de Juliaca, ese talento lo heredó de su querida madre quien con habilidad y diligencia confeccionaba hermosas prendas de vestir.

Actualmente la pequeña sastrería de doña Felicitas ubicada en su humilde domicilio está siendo muy visitada y solicitada por su exigente clientela, quienes luego de ver el perfecto trabajo que diseña y confecciona con finísimos detalles quedan muy satisfechos. Es por ello que ahora goza de gran cantidad de solicitudes, pero aún tiene un problema, no cuenta con suficientes materiales ni herramientas de trabajo.

El anhelo que tiene doña Felicitas es terminar de implementar su sastrería y está segura que con tu apoyo podrá concretarlo.

loans.use: Increase in capital to implement a tailor shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy, is a 25 year old responsible model father; 3 years ago he completed his advanced degree as an educator but due to a lack of job opportunities he has not been able to employ his profession.

Currently, to earn a living and to satisfy his family’s most urgent needs, he provides urban transportation services to the town of Juliaqueña by way of his motorcycle taxi that he was able to purchase from his own savings.

While Fredy is dedicated to his labor, his beloved spouse Nelly and young daughter sell commercial products. Due to their efforts and perseverance they have been able to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Fredy, es un responsable y ejemplar padre de 25 años de edad, hace 3 años concluyó sus estudios superiores como profesor y por falta de oportunidades de trabajo no puede ejercer su profesión.

Actualmente para ganarse el sustento de su familia y cubrir sus necesidades más urgentes se dedica a brindar servicios de movilidad urbana a la población Juliaqueña en su moto taxi que adquirió con los ahorros que poseía.

Mientras Fredy se dedica a esta esforzada labor su querida esposa Nelly acompañada de su pequeña niña se dedica al comercio de artículos por campañas, gracias al esfuerzo y empeño de ambos es que están logrando mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Request for an increase in capital to help fund his wife's business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 47798

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
Pabla is a diligent and enterprising mother, she has used her low economic resources to strengthen her business selling articles of clothing like sweaters and an immense variety of ‘polleras,’a festival costume, on mobile stands in the cities of Juliaca and Ayaviri. Thanks to her commitment and dedication she is able to obtain good weekly earnings and profits with which she supports the members of her family. The desire of doña Pabla is to acquire new designs and colors of polleras to accommodate the requests of her customers, who are mostly beautiful ladies who need to showcase their outfits in different festivals and in some cases for daily wear.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Pabla, es una diligente y emprendedora madre, sus bajos recursos económicos la llevan a esforzarse en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir como chompas y también de una inmensa variedad de polleras que son ofertadas en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Juliaca y Ayaviri. Gracias a su empeño y dedicación logra obtener semanalmente buenas ganancias y beneficios con los que apoya a los miembros de su familia.El deseo de doña Pabla es adquirir nuevos diseños y colores de polleras con el fin de complacer la solicitudes de sus clientes que en su mayoría son hermosas damas que requieren sus prendas para lucirlas en algunas festividades y en algunos casos para su vestir diario.

loans.use: Increase in capital to offer a greater variety of festival costumes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 47799

loans.name: Rufo

texts.es:
Don Rufo is a humble parent working daily in his car to be able to provide the daily sustenance of his family and ensure the security and well-being of his two children and wife. He goes out everyday with his automobile to cover the route of Tambo and Public Records until the late hours of the night. His desire is to be able to improve their income and to do this he asks for a loan which he will invest in the maintenance and repair of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Don Rufo es un humilde padre de familia que diariamente trabaja en su auto para poder otorgarle el sustento diario a su familia y velar diariamente por la seguridad de sus 2 hijos y su esposa. El sale diariamente con su auto a cubrir la ruta del Tambo y Registros Públicos hasta altas horas de la noche, su deseo es poder mejorar sus ingresos y para hacerlo solicita un préstamo que invertirá en el mantenimiento y reparación de su auto.

loans.use: Increase in capital to repair his automobile

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes works daily to achieve what she has yearned for and to provide her family with stability. She is a mother of two small children and has decided to sell articles of clothing in a portable stall to her neighbors and people she knows. She is grateful to her mother, who drove her to dedicate herself to this business and now she has had five years of successful sales. She wants to increase her merchandise, for which she asks for a loan that will be invested intelligently and at the end will produce profits that will benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes día a día trabaja para lograr lo que anhela, brindar a su familia estabilidad, es madre de 2 pequeños y ha decidido vender prendas de vestir de manera ambulante ofreciéndolas entre sus vecinos y personas conocidas.Agradece a su madre que la impulsó a dedicarse a este negocio y ahora que ha transcurrido 5 años de exitosa venta. Ella desea incrementar su mercadería para la cual solicita un préstamo que invertirá inteligentemente y hará producir a fin de que las ganacias generen provecho en sus familiares.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase the supply of products

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
In search of opportunities of development, making curtains was the main occupation of Mariluz. Two months ago she and her daughter decided to apply their needlework skills to make beautiful decorated curtains in a shopping mall with the goal of satisfying the most urgent needs of Huancaína families. Marliluz has great expectations for her business because their enormous efforts have rewarded them so far. It is for this that she asks for a loan to be used for the purchase of fabrics and thread to continue producing the beautiful curtains that adorn the homes of many families.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

En búsqueda de oportunidades de desarrollo, la confección de cortinas era la ocupación principal de Mariluz que hace dos meses en asociación con su hija decidió aplicar sus conocimientos de costura para elaborar bellas cortinas decorativas en un centro comercial con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades más exigentes de las familias huancaínas.Mariluz tiene grandes expectativas de su negocio porque hasta el momento le retribuye sus enormes esfuerzos, es por ello que solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos para seguir elaborando las bellas cortinas que adornarán los hogares de muchas familias.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and thread

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Doña Maria is a very dynamic person who since her youth has sought improvement for the progress of her family and for years she has also been an important mainstay in the economy of her family. Five years ago she opened a store in her own house and with the cordial attention that she offers she has seen her sales increase notably. During these years, thanks to continual improvement, she has generated many more customers and wants to continue implementing them until her store has become one of the best in the district.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Maria, es una persona muy dinámica que desde su juventud ha buscado mejoras para el progreso de su familia y durante años ha sido también un sostén importante en la economía de su familia. Hace 5 años abrió una tienda en su propia casa y con la cordial atención que ofrece ha visto incrementar sus ventas notablemente. La ha ido implementando durante esos años, gracias a que este continua repotenciación le ha generado muchos más clientes desea seguir implementándola hasta convertirla en una de las mejores bodegas de la zona.

loans.use: Increase in capital to increase the quantity of products offered in her small establishment

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth has the satisfaction of having made a good choice; she has dedicated herself to the sale of glass for two years after many attempts to build her own business. She did not do it alone, knowing that it is better to work in partnership, so she capitalized on her savings and looked for a business associate and together they decided to work for each other’s benefit. Elizabeth now wants to open another branch of her glass sales in another area, wanting to offer the best to her 17-year-old son who now needs all of her support to become a professional. She requests a loan to buy wholesale glass, or large sheets of glass, to ensure income.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth, tiene la satisfacción de haber hecho una buena elección, la de dedicarse a la venta de vidrios hace 2 años después de muchos intentos de construir su propio negocio. No lo hizo sola ya que es consciente que es mejor un trabajo asociado, es así que capitalizó sus ahorros y buscó un socio y juntos han decidido trabajar por el beneficio de los suyos.Elizabeth quiere ahora abrir otro establecimiento como sucursal de su venta de vidrios en otra zona más, ella quiere ofrecerle lo mejor a su hijo de 17 años que ahora necesita de todo su apoyo para ser profesional. Solicita un préstamo para comprar vidrios al por mayor es decir planchas grandes y así asegurar equitativamente los ingresos.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire raw material and open another location

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 47804

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
When her daughter's store didn't go as planned, Maria decided to begin selling soft drinks and beer, which she has done already for five years. However, this is not the only way Maria allocates her time. For three years she has worked also as an artisan decorating and finishing furniture parts. She basically paints pieces of wood that will accessorize larger pieces of furniture.

Maria's husband gave her the idea of entering this business as he has done the same work in a factory for more than ten years. Both spouses are in charge of maintaining the home. Although they live with their children, their children are economically independent. Maria's goal is to finish construction of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Cuando la tienda de su hija no iba como ellas pensaban, Maria decidió dedicarse solo a vender gaseosas y cervezas. De esto, cinco años ya pasaron. Pero no es solo en esto que Maria ocupa su tiempo. Hace tres años que trabaja también como artesana elaborando y dándole acabados a algunas partes de muebles. Ella básicamente pinta piezas de madera que servirán de accesorios para otras piezas más grandes de muebles.

El esposo de Maria fue quien le dio la idea de incursionar en este negocio pues él se dedica a lo mismo en su taller hace mas de diez años. Ambos se encargan del mantenimiento de la casa. Y aunque vivan con sus hijos, ellos ya son independiente económicamente. La meta de María actualmente es terminar de construir su casa.

loans.use: Create a suitable working environment in the home

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Valor and bravery have been what Angelica has needed to start her own business and to develop herself as a wandering saleswoman; selling clothes in the Jauja market. She made this decision 3 years ago when she was looking for business opportunities and now this is an important source of income for her and her 10 year old son. She plans to work very hard and improve her finances with an increase in capital.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El valor y valentía a Angélica le han servido para emprender un negocio y ser protagonista de su propio desarrollo mediante la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en la feria de Jauja. Tomó esa decisión hace 3 años cuando estaba en búsqueda de oportunidades de negocio y hoy esta actividad es una fuente de ingresos económicos importante para ella y su pequeño de 10 años. Está planificando trabajar arduamente y mejorar su economía con el incremento de capital.

loans.use: To increase her capital to offer more products/Incremento de capital para elevar la oferta de sus productos.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Upon marrying, Victoria left her husband, leaving behind her job as a company cashier. In this way she came to seek other work and began selling in a market in a traveling position. In the beginning, she sold clothes and fruits for a year each. After purchasing her own spot in the market, she changed her business to condiment sales. It has been eight years that she has been in the same line of work, selling in the mornings and evenings.

Victoria has been separated from her husband for more than five years. She lives alone with her two grown children, who have families of their own. She is saving the earnings from her work to one day apply toward opening a hairdressing salon and a bazaar in her home with her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Al casarse Victoria se fue vivir con su esposo y abandono el trabajo de cajera que tenia en una empresa. Fue así que decidió buscar otro trabajo y empezó a vender en el mercado en un puesto ambulante. Al inicio ella vendió ropa y frutas por un año cada uno. Pero luego de comprarse un puesto propio en el mercado, cambio su negocio a uno de venta de especería (condimentos). Hoy ya lleva ocho años dedicándose a esto vendiendo por las mañanas y por las tardes.

Hace mas de cinco años que vive separada de su esposo. Actualmente vive solo con sus dos hijos que ya son mayores y con su propia familia cada uno. Las ganancias de su trabajo por ahora las esta ahorrando, pues más adelante piensa poner con su hija una peluquería y un bazar en su casa.

loans.use: Establishment of a bazaar-hairdressing salon

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Since childhood, Cristina has been talented in working with her hands, and this is what she now does to support her family. Her qualities have helped her to teach others these skills, and this is what she does; she teaches many mothers from mothers' clubs, 'glass of milk' commitees etc to make things with their hands, as well as selling her own products. She weaves and crochets, and she enjoys doing this every day as it is her vocation, and she must do it to support her three kids.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Cristina, desde su niñez ha tenido un talento para realizar bellos trabajos de manualidades y esto en la actualidad le está sirviendo para sostener a su familia. Sus cualidades le han servido para transmitir estos conocimientos a otras personas y en esto consiste su trabajo, enseña a numerosas madres en clubes de madres, comités de vaso de leche, etc. a los cuales ofrece sus servicios además de realizar estos trabajos para venderlos. Teje a palito y a crochet, y disfruta de este trabajo diariamente porque es su vocación y además le otorga lo necesario para sostener a sus 3 hijos.

loans.use: An injection of capital to buy more raw material/Inyección de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina has always been the main character in her own development, and her economic independence has made her very sure of herself and of the change she can make through working. She sells cosmetics and some handmade items that she herself makes. She offers them to friends and she is constantly looking for new clients to expand and improve her sales. At the same time she also sells delicious sweets on the street.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carolina, siempre ha sido protagonista de su propio desarrollo, su independencia económica la ha llevado a ser muy segura de si misma y del cambio que puede realizar con su trabajo. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y de algunas manualidades que ella misma elabora, los ofrece entre sus amigas y está en búsqueda diaria de nuevos clientes para expandir y mejorar sus ventas y a la vez también ofrece ricas gelatinas que vende al paso.

loans.use: To increase her capital to be able to offer more products/Incremento de capital para elevar la oferta de sus artículos.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia K. is 25 years old, married, and has two children. Since her father passed away two years ago, she has been living on her own. Telesia's husband works in town; however, his salary is not sufficient to fully support the family. Telesia heard of SPBD through the women in her village, and dedided to take advantage of the opportunities it offers for earning additional income for her family. Now, Telesia is starting her own pork cake and donut sales business. This is her first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: Purchase of oil, flour, sugar, baking powder, etc.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh S. is 44 years old and earns about $3.50 per day sewing from her house. Her husband, Mr. Nob Vanchhean, is a 45-year-old construction worker who makes about $4 per day. They have five children, one of whom is married.

She seeks a loan of $700 to purchase a new sewing machine and more cloth to sew and sell. This loan can help to expand and develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and more cloth

loans.name: Srim Ke Group

texts.en:
Mr. Srim K. is the leader of a six member group in Chro Moh Chrouk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a subsistence farmer who also provides other rice farmers with his rice-processing machine; this earns him extra income to better support his family. Unfortunately, his machine needs to be repaired and so he is requesting a loan for that purpose.

Mr. Srim K. is 46 and the father of three children, all of whom are attending school. His wife, Mrs. Nan T., is a farmer and pig breeder. She usually assists her husband on the field to improve their living conditions together.

loans.use: To repair a rice machine in order to earn extra income.

loans.name: Ron Suos Group

texts.en:
This five members group in Chrok Kouv Village in Kampong Chhnang Province is led by Mrs. Ron S., a farmer and rice reseller. She usually buys rice to keep in stock and resell later in the season when it commands a higher price. Unfortunately, due to expenses incurred by health problems and her daughter’s wedding, she does not have enough money to purchase additional rice for resale. Mrs. Ron S. is thus requesting a loan for that purpose.

She and her husband, Khuoy Suon, a subsistence farmer, have other five children, one of whom is a lumberjack while two others are coal sellers. A third one is studying and the remaining child is yet too young to either work or study.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to resell later in the season.

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mr. Samnang Chim decided to pay $13 in advance.

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sarim L. is the leader of this group of five in Prey Pouch Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 49 and the mother of a child employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Sareourn Pring, is a policeman in the province. Mrs. Sarim L. owns a small restaurant where she sells rice, Chinese noodles and rice soups to the villagers. She wants to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy additional and more varied food. She has already obtained a loan from AMK to start her small restaurant, and since the business is successful,  she wants to make it larger.

loans.use: To buy additional and more varied food.

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mrs. Sarim Leang decided to pay $13 in advance.

This Group Has An End Of Term Loan. This Means That Principal Is Due At The End Of The Loan. AMK Allows For Pre-payments, Thus Some The Members Might Pay Some Principal Before The End Of The Loan. So Mrs. Sarim Leang Decided To Pay $13 In Advance.

loans.name: Kev Ke Group

texts.en: Mrs. K. K. is the leader of this five-member group in Prey Pouch Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 38-year-old housewife and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the others are yet too young to attend.  Her husband, Mr. Narin Heak, is a construction worker in the village.  In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. K. K. is requesting a loan to start a pig breeding business to assist her husband in supporting the family.

loans.use: To start a new business breeding pigs.

loans.name: Sokny Kim Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokny K., a fruit seller who generates a small income, is the leader of a five-member group in Prey Pouch Village, which is located in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 31 years old and the mother of a child who is yet too young to attend school while her husband, Mr. Hao Horm, is a construction worker who also generates a small income to support the family.  In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sokny K. is requesting a loan to start a pig breeding business.  Previously, she obtained a loan to buy fruit to resell in the local market.

loans.use: To start a pig breeding business in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Sugeng

texts.id:
This loan if approved would be the second loan for Sugeng P.. In the first loan, his payment record is good. His printing business also is progressing compared to earlier times. This time there were so many orders that need to be printed, from greetings, invitations and posters. Because of the many orders, Sugeng could not finish it all by himself. Therefore he is employing his brother to assist him. The objective of this loan is to buy raw materials, like cloth, paper and ink. At the moment Sugeng lives in Pulau Pinang street with his wife and two children.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Pinjaman kali ini merupakan pinjaman kedua bagi Sugeng P.. Pada pinjaman tahap pertama, rekor pembayarannya bagus. Usaha percetakannyapun memiliki kemajuan dibandingkan sebelumnya. Saat ini begitu banyak pesanan yang harus dicetak, mulai dari kartu ucapan, undangan dan baliho atau spanduk. Karena begitu banyaknya pesanan, Sugeng sampai kewalahan untuk menyelesaikan semuanya sendiri. Karena itu ia mempekerjakan saudaranya untuk membantunya . Tujuan dari pinjaman kali ini untuk membeli bahan baku untuk percatakan sepeerti kain, kertas dan tinta. Sugeng saat ini tinggal di Jl.Pulau Pinang bersama istri dan kedua anaknya.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Chanphal Leang Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chanphal L., 58, is the group leader of five members in Prey Pouch Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a bicycle repairer and the father of four children, all of whom are enrolled in local school. His wife, Mrs. Sokuntheavy Kon, is a farmer and teacher.  They currently live in an old house whose roof leaks badly during the rainy season, so he is requesting a loan which, when added to his savings, will allow him to build a new house in the village.
 Previously, Mr. Chanphal L. obtained a loan to buy bicycle equipment for his village customers.

loans.use: To help build a new house.

loans.name: Sriningsih

texts.id:
Sriningsih works as a tailor. Her business seems to have a good prospect because not only she gets individual orders, but she also get bulk orders from garment retailers. Due to the high numbers of orders, Sriningsih begins to teach her children how to sew so that they can help her finish working on the orders on time. This time, Sriningsih hopes to get another loan to buy materials such as cloth and thread as she already paid back the previous loan without delay. Now, Sriningsih lives with her husband and children in Denpasar.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Pekerjaan sebagai penjahit merupakan profesi sehari-hari yang dilakukan oleh Ibu Sriningsih. Usahanya ini dinilai memiliki prospek yang cukup bagus karena selain pesanan dari individu, ada juga pesanan dari garmen dalam jumlah yang banyak. Karena begitu banyaknya pesanan, Sriningsih sekarang dalam proses mengajari anaknya menjahit, sehingga bisa membantunya menyelesaikan semua pesanan tepat waktu. Kali ini Sriningsih berharap diberi pinjaman lagi untuk membeli bahan-bahan seperti kain dan benang, karena pada pinjaman sebelumnya dia telah lunas dan tidak pernah menunnggak. Saat ini Sriningsih tinggal bersama dengan suami dan anaknya di Denpasar.

loans.use: To add more capital

loans.name: Channeth Nhem Group

texts.en: Mrs. Channeth N., a 26-year-old housewife, lives in Prey Pouch Village where she is the leader of a five-member group.  To assist her husband, Mr. Buntha Reth, a motorbike taxi driver, to support the family, Mrs. Channeth N. is seeking a loan to purchase a pig to raise. She and her husband have three children, two of whom are studying while the youngest child is yet too young to attend school. Last year, Mrs. Channeth N. obtained a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband to start a motorbike taxi business.

loans.use: To buy a pig to raise.

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mrs. Chanthy Nhem decided to pay $10 in advance.

This Group Has An End Of Term Loan. This Means That Principal Is Due At The End Of The Loan. AMK Allows For Pre-payments, Thus Some The Members Might Pay Some Principal Before The End Of The Loan. So Mrs. Chanthy Nhem Decided To Pay $35 In Advance and Mrs. Chanlorn Thoang deicded to pay $25 in advace too.

loans.name: Nawawi

texts.id:
Nawawi runs the business with 4 workers. Nawawi wants to add more workers so that he needs more capital now. Nawawi's business is selling prized toys. The capital that he needs for a set of toy is about Rp. 50,000. Each worker can produce 6 - 10 sets of prized toys. The daily income is enough to pay the workers' wages and to purchase toys to be sold again. Besides, the profit is also spent for his children's education fee.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan 4 orang tenaga kerja Bapak Nawawi menjalankan usahanya. Saat ini Nawawi ingin menambah tenaga kerja dan untuk itu dia memelukan modal. Usaha yang ditekuni oleh Nawawi adalah sebagai penjual mainan berhadiah. Modal yang diperlukan untuk setiap satu set mainan adalah sekitar Rp. 50.000 dan untuk setiap tenaga kerja minimal membawa 6 – 10 set mainan berhadiah. Penghasilan yang didapat setiap hari cukup untuk membayar tenaga kerja dan juga untuk membeli mainan untuk dijual kembali. Selain itu juga, keuntungan yang didapat untuk biayai sekolah anaknya.

loans.use: To add more capital

loans.name: Yulin Hok Group

texts.en: Mrs. Yulin H. is the group leader of six members in Prey Pouch Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 62-year-old housewife whose husband, Mr. Nhan S., a bicycle repairer, provides the family’s only income.  Unfortunately, he does not have enough money to purchase an air pump for his business, so Mrs. Yulin H. is requesting a loan to purchase one.  She and her husband live in an old house and try to support their standard of living together.

loans.use: To buy an air pump for her husband's business.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman is a mother who works selling snacks for school kids. Her kiosk is located strategically near a school so her business is quite good. Everyday she walks to buy merchandises for her kiosk in Badung market as her house is not too far away from the market. Besides selling snack, she also sells other food such as rujak buah (cut fruits with sour and spicy sauce) and lontong sayur (rice cake and vegetable with spicy coconut milk soup). Her regular customers are usually her own neighbours. The income from the kiosk is spent for capital and also for her daily life expenses. Ni Nyoman hopes that the loan can help her expand the kiosk.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman adalah seorang ibu yang berprofesi sebagai penjual makanan ringan dan konsumennya adalah anak-anak sekolah. Tempat berjualannya yang bersebelahan dengan sekolah cukup strategis, sehingga usahanya cukup lancar. Setiap harinya ia belanja kebutuhan warungnya di Pasar Badung dengan berjalan kaki, karena jarak antara rumah dan pasarnya tidak terlalu jauh. Selain menjual makanan ringan, dia juga menjual makanan lain seperti rujak buah dan lontong sayur. Biasanya pembelinya adalah tetangga-tetangganya sendiri. Hasil dari warungnya dipergunakan sebagai modal lagi dan juga memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Ni Nyoman berharap, pinjaman kali ini bisa membantunya mengembangkan warungnya.

loans.use: To add more capital

loans.name: Saov Sop Group

texts.en: Saov S., a single 26-year-old palm leaf sewer, is the group leader of four members in Kor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Although she usually generates a small income through palm leaf sewing, she is now seeking a loan to start a pig breeding business in order to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To start a pig breeding business in order to improve her living condition.

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mrs. Teourn Nim decided to pay $17 in advance.

loans.name: Nawi

texts.id:
Nawi lives with his wife on Parahyangan street, Tuban Bali in a quite decent rented 3 x 3-meter room. Both of his children stay with their grandmother and studies in Jawa. In his daily life, he works as a second-hand goods collector. He collects junks and second-hand goods and then re-sell them. He has done this work since 6 years ago. Although people think that this job is dirty and unhealthy, Nawi keeps working on it. The income from the junks is enough to cover his children's education in Java, rent fee, daily expenses, and recently he just managed to buy a motorcycle. He hopes he can get a loan for his capital to buy sellable second-hand goods.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Nawi tinggal bersama istrinya di Jl.Parahyangan Tuban Bali dengan mengontrak sebuah kamar kecil berukuran 3 x 3 meter dan kondisi tempat tinggalnya cukup baik. Kedua orang anaknya tinggal di Jawa bersama neneknya dan bersekolah disana. Sehari-harinya kegiatan Nawi adalah sebagai pemulung, mengumpulkan rongsokan dan barang-barang bekas untuk kemudian dijual lagi. Pekerjaan ini sudah ditekuninya sejak 6 tahun yang lalu. Meskipun orang menganggap pekerjaan ini kotor dan tidak sehat, tapi Nawi tetap tekun menjalaninya. Penghasilan dari mencari barang rongsokan cukup untuk menyekolahkan anaknya di Jawa, membayar biaya kontrak rumah, untuk kebutuhan sehari dan sekarang bahkan Nawi sudah bisa membeli sepeda motor. Harapannya dia bisa diberi pinjaman yang nantinya akan dipakai sebagai modal membeli barang bekas lalu kemudian dijual kembali.

loans.use: To add more capital

loans.name: Kasiono

texts.id:
Kasiono has worked as a second-hand goods collector for quite some time. For almost 10 years, Kasiono has to spend his time to look for second-hand goods and also to work as a street sweeper. In his daily life, Kasiono wakes up at 5 am to sweep the street while collecting sellable second-hand goods. After that, he looks for the goods in other places using his motorcycle to Kuta and Suwung Kangin area. In the evening, he sells the goods and when he has spare time, he helps his neighbours who needs his help. Currently, he lives together with his wife and children in Tuban Bali in a very humble rented house.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Pekerjaan sebagai pencari barang rongsokan sudah lama ditekuni oleh Kasiono. Selama hampir 10 tahun, Kasiono harus membagi waktunya mencari barang bekas dan juga sebagai tukang sapu jalan. Sehari-harinya, Kasiono harus bangun jam 5 untuk membersihkan jalan sambil tentunya mengumpulkan barang bekas yang masih bisa dijual. Setelah selesai, dengan menggunakan sepeda motornya, Kasiono langsung mencari barang rongsokan ditempat lain samapai daerah Kuta dan Suwung Kangin. Setelah itu sore harinya dia menjual barang hasil pencarinnya dan kalo masih ada waktu dia biasanya membantu tetangga sekitarnya yang membutuhkan bantuan. Saat ini kasiono tinggal bersama istri dan anaknya di Tuban Bali disebuah rumah sewa yang sangat sederhana.

loans.use: To add  more capital

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
This would be second loan for Siti A.. After repaying her first loan properly, Siti A. wishes to expand her business further. Siti A. sells food in her simple kiosk. Her family is quite healthy, but her husband has impaired vision, which makes him unable to work. Siti A. is highly motivated to meet her family's financial need. Each day, she goes shopping in Abianbase market and sells her food from the morning to the evening.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Pinjaman kali ini merupakan pinjaman yang kedua bagi Ibu Siti A.. Setelah menyelesaikan pinjaman pertama dengan baik, Siti A. berkeinginan untuk menambah modal usaha lagi. Saat ini usaha yang ditekuni Ibu Siti A. adalah sebagai penjual makanan dengan membuka warung makan sendiri.Keadaan keluarganya cukup sehat, tapi saat ini suaminya mengalami rabun, yang mengakibatkan dia tidak bisa bekerja. Seorang diri berusaha tidak menjadikan Siti A. patah semangat. Setiap harinya, untuk keperluan warungnya, dia berbelanja di Pasar Abianbase dan mulai berjualan mulai dari pagi hingga sore hari.

loans.use: Increase business capial

loans.name: Muryati

texts.id:
Muryati has been making bags for the past 5 years. She usually sells her product to an art shop in Kuta. She makes her own bags, or subcontract it to her friends. Currently, Muryati takes bulk order. In the past, the Art Shop provides the raw materials, however, recently Muryati has to obtain her own materials. Because of limited fund availability, Muryati has to rely on loan to continue this business. She will lose her income if she cannot fulfill future orders.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Pekerjaan sebagai pengepul tas sudah ditekuni oleh Muryati sejak 5 tahun yang lalu. Biasanya dia mengambil pesanan dari Art Shop di daerah Kuta, setekah itu dijahit sendiri atau diberikan kepada temannya yang lain. Saat ini, Muryati mendapat pesanan tas dalam jumlah yang banyak. Tidak seperti biasanya bahan sudah disediakan oleh Art Shop, kali ini Muryati harus menyiapkan sendiri bahan untuk membuat tas. Karena terkendala modal, Muryati sangat berharap diberi pinjaman untuk meneruskan usaha ini karena usaha ini sebenarnya sangat menjanjikan. Kalau pesanan kali ini tidak bisa diselesaikan, maka tentu saja Muryati tidak memiliki penghasilan.

loans.use: Increase Working Capital

loans.name: Kasminah

texts.id:
For the last 10 years, Kasminah and her husband has been working as junk collector. Their children have been married and lives separately from Kasminah. Every day, Kasminah and her husband collects used junk in a collection place in Suwung Kangin area. Until noon, they collect junks, and in the evening, they sort the junk based on material. Once a week they bring their collected junks to the collection center to be weighed and resold. Kasminah and her husband work diligently. They use their income to pay rent for the house they live in.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Usaha sebagai pemulung atau pengumpul rongsokan sudah ditekuni oleh suami istri ini sejak 10 tahun yang lalu. Selama ini mereka hanya tinggal berdua karena kedua anaknya telah berkeluarga dan tinggal ditempat lain. Setiap hari mereka mengambil barang bekas atau rongsokan di tempat yang sudah menjadi langganan mereka yaitu disekitar daerah Suwung Kangin. Sampai tengah hari mereka melakukan itu, dan pada sore harinya mereka memisahkan barang yang didapat sesuai dengan jenisnya. Setiap seminggu sekali mereka membawa ketempat penampungan untukditimbang dan dijual. Begitulah pekerjaan ini dilakukan dengan tekun oleh Kasminah bersama suaminya. Rumah yang mereka tempati saat ini merupakan rumah sewa, dan penghasilan dari mengumpulkan barang bekas itulah yang digunakan untuk membayar rumah dan untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari.

loans.use: Increase Working capital

loans.name: Saly Nem Group

texts.en: Mrs. Saly N., the leader of a group of five in Kor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, is a palm leaf sewer. She is 49 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending school while the other is yet too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Rom Mao, is a motorbike taxi-driver. Because the family’s current income is small, she is requesting a loan in order to start a business breeding pigs.  Previously, Mrs. Saly N. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a new motorbike for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to start a new business.

payments.comment: This Group Has An End Of Term Loan. This Means That Principal Is Due At The End Of The Loan. AMK Allows For Pre-payments, Thus Some The Members Might Pay Some Principal Before The End Of The Loan. So Mrs. Saly Nem Decided To Pay $13 In Advance.

loans.name: Agus

texts.id:
Agus P. makes leather bracelet for a living. He travels 2.5 km to work using his motorcycle every day. He sells the finished braceletes direct to consumer or souvenir shop. These braceletes are made of dried leather and then shaped into bracelet in various sizes. Currently he lives in Wijaya Suwung road in Denpasar. His kid is currently in primary school. He uses the profit from his business fro daily living needs and pay his kid's tuition. Agus P. really hopes that he can obtain the loan to expand his business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sehari-harinya Agus P. berprofesi sebagai perajin Gelang Kulit. Agus harus menempuh jarak sekitar 2,5 km ketempatnya bekerja dengan menggunakan sepeda motor. Biasanya gelang kulit yang sudah diproduksi dijual ke toko souvenir atau langsung ke konsumen. Gelang kulit ini dibuat dari kulit yang sudah dikeringkan kemudian dibentuk dan dijahit menjadi gelang denagn berbagai bentuk dan ukuran. Saat ini tinggal bersama istri dan anaknya di.Jl Wijaya Suwung Denpasar. Anaknya sekarang sudah duduk di bangku Sekolah Dasar. Keuntungan yang didapat, selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga, juga dipakai untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya. Agus P. sangat mengharapkan diberi pinjaman untuk dipakai sebagai modal usaha.

loans.use: Purchase Raw Leather material

loans.name: Man Eourng Group

texts.en: This group of five members, located in Kor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, is led by Mrs. Man E., a housewife.   She and her husband, Yong Meas, a motorcycle taxi-driver, have five children, two of whom work in a garment factory while the others are studying at state school.  Because of the family’s poor living conditions, Mrs. Man E. is requesting a loan to start a pig breeding business. She previously obtained a loan from AMK to build a new house in the village.

loans.use: To start a new pig breeding business.

loans.name: Busairi

texts.id:
Busairi lives in Tuban, renting a simple but hygienic room for $15 per month. He has been a junk collector for the past 5 years. He has no other skills nor the funding to start other business. Everyday, Busairi roams around Tuban area from dawn to dusk to seek and purchase unused junk. He only takes rest to eat lunch. After full day of work, he brings his collected junks to a junkyard that repurchase his goods to be recycled and resold. Busairi hopes that with loan from DINARI he can purchase more trash instead of seeking around.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Saat ini, Busairi tinggal di Tuban dengan menyewa sebuah kamar seharga Rp.150.000 per bulan. Keadaan kamarnya sangat sederhana, tetapi lingkungannya cukup sehat. Sudah sekitar 5 tahun yang lalu klien memulai usaha ini, dan sampai sekarang masih bertahan. Selain karena tidak memiliki usaha yang lain, juga karena tidak memiliki modal untuk memulai usaha yang lain. Setiap harinya, mulai dari pagi sampai sore hari, Busairi harus berkeliling di sekitar wilayah Tuban untuk mencari dan membeli rongsongan. Dia hanya beristirahat pada saat makan siang. Setelah seharian bekerja, hasil yang didapatnya dibawa ke tempat pengumpulan barang rongsokan untuk kemudian ditimbang dan dijual. Busairi berharap, dengan modal pinjaman dari DINARI, dia tidak perlu lagi mencari tetapi cukup membeli lalu kemudian dijual lagi.

loans.use: Increase Working Capital

loans.name: Hariyani

texts.id:
Hariyani lives with her husband in a rented room. In front of this room, she opens a small food kiosk, which sells rice dishes, basic commodities and drinks. She has worked on this business for about a year. Before that, she worked as a tailor, but she decided to start her own business to increase her income. Hariyani's living space is clean, and she is quite resilient and good at arranging and cleaning her kiosk. Most of her customers are regulars who live around her neighborhood. Hariyani really hope that she can receive this loan, which will be used to increase her kiosk's inventory, especially to buy rice because rice is the main commodity wanted by her neighbors.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Klien bersama suaminya saar ini mengontrak sebuah kamar dan didepan kamar itu dia membuka warung kecil untuk berjualan. Jenis jualannya bermacam-macam; nasi campur, sembako, juga minuman. Usaha ini baru ditekuni sekitar 1 tahun yang lalu. Sebelumnya klien bekerja sebagai penjahit, tetapi memutuskan untuk memulai usha baru untuk menambah penghasilan. Tempat tinggalnya cukup bersih, dan klien cukup ulet dan pinter mengatur dan membersihkan warungnya. Kebanyakan konsumennya sudah menjadi langganannya, terutama mereka yang tinggal di daerah sekitar tempat tinggalnya. Klien sangat berharap diberi pinjaman unutuk dipakai memperbanyak isi warungnya, terutama membeli beras, karena beras merupakan kebutuhan pokok yang banyak dicari warga sekitar.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: M.

texts.id:
S. collects and recycles used items. Everyday, he walks around with a cart to look for and buy used items, which are then sold to a recycling hub. He has to meet his household needs and pays for his children's school tuitions. S. is diligent and full of determination despite his small profit. He really hopes that he is given this loan, which he will use to increase his business capital. He has 3 children, two of whom are in middle school and vocational school. He rents a room on Patih Jelantik Street with his family. His room is decent, although its roof is only made of zinc plates and its floor of rough cement.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

S. sehari-harinya bekerja sebagai pengumpul barang-barang bekas dan rongsokan. Setiap harinya dia harus berjalan keliling untuk mencari dan membeli barang-barang bekas yang kemudian dijual kembali ke tempat pengeumpulan rongsokan. Sarana yang dipakai hanya gerobak dan sepeda dayung. Selain harus memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya, dia juga harus menyekolahkan kedua anaknya. Klien cukup ulet meskipun keuntungan yang didapat tidak terlalu banyak. Dia sangat mengharapkan diberi pinjaman untuk bisa dijadiakn tambahan modal usaha. Saat ini dia sudah memiliki 3 orang anak, 2 diantaranya sudah duduk dibangku SMP dan SMEA. Bertempat tinggal di Jl.Patih Jelantik, dia bersama keluarganya menyewa kamar dengan pembayaran bulanan. Kondisi kamarnya lumayan bagus, tetapi atapnya hanya dari seng dan lantainya dari semen kasar

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen N. is 28 years old and earns around $5 per day as a tailor at the market. She lives with her mother in Dang Rung Village, Pursat Province, Cambodia. Her mother makes about $3 per day selling groceries.

She plans to expand her business and she is finding it hard to get to her business place from her house. Sometimes, she has to pay for a motor-taxi. N. is seeking a loan to purchase a motorbike to use for her family. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy more cloth to sew and then sell. This loan will help her to expand her business and to improve her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and more cloth

loans.name: Heri

texts.id:
Heri Priyanto works as a leather bracelet maker. Heri has to travel by motorcycle for about 2.5 km (1.55 miles) to the place he works. Usually, his leather bracelets are sold to souvenir shops or directly to customers. His leather bracelets are made of dried leather, which is shaped and sewed into bracelets with many designs and sizes. He lives with his wife and child on Wijaya Suwung Street, Denpasar. The profit he earns is not only used for his household needs, but also saved for his child's school tuition in the future. Heri Priyanto really hopes that he will be given this loan so that he can increase his business capital, which can grow his business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Sehari-harinya Heri Priyanto berprofesi sebagai perajin Gelang Kulit. Heri harus menempuh jarak sekitar 2,5 km ke tempatnya bekerja dengan menggunakan sepeda motor. Biasanya gelang kulit yang sudah diproduksi dijual ke toko souvenir atau langsung ke konsumen. Gelang kulit ini dibuat dari kulit yang sudah dikeringkan kemudian dibentuk dan dijahit menjadi gelang denagn berbagai bentuk dan ukuran. Saat ini tinggal bersama istri dan anaknya di.Jl Wijaya Suwung Denpasar. Keuntungan yang didapat, selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga, juga dipakai untuk persiapan untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya nanti. Heri Priyanto sangat mengharapkan diberi pinjaman untuk dipakai sebagai modal usaha sehingga usahanya bisa lebih berkembang.

loans.use: To increase business capital

loans.name: Muayat

texts.id:
Everyday from 5:00 am to 2:00 pm, Muayat works as a garbage man, who collects and transports household garbage from his neighborhood. He earns $10 monthly, which is insufficient to meet his daily needs. Thus, he also collects used items, which can be weighed and resold. In addition, Muayat buys used items from his neighbors and stores them in a storage at his house. Fortunately, he doesn't have to support his two children, who are already married. Right now, Muayat only lives with his wife, Anik.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Setiap hari, mulai jam 5 pagi sampai jam 2 siang Muayat bekerja sebagai tukang sampah, dimana dia bertugas mengumpulkan dan mengangkut sampah rumah tangga milik warga sekitarnya. Setiap bulannya dia dibayar Rp.100.000.- Tetapi karena penghasilan dari tukang sampah tidak mencukupi kebutuhan hidupnya, dia juga harus mengumpulkan barang-barang bekas lalu kemudian ditimbang dan dijual lagi. Selain mengumpulkan, Muayat juga membeli dari tetangga sekitarnya kemudian dikumpulkan di gudang dirumahnya. Untungnya dia tidak harus membiayai kedua anaknya karena semuanya sudah menikah. Sekarang ini Muayat hanya tinggal berdua bersama dengan istrinya Anik.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Mulyati

texts.id:
Mulyati lives with her child and parents on Kartini Street, Denpasar. Everyday, she works as a food seller in a kiosk. Her food kiosk opens from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm. Most of her customers are people from her neighborhood. Her daily profit ranges from $3 to $4. She sells desserts, rice cakes and snacks for children. Fortunately, Mulyati's mother helps her in this business. Mulyati hopes that this loan can help increase her business capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Saat ini Mulyati tinggal bersama anak dan orang tuanya di Jl.Kartini Denpasar. Setiap harinya dia bekerja sebagai penjual makanan di warung. Warungnya buka mulai dari jam 06.00 pagi sampai jam 10.00 malam. Kebanyakan pelanggannya adalah warga disekitar rumahnya. Setiap hari keuntungan yang didapat berkisar antara 30.000 – 40.000. Adapun jualannya seperti Es, Lontong dan camilan atau snack untuk anak-anak. Untungnya dalam menjalankan usahnya Mulyati dibantu oleh ibunya yang juga tinggal dengannya. Mulyati berharap kali ini diberi pinjaman untuk bisa menambah modal usaha.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Murahna

texts.id:
Muranha is now living in a rented room with her husband. All of their children have got married and had their own business. They use the terrace in front of the room to do the business.

Muranha sews bags everyday. Bags that have been ready, then are brought to the nearest art shops that have ordered them. The business is quite hard for Muranha because she has to purchase the raw materials with her own money. Actually, the income she could earn is quite big. It depends on the number of bags she produces, that is why Muranha is hoping so much to earn loan to increase the capital for her business that will enable her to increase the number of bags produced.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Muranha saat ini tinggal disebuah rumah sederhana yang hanya memiliki satu kamar yang dipakai sebagai kamar tidur. Dia tinggal bersama suaminya. Semua anaknya sudah menikah dan sudah memiliki usaha sendiri. Rumahnya sekarang juga merupakan romah kontrakan, bukan milik sendiri. Didepan rumahnya ada teras yang dipakai sebagai tempat usaha. Sehari-harinya Murahna bekerja sebagai penjahit tas. Tas yang sudah selesai dijahit kemudian dibawa ke art shop yang sudah memesan terlebih dahulu. Karena bahan untuk membuat tas dan pernak-perniknya dari uangnya sendiri, Murahna merasa sangat keberatan. Padahal keuntungan yang didapat cukup banyk tergantung banyaknya jumlah tas yang dihasilkan. Oleh karena itu, Murahna sanagt mengharapkan bantuan modal untuk bisa melanjutkan usahanya.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Morn Yuos Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn Y. is the leader of this group in Koh Khtom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. The 35-year-old subsistence farmer has five children, four of whom are studying while the fifth is yet too young to attend school. In September of 2007, her youngest child got malaria, the treatment of which incurred unforeseen expenses. Mrs. Morn Y.’ husband, Mr. Kimsan Mork, is a farmer and pig breeder who also sometimes buys firewood to resell to the villagers.

Earning a small yearly income because she owns a small piece of land, Mrs Morn Y. now wants to expand her rice plantation and is therefore seeking a loan to buy additional land.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Suong Yim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Suong Y., the leader of this group of five members, lives in Chrok Kov Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 31 and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the others assist their parents at home. Her husband, Ny Seourn, is a farmer. Mrs. SuongY. is also a farmer and palm leaf sewer, but these two activities are not adequate to provide comfortable living conditions; she therefore wants to start another business and is asking for a loan to purchase fish to resell. The loan is necessary because in June of 2007, Mrs. Suong Y. got a bleeding cough, the treatment of which imposed unexpected expenses on the family, leaving insufficient money to start the new business.

(Mr. Erm M. was not available, so his wife is presented in the picture instead.)

loans.use: To purchase fish to resell to the villagers.

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mr. Erm Mek has finished the repayment for this loan term; he repaid $75 for his loan.

loans.name: Sahrah

texts.id:
Sahrah's daily activitiy is to sell toys in Pasar Badung, start from 5 to 7 a.m. She chooses to selli in that time because 5 to 7 a.m is the time when the market is very crowded with many customers. Sahrah always has to walk in the crowd to offer and sell her stuffs. Sometimes when she feels too tired, she sits and sells her stuffs on a piece of cloth.

She lives with her husband in a rented house in Jl.Kartini Denpasar. They have 4 children who all have already got married and live separately.

Sahrah hopes that she could use the loan she expects to earn to purchase more various toys to be sold.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan sehari-hari Sahrah adalah berjualan di Pasar Badung mulai dari pagi jam 5 sampai jam 7. Sengaja Sharah berjualan di jam tersebut karena merupakan jam sibuk, dimana banyak sekali pengunjung pasar. Sahrah harus berjalan keliling berdesak-desakan dengan pengunjung pasar untuk menjajakan dagangannya. Terkadang kalau dia kelelahan dia harus menggelar tikar atau karpet untuk menjajakan dagangannya. Saat ini bersama suaminya, dia tinggal di Jl.Kartini Denpasar. Mereka berdua tinggal di sebuah rumah kontrakan. Sahrah mempunyai 4 orang anak, tetapi semuanya sudah memiliki keluarga sendiri. Mereka semua sudah menikah. Sahrah beraharap dari pinjaman modal kali ini bisa dipakai untuk memperbanyak jenis jualannya.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Sunarya

texts.id:
Sunarya has started her business which is bags production since 6 years a go. She receives orders from area around Tuban almost everyday. The orders she receives keep her busy and do not allow her to do nothing. Now she receives quite big number of orders from an art shop that is her loyal customers, that require her to increase her capital that enable her to purchase raw materials. She hopes so much that DINARI will entrust her the loan.

The price of a bag she sells is around Rp.40.000 – Rp.60.000, depends on the style and difficulty during the making process. The income she earns from the business is enough to fulfill her daily needs and to pay her monthly house rent fee, Rp 275,000. She lives healthy together with her husband and children in a nice environment in Jl.Hyang Nyang Sari Tuban Bali.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan sebagai pengrajin dan penjahit tas sudah ditekuni sejak 6 tahun yang lalu..Pesanan untuk membuat tas didapat dari sekitar Tuban. Setiap hari selalu saja ada pesanan, sehingga Sunarya tidak pernah mengangur. Saat ini, karena terlalu banyaknya pesanan dari art shop langganannya, Sunarya butuh modal untuk membeli bahan baku. Dia sangat berharap melalui DINARI dia dapat menerima pinjaman itu. Harga tas yang sudah jadi berkisar antara Rp.40.000 – Rp.60.000, tergantung model dan tingkat kesulitan dalam membuatnya. Keuntungan yang diperoleh cukup untuk keperluan sehari-hari dan membayar kos per bulan sebesar Rp. 275.000. Keadaan tempat tinggalnya baik, lingkungannya juga sehat. Bersama suami dan anaknya yang berusia 3 tahun, saat ini Sunarya tinggal di Jl.Hyang Nyang Sari Tuban Bali.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Sok Sam Group

texts.en: Mrs. S. S., a farmer, is the leader of this group.  She is 49 and married with two children, both of whom are enrolled in state school.  In December 2007, one of the children got typhoid which cost $100 to cure. Her husband, Mr. Salim L., is a farmer who also generates an income from palm trees. Now living in a small house in Chrok Kov village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Mrs. S. S. and her family are having difficulty during the rainy season because of a bad roof. She is therefore seeking a loan to build a new house in the village. Previously, she obtained $250 from Acleda Bank to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to cultivate on her rice field.

loans.use: To build a new house to improve living conditions.

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mrs. Nov Chum decided to pay $3 in advance.

loans.name: Adabus

texts.id:
After paying his first loan, Adabus' mineral water selling business is increasing. He has many customers. Adabus usually sells 50 gallons of mineral water each day, and after receiving loan from DINARI, he is able to sell 100 gallons a day. His customers are not only those who live near him, but also those who live away from him. Adabus charges various delivery cost for various distance of delivery. he plans to use the proposed loan to increase his capital to enlarge his business.

Now Adabus is living with his wife and children. They rent a land and built a semi-permanent house on it.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Sejak melunasi pinjaman periode pertama, usaha Adabus mengalami perkembangan sampai saat ini. Usaha jual air mineral kelilingnya cukup banyak memiliki pelanggan. Biasanya dia berjualan air mineral sampai 50 galon per hari. Tapi sejak mendapat pinjaman dari DINARI dia bisa mendapatkan pelanggan sampai 100 galon air mineral per hari. Konsumennya bukan hanya penduduk sekitar rumahnya tetapi juga berada di tempat yang jauh. Untuk ongkos mengantar bervariasi tergantung jarak pelanggan. Recananya, pinjaman kali ini akan dijadikan modal tambahan sehingga nantinya usahanya bisa lebih besar dan maju. Saat ini Adabus S. tinggal bersama istri dan anaknya. Mereka menyewa tanah per tahunda membangun rumah semi permanen diatasnya. Keadaan keluarganya sehat.

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Khom Tuy Group

texts.en: Mrs. Khom T. is the group leader of five members in Cham Bak Phém Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. A Khmer cake seller and farmer, she is 51 and a widow with four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others stay at home to help their mother sell Khmer cake in the village. In the dry season this year, Mrs. Khom T. hired a laborer to work on her rice plantation. She now does not have enough money to pay for the laborer, and is thus seeking a loan for this purpose. Previously, Mrs. Khom T. obtained a loan to buy fish to resell in order to support the family.

loans.use: To pay for a laborer hired to work on her rice plantation during dry season.

loans.name: Zuril Ina

texts.id:
Zuril lives in a rented room in Jl.Sunia Negara together with her husband and her 3 months old baby. She sells food in a booth in front of her rented room. Her customers are her surrounding neighbors. The economic conditions, when her husband's income can not afford their daily needs, has forced her to do the business.

Zuril hopes that the loan she expects to earn from DINARI can be used to purchase more stuffs to be sold in her booth that can attract more customers.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Zuril saat ini tinggal di Jl.Sunia Negara di sebuah kamar kost bersama suami dan anaknya yang masih berumur 3 bulan. Usaha sehari-hari yang dijalani oleh Zuril ialah berjualan makanan disebuah warung didepan kostnya. Pelanggannya adalah orang-orang disekitar tempat tinggalnya. Keadaan ekonomi keluarganya yang tidak mampu memaksa Zuril harus ikut bekerja membantu suami menambah penghasilan. Penghasilan suaminya tidak mencukupi untuk kebutuhan rumah tangga dan membayar uang sewa kamar per bulannya. Zuril berharap, dengan adanya pinjaman dari DINARI dia bisa memperbesar warungnya sehingga makin banyak pelanggan yang datang.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Luluk

texts.id:
Luluk’s daily work is a trader of electrical appliances. These electrical appliances include bulbs, fluorescent tubes, switches, circuit breaker, cables and various other types of electric appliances. A mother aged 33 years has been in this profession for sometime. At this moment Luluk needs additional funding very much in order to be able to add more variety and quantity of appliances offered. With her husband, I Ketut Widiani, they live in Kepaon Denpasar. They live in a home leased under the annual payment plan.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Pekerjaan sehari-hari Luluk adalah sebagai pedagang alat-alat listrik. Adapun alat-alat listrik yang dijualnya seperti balon lampu, neon, saklar, stop kontak, kabel dan berbagai macam peralatan listrik lainnya. Ibu berusia 33 tahun ini sudah lama menekuni profesi ini. Saat ini Luluk sangat membutuhkan modal tambahan untuk bisa menambah jenis dan jumlah alat listrik ditokonya. Bersama suaminya I Ketut Widiani, mereka tinggal di Kepaon Denpasar. Mereka tinggal di sebuah rumah kontrakan dengan sistem bayaran per tahun.

loans.use: Additional Funding for Business (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Abdul Sabor

texts.en: Abdul Sabor lives in district 5 of Kabul Afghanistan. Hhe is educated and married. He is a carpenter with a small shop and lots of clients. Abdul wants to enlarge his shop, so he is requesting loan to buy the necessary materials. This will enable him to provide for more customers and increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase materials to expand his carpentry shop

loans.name: Abdul Sabor

texts.en: Abdul Sabor is a young father. He is a very hard worker and has video caste shop in a crowded shopping area in Kabul. He is requesting a loan to import more CDs and DVDs for his shop. This will improve his business and create a better financial condition for his family.

loans.use: To export more CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheab T. and his wife, Mrs. Phy Sam, were married in 1990 and have seven children; four sons and three daughters. Five of their children are in school and other two are still young and stay at home. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sopheab has been a fisherman for ten years and also sells bananas. His wife has been in the business of selling bananas at Ta Khmao market for six years. He carries the bananas to Phnom Penh on his motorbike. Now, he needs a motorbike trailer to carry the bananas to make the trip more comfortable and efficient.

He is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike trailer to carry the bananas he will sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike trailer to carry bananas to the market

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Mrs. Ky C., 41, and her husband, Mr. Bo Phang, 42, were married in 1986 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. All of their children are in school. Mr. Bo has been a mason for ten years. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Ky has been a farmer for five years. She grows a few different kinds of spinach on her farrm, which is not far from her house. Now she wants to start a new business raising pigs. She is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha P. and her husband, Mr. Khai Kong were married in 1981 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. One of their sons is married and lives outside of the family home, and other one is in school. Their two daughters weave silk at home. The family lives across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Her husband has been building wooden houses for three years. The couple is in the process of repairing their home.

Mrs. Sokha has been a weaver and a vegetable seller since she was young. These are skills that she learned from her mother. She sells vegetables in the morning at the village market and weaves silk at home at the afternoon. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who sells them in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of US$1000. With the loan, and the money they have saved, they want to finish their house.

loans.use: To add to her own money for finishing her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en:
Mrs. Ratha Y. and her husband, Mr. Buntha Bo, were married in 2007 and have one son. The couple lives with their parents, brothers, and sisters. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Ratha has been a weaver since 2000. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who take them to Phnom Penh to be sold. Her husband has been a driver since he was eighteen years old.

Last year, Mrs. Ratha started a busines raising pigs. She is now requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase 12 piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase 12 piglets

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoeun Mom and her husband, Mr. Sarin Phoung, were married in 1984 and have four children; one son and three daughters.
