One of her daughters is married and lives in the family home, two children are in school, and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Mom has been a weaver for over ten years, but now she is transferring her loom to her daughter to continue her business.

Mr. Sarin has been a mason for five years. It’s a skill he learns from his neighbor. Mrs. Mom is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mohammad Nadar

texts.en: Mohammad Nadar lives in district 8 of Kabul Afghanistan. He is not formally educated, but he has been involved in the bakery business for more than 9 years. He learned this business from his father. He is requesting a loan so he can open another bakery that will be his own business.

loans.use: To start a new bakery business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng S. and his wife, Mrs. Thary Noun, were married in 1986 and have four children; one son and three daughters. Three of their children are in school and one of their daughters works in garment factory. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Heng has been a village doctor for eleven years. His wife sells medicine at home. He is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike for his family's use.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for the family's use

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheab C. and her husband, Mr. Phally Heng, were married in 2003 and have two children; one son and one daughter. The couple lives with their parents, brothers, and sisters. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sopheab has been a weaver for over ten years. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. Her husband is a silk weaver, as well. He has been in this business for seven years. The couple sells their finished product to the middle man in the village who will takes them to Phnom Penh to sell.

Mrs. Sopheab is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny N. and her husband, Mr. Sothea Sor, were married in 1996 and have two children; one son and one daughter. Both of their children are in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Ny is a construction worker for a company in her village. Before starting this job, she cut grass to sell as a cow feed, but changed her job, because construction work can earn more income. Her husband has been a mason for four years. He works in the village and in a nearby province.

Mrs. Ny is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase a motorbike to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to ride to work.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Miss Sopheab M. is single and lives with her mother, who is a farmer, and her younger brother, who builds wooden houses. The family lives on an island on Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Miss Sopheab has been a weaver for over ten years. It’s a skill she learns from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who will sell them in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of US$800 to purchase a construction crane for her brother use to build wooden houses.

loans.use: To purchase construction crane

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Mrs. Lam M. and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Thorn, were married in 1990 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. Their daughter weaves silk at home and the other two children are in school. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for eighteen years.

Mrs. Lam has been selling Khmer noodles and desserts in front of her home for three years. Now, she wants to start a new business raising pigs. She is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for raising.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is married; she is 35 years old with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. Her provisions range from milk, beverages, and soap to drinks items like juice. She started her business 1997. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more provisions and drinks for sales. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy fruit juice, drinks and provisions for sales

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate E. is a creative woman. Her creativity is seen in her skill, which is the designing of clothes. She acquired this skill by training. Kate is 37 years old, and she is married with 4 children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Kate needs a loan of $600 to buy more clothes, tailoring materials and provisions for sales. Kate has been borrowing form LAPO microfinance for 5 years. Kate needs the loan to enable her to increase her sales so as to meet with her increasing customer demands.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, tailoring materials and provisions for sales

loans.name: Jurka

texts.en: Jurka is a  48-years-old widow with two children from the town Derventa. She receives monthly disabled benefits in the amount of 500 KM. Jurka is requesting a loan so she can buy seeds and cultivate her land. This is her second loan at the MCO WWI. She will sell the vegetables she raises, which will increase her monthly incomes.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Stana

texts.en: Stana was born in 1969. She lives with her husband and their four children in the town Derventa. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 800 KM. They also receive a monthly children’s allowance. This is her second loan in the amount of 1200 KM and Stana will use it for land cultivation. By taking this loan Stana will be able to cultivate more land and she will be able to provide larger income for her family.

loans.use: For land cultivation.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Osarumwense

texts.en: Osarumwense O. is 33 years old. She is married with 3 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, and she has been in the business of selling cooked food and drinks for 4 years. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for 4 years. Osarumwese is an energetic woman. Her business requires human energy and financial support. Her numerous customers are increasing day by day because she cooks well. She needs a loan of $450 to buy foodstuffs and a generator to enable her cool the drinks for her customers, as an alterative to when the power supply fails.

loans.use: To buy a generator and foodstuffs for cooking

loans.name: Taj Muhammad

texts.en:
Its Taj M., son of S. M., is 29 and is the father of 4 children.
Taj M. lives in district 1 of Ningarhar province and has a Video and CD shop in Jalalabad City. He is requesting a loan to improve his small business and increase his customers. He will use the loan to purchase more CDs and movies for his shop.

loans.use: To buy more CDs and movies for his shop

loans.name: Mercy O

texts.en: Mercy O E.’s business is distinguished from other shops around her because of the unique way she arranges the drugs and provisions in her shop. She was able to arrange the pharmaceuticals in various sections, but makes them look uniform, and the provisions are in other sections of the shop that made it so colorful and attractive to customers. She has been in the business now for 8 years, and she also has been borrowing from LAPO microfinance for the past 8 years. She is 37 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Mercy needs the sum of $875 to buy more drugs and provisions for sale so that she can serve her increasing customers better.

loans.use: To buy more drugs and provisions for sales

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is business-focused and very determined to improve her business. Cecilia is 49 years old and married; she has 7 children and she lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for 8 years. Cecilia sells drinks and water, and she needs the sum of $1200 to buy more drinks and water from the producers so that she can serve her customers better. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for the company

loans.name: Ana Daisy

texts.en: Ana Daisy is an entrepreneur who works extremely hard to support her two daughters, who are 8 and 13 years old, respectively. Ana recently started a small business where she sells jewels, and she operates this business from her home. Ideally, she would like to operate her business out of a separate location, but she will accomplish that goal down the road. She is hereby seeking a loan to buy a collection of new items to add to her stock in order to hopefully increase her sales volume and to thereby generate greater revenue. In turn, she believes that she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of additional jewels for a small business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is a young and promising entrepreneur who is working hard to earn a living and to fend for her newborn daughter.  Milly operates a small business, which she started just one and a half years ago, where she sells silver jewels. Milly’s big dream is to own a big establishment where she can sell a great deal of jewels and other women’s clothing.  Meanwhile, she’ll keep working hard to offer new products to her customers and to attract new customers. With this loan, Milly would like to buy more goods to add to her stock.

loans.use: To puchase additional silver jewels to retail in her community.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita Osemwengie is 53 years old. She is married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for 5 years. She sells provisions and drinks. She needs a loan of $875 to buy more provisions and drinks. She wants to increase her sales, as her customers are increasing.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Mrs. Paullina U. is 51 years old, married and has 7 children. She finished the repayment of the last Kiva loan. According to her, the loan was really helpful to her. Hence with the loan she was able to serve her customers better. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes to improve her business, so she is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more women's clothing for sale. She thanks you for this opportunity for her business.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothing and hats for sales

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.en: These are the seven members of the Faraja group in Mbagala, a Dar es Salaam city suburb.  They are a group of grandmothers who take care of orphans. They weave and make candles and sell them to supermarkets. The income generated helps them to sustain a living and send their grandchildren to school. They are in need of a loan to help them expand their business.

loans.use: Expand business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Philo

texts.en: Mrs. Philo I. is 42 years old, and she lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She is married with 2 children. She deals in plastics, so she is requesting for a loan of $1200 to enable her buy more plastics for sales. She has been borrowing from LAPO for more than 10 years now. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more plastics for sales

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary O. is 49 years of age; she lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She is married with 5 children, and she sells frozen items such as chicken and foods, which she learned form her sister and started 2005. She is asking for a loan of $875 to enable her buy more frozen items for sales to improve her business. She has been a LAPO client for 2 years as a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy more frozen items such as chicken and food for sales

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Mrs. Adesuwa I.is 46 years of age, married, and has 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells frozen foods such as chicken and turkey. She has been in business since 2005. Due to the increase in demand of products, she is requesting $875 to buy more frozen food for sales. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods for sales

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
A. Doris prepares a native food called fante kenkey. Maize is used in the preparation of fante kenkey. It is highly desired by the natives of both western and central regions of the country. She is married and has 6 dependants.

Her business is doing very well, and she wants to increase her production and sales. She is running out of ingredients for her making fante kenkey. She is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients for producing more kenkey to sell.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for making fante kenkey

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria E. is 47 years old, a widow with 6 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 5 years. She sells rice and beans. She is requesting $875 to enable her buy more rice and beans for sales.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth I. is 55 years old. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She is married with 5 children, and she sells provisions and drinks, which she learned from her mother and started 2000. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to enable her buy more provisions and drinks for sales, to improve in her business. She has been a LAPO client for 6 years as a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: La Reforma Group

texts.en:
Cristina lives in San Pedro de Macoris with her six children (ages: 23, 21, 18, 16, 13, and 10 years old) and her husband. Cristina sells food from a small stand outside of her house, and she would like to use the proceeds from this loan to buy more merchandise for her business. Her dream for the future is to be able to open her own restaurant, and she would like all of her children to attend university so that they might have a better life than she has had. According to Cristina, her biggest problem as of late is earning enough money to get by on a daily basis. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to expand her business, and that she will have enough money to pay for basic life necessities.

Esperanza would like to thank every Kiva lender for their support and generosity. God Bless!

loans.use: To expand a food stand by purchasing additional products such as meat, fruit, and vegetables.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Mrs. Philomena Onorunose is 42 years old, and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with 6 children. She sells firewood, which she learned from her mother and started 1987. She is requesting a loan of $875 to enable her buy more wood for sales. She is a trader and has been in LAPO for 4 years as a dedicated client. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for sale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
A. Jane buys maize in large quantities and sells smaller quantities to her customers. She is not yet married.

Her business is doing very well, and she wants to increase sales. She is running out of stock. So she is requesting a loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Creciendo Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.en:
Petrolina lives with her 2 children (ages: 16,18) in San Pedro de Macoris. She currently runs a small cafeteria in a local school, where children can come to buy snacks during lunch time. With this loan, she would like to buy her most popular merchandise in bulk so that she can make more of a profit. She loves children, she has a passion for teaching, and she hopes that one day she will be able to open a private school in her neighborhood. Right now, the most important thing on her mind is raising and educating her own children, and supporting them in their educational pursuits.

Thank you for supporting and encouraging these women, and we look forward to watching them grow and succeed!

loans.use: To purchase merchandise in bulk in order to increase the stock of an existing cafeteria.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
E. Charlotte sells food. She is married and has 4 children. Her business is doing very well, and she wants to increase sales. She is running out of goods to sell.
She is a requesting a loan to buy more food to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. is 37 years old, married and has three children. She sells provisions and drinks. This was the business she learned from her mother. She has five years experience in business. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of $450 for her to buy drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Estelista

texts.es:
Estelista is a hardworking woman and dedicated to what she has been doing for over 10 years, selling baby and infant clothing. Her dedication helps her sales, which she conducts on Sunday in the markets on Huancavelica in her locality, and she has the newest designs. Estelista remembers the days when she first started her enterprise after a business transfer, and she had to endeavor greatly to capture customers. To continue her efforts, she seeks a loan to acquire a greater amount of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Estelista, es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a lo que hace y lo demuestran sus 10 años de experiencia vendiendo ropas para bebés y niños pequeños, su dedicación favorece las ventas que realiza los días domingos en las ferias de la calle Huancavelica en su localidad, y está a los nuevos diseños. Estelista recuerda aquellos días en que ella inició su negocio después de un traspaso comercial y le costó mucho esfuerzo captar clientes. Para continuar ese gran esfuerzo solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de prendas.

loans.use: Increase of capital to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Elizabeth Doris

texts.en:
A. Elizabeth Doris prepares a native food called kenkey. Maize is used for the preparation of kenkey. It is in great demand by the natives of Greater Accra region of the country. She is married and has 3 children.

Business is doing very well, and she wants to increase production and sales. She is running out of ingredients for her food production. She is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients to increase production of kenkey.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for creating kenkey

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
Margoth has an internal fortitude motivated by the love of a mother for her only child. She has gotten ahead after many failures that didn’t permit her to practice her profession as a teacher. Not long ago, she decided to sell groceries at a stand in the market and it has proven to be a good option to sustain her family on a daily basis; the family includes only her son and her mother, with whom she shares her days. She greatly enjoys her mother’s company, and she now wishes to increase her merchandise and that way grow her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Margoth, tiene una fortaleza interna motivada por el amor de madre hacia su único hijo. Ella sale adelante después de muchos fracasos que no le permitían ejercer su profesión de maestra. Hace poco decidió vender abarrotes en un puesto de mercado la cual ha sido y es una buena opción para lograr el sustento diario de su familia: que son únicamente su hijo y su madre con quienes comparte los días. Ella disfruta mucho de la compañía de su madre y ahora su deseo es incrementar su mercadera y así acrecentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Increase capital to offer a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is married with eight children. She sells foodstuffs such as plantains, cassava (garri) and corn. She also sells mortars, small hard bowls in which one can crush substances such as seeds and grains into powders with a special object called pestle. She is 50 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 1988. She needs the loan  of $450 to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more corn and other foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth Doris

texts.en:
A. Elizabeth Doris prepares a native food called ‘kenkey’. Maize is used for the preparation of the kenkey. It is highly patronized by the natives of Greater Accra region of the country. She is married and has 3 children. Business is doing very well she wishes to increase production and sales. She is running out of ingredients for her food production.She is in a blue skirt at the extreme left in the picture.

She is asking for an additional capital to buy more food items for her food production.

loans.use: As an additional capital to buy more food items for her food production.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 45 year old mother of five. Her eldest child is married and the other four are still in school. She has two separate businesses: a half acre sweet potato plantation; and a charcoal selling business. The sweet potato plantation bears crops every 4 months which she can sell for $50 - although she has to hire someone to harvest the crop at a cost of $13. She buys bags of charcoal for $10 and sells them for $14. Margret is still looking for a loan to enable her to continue buying charcoal.  Her profits are all spent on school fees and she needs the loan to repurchase stock.

loans.use: To buy charcoal stock.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora works tirelessly for the well-being of her two children who still live with her. She wants to help them get ahead, which is the reason she works despite the pain she suffers from osteoporosis. The best alternative for Teodora is the sale of clothing throughout various locations of the city and she seeks a loan to increase her product and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Teodora, trabaja incansablemente por el bienestar de sus 2 hijos que aún viven con ella. Desea ayudarlos a superarse y esta fue la razón por la cual ella trabaja a pesar de las dolencias que padece a causa de la osteoporosis que sufre. La mejor opción para Teodora es la venta de prendas de vestir por diferentes puntos de la ciudad y solicita un préstamo para acrecentar sus ofertas y ganancias.

loans.use: Increase of capital to raise sales.

loans.name: Cesarea Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca started her business selling shoes by catalog to meet her basic economic needs, given that when she became a widow she was left without any means of support. For this reason, she started selling shoes so she could get ahead with the immediate requirements of the household. She started four years ago selling to friends, neighbors and acquaintances and little by little has increased her customer base thereby attaining better earnings.

She needs a loan of $575USD, to be repaid in six months, to purchase more merchandise and therefore be able to make more sales. With your support, Francisca will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca inició su negocio de venta de zapatos por catalogo para solventar sus necesidades económicas ya que cuando enviudo se quedo sin un sustento económico por esto emprendió la venta de zapatos para poder salir adelante con las necesidades propias del hogar. Comenzó hace 4 años vendiendo entre amigos, vecinos y familiares y poco a a poco ha incrementado su cartera de clientes obteniendo mejores ingresos.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así tener mayor venta. Con tu Apoyo Francisca lograra salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna is very dedicated to her guinea pig farm, which she implemented in her house over nine years ago, starting at first to use for her own consumption. Later, after noticing the interest, she increased her capacity and invested capital into acquiring more guinea pigs. She fills orders for her demanding customer base, and they are used during festivities. Her wish is to get ahead and, for this reason, she is seeking a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Reyna, está muy dedicada a su granja D. cuyes implementada en su casa hace más D. 9 años y que en sus inicios fue para consumo propio, después D. darse cuenta D. su acogida aumentó su capacidad D. crianza y su capital D. inversión para adquirir más cuyes. ElL. cubre pedidos D. acuerdo a su más exigente clienteL., y estos son utilizados en ambientes festivos. Su deseo es seguir adelante y por ello solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Capital to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en: Felicita is a 49 year old mother of 9 children. Her kids are all between the ages of 18 and 29 and she supports two of them at university. She has three different businesses that she manages completely on her own.  She has chickens that she buys as chicks, rears and then sells for meat when they are adults. At the moment she has around 90 chickens (some layers, some broilers and some local breed). She also has 3 pigs which she also buys young and sells for meat.  As well as her meat businesses, she has water in a large tank which she sells by the jerry can to the locals, and she has a small jack fruit plantation. Her main business is her poultry which she buys for $5 each, rears for 2 months, and sells for $30.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and feed

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia raises cattle for the production of cheese and butter. She recently began selling the milk as well. Amelia is satisfied to see that she has increased her herd over time.

Amelia has had several tragedies befall her due to unexpectedly cold weather and outbreaks of tuberculosis in her herd.

Amelia wishes to continue her business and to this end requests a loan. She will invest this loan in her stable, improving it for her herd.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Amelia, se dedica a la crianza D. vacas D. las que se sirve para fabricar queso y mantequilla, ahora han decidido vender su leche también y está contenta porque con el tiempo ha visto acrecentar la cantidad D. animales que tenia en un inicio, Amelia ha tenido muchos fracasos en el cultivo D. tubérculos y demás productos por la inclemencia del frío. Desea seguir trabajando y para este fin solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá para mejorar las instalaciones D. su establo.

loans.use: Repair and remodel the stable to protect livestock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Jane-Mary

texts.en: Jane-Mary (aged 52) has a bar which she has owned and managed since 2001.  She opens seven days a week from mid-morning until midnight selling a variety of beers and spirits to the public.  She has two workers, who are paid $12 each per month and allowed to sleep in a room she has built for them at the back of the bar.  She is looking to borrow funds to enable her to buy beer in large quantities and therefore increase her profits.  She can buy one crate of beer for $19 and sell it for $25.  Jane-Mary has 4 children who are all married and she pays the school fees for her 4 grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy beer in large quantities for her bar and therefore increase profits.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga has spent many years working in different industries. The need to provide for four children has provided her with the drive to better her families situation. To this end, one year ago, Olga opened a billiard hall in her home. She manages this as a healthy place of entertainment.

Olga’s hope is to fix up her home and the billiard hall in order to create a more attractive space and bring in more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Olga, trabajó durante muchos años en diversos negocios y la urgencia de sostener a sus 4 hijos era la fuerza de mayor razón que la empujaba a salir de su situación. Es así que desde hace 1 año abrió un billar en su propia casa, un centro de diversión sana, que ella administra. Su deseo es mejorar su espacio de trabajo e implementarlo para hacerlo más llamativo a fin de albergar mayores visitas.

loans.use: Repair and improve the billiard hall.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hebreo Group

texts.en:
Y. lives with his wife and two children (ages: 12, 15) in the busy town of San Pedro D. Macoris. He owns a small street-siD. business where he sells a variety of fried foods. This loan will be used to buy flour, oil, meat, and vegetables for the popular Dominican food called “empanada”. In the future, he would like to move his business from the street to a proper store where he would be able sell a variety of different foods. Y. loves his children, and he takes great priD. in sending them to a good school. He hopes that once his business grows even more he will be able to start saving for their college education.

Thank you for supporting this group, and we look forward to watching these 5 entrepreneurs improve their businesses and lives!

loans.use: To purchase additional flour, oil, vegetables, and meat to make "empanadas"

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina works very hard everyday at the job that allows her to be a source of income for her household. She wants her 2 kids to be well looked after, and it is this desire that serves as constant motivation for her to keep on working and looking after her shop. Dina wants to keep progressing in business with her family and this is why she wants to open a small sewing workshop to make aprons too.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Dina, emprende a diario y con mucho esfuerzo un trabajo que le permite ser una fuente sostenedora de su hogar. Sus deseos de superación por el bienestar de sus 2 hijos la motivan constantemente para continuar con su trabajo de administrar su tienda.Dina quiere seguir progresando en compañía de su familia es por eso que también quiere implementar su pequeño taller de costura para confeccionar mandiles.

loans.use: To get a sewing workshop/Implementación de su taller de costura.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana is a young woman who wants to progress in life and who is constantly looking to further develop herself. She wants to have a business which will allow her to support her dearest parents and her family. She is asking for a loan with which she can buy more and better products for her store in order to fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Liliana, es una joven con muchos deseos de progreso y está en constante búsqueda de nuevos horizontes de desarrollo para su vida, quiere emprender un negocio que se convertirá en el principal sostén de sus amados padres y su familia. Solicita un préstamo para implementar con más y mejores productos su pequeño establecimiento a fin de concretar sus deseos.

loans.use: To obtain capital to set up her grocery store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina and her husband work together in a small locksmiths that they both look after. Aquilina is in charge of the work contacts and her husband concentrates on doing the jobs. They made a firm decision to start this business and they set out with the necessary equipment and the right knowledge, and this has been a great help when making metal files, tables, bars etc. Their desire is to keep going in this vein and to improve their production, consolidating their metalic carpentry and their production of all types of furniture. They are happy because they have been doing this noble labour for 10 years and they want to improve their business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Aquilina y su esposo trabajan juntos en un pequeño taller de cerrajería que ellos mismos administran, Aquilina se encarga de hacer los contactos de trabajo y su esposo de concretar esos trabajos, su decisión fue firme cuando empezaron a implementar su taller con los equipos necesarios, los conocimientos adquiridos por su esposo hoy son una gran herramienta que aporta a la elaboración de estructuras de metal como carpetas, mesas, mostradores, etc. El deseo de ambos es seguir incursionando en este rubro y mejorar la producción consolidándose como carpinteros metálicos y produciendo todo tipo de muebles, se sienten satisfechos porque esta noble labor está cumpliendo 10 años y quieren mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: An injection of capital to improve their workspace/Inyección de capital para mejorar su espacio de trabajo.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Jackelyne

texts.es:
Jacqueline is a young working woman that is always looking to get ahead. Her will to be independent and improve herself led her to start her own business by selling cosmetics. She would like to get a greater amount of cosmetics so that she can increase her customer base and her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Jacqueline, es una joven empeñosa y trabajadora que siempre ha buscado salir adelante, sus deseos de superación y auto sostenimiento la han conducido a dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos. Desea adquirir mayor cantidad de cosméticos para ampliar su cartera de clientes y por ende sus ganacias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (cosmetics) for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel started the business because her job as a teacher did not bring in enough money to cover her family's numerous expenses. For this reason she began her own business hoping to generate extra income. The business started eight years ago and it has been doing very well. She first started selling merchandise to people that she knew and they, in turn, recommended her service to others, increasing the total number of clients. Up to this day, she is still sought after by a great number of customers that want to purchase shoes and clothes. They know she makes split-payments deals that makes it easier for them to obtain what they want.

She requests a credit line in the amount of US500.00, that will be paid off in 2 months, to purchase more of the season's merchandise because she has many orders that she has not been able to fulfill.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

María Isabel inició el negocio debido a que su trabajo como maestra no le dejaba suficientes ingresos y tiene muchos gastos en su casa, por esa razón se decidió a emprender mi propio negocio para sacar un ingreso extra. Comenzó hace 8 años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, en un inicio vendía únicamente a personas conocidas pero después la fueron recomendando con otras personas y su círculo de ventas se fue incrementando. Al día de hoy ya cuenta con un buen volumen de clientes que la buscan para comprar ropa y calzado, como saben que les da algunas facilidades de pago, la gente no tienen gran problema en conseguir lo que andan buscando.

Solicita un crédito por $500 que pagara en 2 meses para conseguir mercancía de temporada porque tiene varios pedidos pendientes que no ha podido surtir por falta de recursos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mehida

texts.es:
Each day Mehida's wish is to improve her economic situation, so she decided to do two things: firstly to sell propane filled balloons, and secondly to sell cosmetics. Mehida started doing these two things 6 years ago and her dream is to be able to improve the infraestructure of her house so that she can open up an adecuate area to sell her indespensible products from, as many housewives from the local area buy them from her.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Mehida, en sus deseos de mejorar cada día su situación económica decidió dedicarse a dos actividades: la principal es la venta de balones con gas propano y la segunda a la cosmetología.Son 6 años que Mehida realiza estas labores y su sueño es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su casa e implementar un local adecuado para ofertar desde este espacio el indispensable combustible para muchas amas de casa de su localidad.

loans.use: An injection of capital to make a suitable space to sell things from her house/Inyección de capital para implementar en su hogar un espacio adecuado de ventas.

loans.name: Jose Arnulfo

texts.es:
Arnulfo got involved in this line of business when he was very young. It has been the family's business. His parents dedicated themselves to the pottery business trade which he later inherited. He has kept the family's tradition alive. He is still involved because it provides a source of income for his family. The neighborhood where he lives has a high concentration of pottery shops. He started thirty years ago by selling hand-made pottery to neighboring communities. Currently, there are orders being made from places such as, San Luis Potosi and Poza Rica Veracruz. His business is growing and needs more investment.

He is requesting a credit line in the amount of US$625.00, which will be repaid in 6 months. It will be used to purchase more material used in manufacturing the hand-made pieces. Also, more clients and orders are coming in which require more investment as well.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Arnulfo inició el negocio desde muy pequeño, empezó primero como un negocio familiar, sus padres se dedicaron al negocio de alfarería el cual heredo y hasta la fecha continua con la tradición familiar, actualmente continua porque de ahí obtiene ingresos familiares, de hecho en la comunidad en la que vive la mayoría son talleres de alfarería. Comenzó hace 30 años fabricando artesanías vendiéndolas en las comunidades cercanas, actualmente surte pedidos a San Luis Potosí y Poza Rica Veracruz, y como su negocio va en crecimiento tiene la necesidad de hacer mayor inversión.

Solicita un crédito por US $625 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir material para la fabricación de las artesanías, actualmente ha ampliado su cartera de clientes y tiene mayores pedidos, por lo que requiero de más inversión

loans.use: Purchase material for work.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.es:
Silvestre started a his career with a natural-water retail business. Later, he began selling electronic equipment but, when he realized that the income generated was small and fell short of covering family's expenses, and with his brother's assistance, he started a business of forged-metal doors. They have built a clientele that have pushed profits upwards. Nowadays, they own a blacksmith shop that has been doing well, although he still sells water on the weekends.

He is requesting a credit line in the amount of $575.00, to be repaid within six months, to purchase more material for the shop and the season's fruits. He is hopeful that with Kiva's help he will be able to achieve this. p> Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Silvestre inicio el negocio en la venta de aguas naturales en un tianguis, después empezó vendiendo aparatos electrónicos, al ver que los ingresos eran pocos, y no le alcanzaba para los gastos económicos de la familia, entonces con la ayuda de su hermano iniciaron la elaboración de puertas de forja y empezaron hacerse de clientes, incrementando sus ganancias, hasta la actualidad que ya tienen una herrería, y les ha ido muy bien, pero también sigue con la venta de aguas naturales aunque solo los fines de semana, por que entre semana se dedica a la herrería.

Ahora esta solicitando de un crédito de US $575 que pagara a 6 meses, para comprar la material para herrería y fruta de temporada, tiene la esperanza que con el apoyo de Kiva, podrá lograrlo.

loans.use: Purchase more material.

loans.name: Francisco Camilo

texts.es:
Don Francisco is married and has 3 school-aged children. He lives in the Altagracia neighborhood of Managua, Nicaragua and he works as a welder. At 39 years of age, he has 10 years of experience in this field and he earns enough to support his family. His wife is an office worker and helps him with household expenses because they want to get ahead and to give their children a good education. Don Francisco wants to improve his shop’s appearance, and for that reason he is asking for credit. With the credit he will purchase construction materials in order to improve the facade not only of his business but also of his home. This will give his clients a better impression while simultaneously improving his own quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Francisco es casado y tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar. Habita en el barrio Altagracia de Managua y se dedica al oficio de soldadura eléctrica. A sus 39 años de edad, tiene 10 años de experiencia en este negocio que le dá el sustento para su familia. Su esposa es oficinista y le apoya en los gastos del hogar, porque como familia desen salir adelante y brindarle educación a sus hijos. Don Francisco desea mejorar las condiciones del local, es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar la fachada tanto de su negocio como de su hogar, para así poder brindar una mejor presentación a sus clientes, al mismo tiempo que mejora también sus calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials in order to improve the facade of his business and his home.

loans.name: Magda Verónica

texts.es:
Magda J. lives in the “Tierra Prometida” [Promised Land] neighborhood of Managua, Nicaragua. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children studying in elementary school. Her husband is an inspector and helps bring income into the home. Magda is a hair stylist and she maintains a small beauty salon in her own home where she serves clients. She also sells cosmetics and general merchandise. Her small business began through her own efforts and with financing. With the current loan she hopes to be able to improve her house and thereby her beauty salon in order to create better working conditions. Eventually, with future earnings, she would like to separate her home and her beauty salon, and she would also like to have a small cosmetics and assorted goods store.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Magda J. habita en el Barrio Tierra Prometida de Managua, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos niños que se encuentran estudiando la educación primaria. Su esposo es inspector y aporta en la economía de la familia. Magda es estilista y posee en su casa de habitación un pequeño salon de belleza en donde atiende a sus clientes, al mismo tiempo se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y mercadería en general. Su pequeño negocio lo comenzó con esfuerzo propio y con financiamientos. Con el préstamo requerido espera poder mejorar su vivienda y por ende su negocio de salón de belleza para así poder tener mejores condiciones de trabajo y en un futuro con la ganacias obtenidas pueda independizar el salón de belleza y su hogar, y también desea tener una pequeña tienda de cosméticos y mercadería variada.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials in order to improve her home

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Madam Hawa B. was overwhelmed with joy with her last loan from Kiva. Her family depends solely on her income.  She is grateful that her profits increased and during the loan period she was able to meet her family’s basic needs. She completed paying her installments in March and is requesting another of loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Increase her stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther B. is very thankful and grateful to Kiva and shall always remain thankful to Kiva for their kind gesture. The loan, she said, is a great blessing. She is realizing a profit from the business and an increase in stock. She said that Kiva is a life saver for poor women like her. She feels strong and filled with hope that one day she will drive herself and her children out of poverty. Esther would like to continue expanding her fish business and is requesting a loan to purchase 2 baskets of dried fish.

loans.use: To purchase more baskets of dried fish to increase stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Kerelie

texts.en: Kerelie, a widow, is very thankful to Kiva for the previous loan.  Kiva's loan has helped her tremendously. From the profits, her family can now have food to eat and clothes to wear. Her business is progressing and she is sure, with Kiva, her life will be better. She has already completed paying her installments and is requesting another loan.

loans.use: To increase stock and income.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura, a single mother of four children, lives in Monte Plata where she operates a small shop offering women’s clothes and jewelry to people of the neighborhood. Maura explains that it was a terrible blow for her raise four children on her own after her husband passed away. “Nonetheless, God has helped me a lot, and He gave me strength to work hard and move my business forward.

Maura explains that maintaining the cash flow is sometimes a hard task, but she hopes that her new collection of fashionable garments will help her business be more profitable than before.

Maura says that she’ll keep working hard in order to provide a comfortable lifestyle with her children.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes and jewels for a small shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a young, enthusiastic, budding entrepreneur who lives in the Sabana Grande de Boyá community of Monte Plata. She’ll have her Secondary Education certificate in a few months, and she’s ready to study Business Administration at the public university in Santo Domingo, the capital.

To make a living and save money in order to start her studies, Esther sells garments to men of her community. She says that she has a lot of customers, including teachers and students of her school, neighbors that have a good job, and other friends.

With her loan, Esther will buy more goods in order to increase her sales volume, and thus her income. That way, the entrepreneur hopes that she’ll be in a better situation to reach her goals and move ahead.

loans.use: To buy men's clothing to retail in her community.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Esnilda

texts.en:
Esnilda is twenty-five years old, and she and her husband have two daughters, aged of four and eight. To supplement the family’s income, she sells costume jewelry to women of her community. Esnilda explains that she’s started her business two years ago, and currently she has a lot of loyal customers.

The entrepreneur plans on using her loan to buy new fashionable jewels to add to her stock. She hopes that she’ll attract more people to her business, and increase her revenue.

Esnilda says that she’s putting aside money so that she can send her youngest daughter to school next year.

loans.use: Purchase of costume jewelry to retail in her community.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe, 54-year-old, lives in the low-income Sabana Grande de Boyá community of Monte Plata. As she’s undereducated and didn’t have the opportunity to hear about family planning methods, Guadalupe says “I committed the great error of having too many children (six daughters and five sons)”. She remembers that it’s been very hard to keep up her offspring.

To make a living and fend for her children, Guadalupe had to start selling tablecloths, bedspreads, curtains and the like to women of her community. The entrepreneur explains that currently she has a well established clientele. Her business is profitable and her children go to school. Nonetheless, Guadalupe thinks that she could earn more if she could have more access to capital and invest in the purchase of a large quantity of goods. So, she thanks in advance the bigheartedness of all the Kiva’s community which will support her with this loan. Guadalupe wants to keep working hard in order to provide a comfortable lifestyle with her family.

loans.use: To buy curtains, tablecloths, and other similar goods to resell in her community.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sim San Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim S., the group leader, lives in Cham Bak Phém Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells fruit in the local marK. and would like to expand her business. She has applied for this loan so that she can buy more fruit to re-sell.

Mrs. Sim S., 42, has four children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory while the other two study at a state school. Her husband, Mr. Yean Dok, sells fruit in the marK. with her.

Mrs. Sim S. previously obtained a loan to start the fruit business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to re-sell

loans.name: Sokha Khim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha K., the group leader, lives in Cham Bak Phém Village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a tailor and earns a small income that must support her family. Because Mrs. Sokha K. only has one business activity, she has decided to start another business to earn a second income breeding pigs. In order to do this, she will need a loan to buy some pigs; any remaining money will contribute towards building a piggery.

Mrs. Sokha K. is a widow with three children. One of her children is also a tailor; the others are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Sokha K. previously obtained a loan from AMK to start cultivating rice.

loans.use: To start a new business breeding pigs

loans.name: Nhor Daut Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor D., the group leader, lives with the other members of her group in Cham Bak Phém Village. She buys sugar palm and then re-sells it for a profit. She does not currently have enough money to buy more sugar palm, which is why she applied for this loan. Last year, Mrs. Nhor D. obtained a loan to buy pigs for breeding.

Mrs. Nhor D. is 29 years old, married and has six children. Two of her children work in a garment factory while the others attend school. Her husband, Mr. Sareourn Tu, is a subsistence farmer.

The family is in good health and Mrs. Nhor D. hopes to generate more money through her business.

Mrs. Nhor D. is the middle woman in the picture.

loans.use: To buy sugar palm that will be re-sold for a profit

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mrs. Nhor Duat decided to pay $13 in advance.

This Group Has An End Of Term Loan. This Means That Principal Is Due At The End Of The Loan. AMK Allows For Pre-payments, Thus Some The Members Might Pay Some Principal Before The End Of The Loan. So Mrs. Nhor Duat Decided To Pay $63 and Mrs. Thoeurng Ngin do the pre-payment $25 In Advance.

loans.name: Rom Neng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom N., the group leader, owns a small restaurant in Cham Bak Phém Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells rice soup, Chinese noodles and rice for breakfast. She is 55 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Sameourn Hin, is a farmer and he cultivates land near the village.

In the past, Mrs. Rom N. has hired a pump to water their crop. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to pay the fee this year and has applied for a loan to solve this problem.

loans.use: To pay for a hired water pump

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mrs. Theoun Mao decided to pay $13 in advance.

This Group Has An End Of Term Loan. This Means That Principal Is Due At The End Of The Loan. AMK Allows For Pre-payments, Thus Some The Members Might Pay Some Principal Before The End Of The Loan. So Mrs. Theoun Mao Decided To Pay $13 In Advance.

loans.name: Em Hin Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Em H., the group leader, lives in Cham Bak Phém Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a rice farmer and also sells water-lilies. Mrs. Em H. is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in garment factory while the other is enrolled in school.

The family now lives in an old house with walls that always leak during the rainy season. Mrs. Em H. has applied for this loan to build a new house in the village.

Previously, Mrs. Em H. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her rice plantation.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Saray Bich Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Saray B., the group leader, is a mat maker in Prek Rang Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Theourn Chhin, is a construction worker and fisherman. Although she and her husband both work, they only earn a small income.

Mrs. Saray B. has started building a new house to replace the family’s old house, but she does not have enough money to finish it. This loan would be combined with profits she has saved for many years to complete the new house.

Mrs. Saray B. previously obtained a loan from AMK to buy two fishing nets.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Bunly Chroen Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunly C., the group leader, lives in Prek Rang Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Bunly C. is a subsistence farmer. She has hired a laborer to plow her rice field, but unfortunately she does not have enough money to pay the wages. She would use her loan for this purpose and any remaining money would go towards fuel for her pump.

Mrs. Bunly C. is 34 years old and married with four children, one of whom is a fisherman like his father. Her other three children are enrolled in school.

Last year, Mrs. Bunly C. obtained a loan to buy fuel for the pump and fertilizer. Three years ago, Mrs. Bunly C. got a serious liver disease and the family spent $1000 on treatment.

loans.use: To pay wages and purchase fuel

loans.name: Yan Seang Group

texts.en: Mrs. Yan S., the group leader, is a mat maker in Prek Rang Village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a widow without any children and has a reputation for being hard working. Business is booming, and she now needs a loan to buy more raw materials (i.e. palm leaves) to make enough mats to satisfy rising demand.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials to make mats

loans.name: Kimsong Sim Group

texts.en:
Mr. Kimsong S., the group leader, is a fisherman but his business is not growing because he has insufficient equipment. This is why Mr. Kimsong S. decided to apply for a loan to purchase five more fishing nets for his business.

He is 42 years old and the father of four children. One of his children is a construction worker while the others all attend school. His wife, Mrs. Syden E., is a fish seller and sometimes she assists him out on the lake.

loans.use: To purchase five new fishing nets

loans.name: Thị Phuong

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nghiem Thi Phuong (ID number: 050013), is 4o years old. She wants to borrow 160 USD to buy chicken-feed, chinawares to let other people rent. Her average income is 8-9 USD/day. She has 2 children, one of which is in the military, the other is going to school. She already repaid for the first loan and she is very fond of repaying weekly. Mrs. Le Thi Binh (ID number: 050008), is 40 years old. She wants to borrow 170 USD to buy frogs to breed. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Loan (ID number: 050009) is 38 years old. She wants to borrow 155 USD to buy wholesale pork for retail at the market. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Ngai (ID number: 050010) is 49 years old. She wants to borrow 130 USD to buy pig mash. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Nga (ID number: 050011) is 44 years old. She wants to borrow 130 USD to buy meat and sell them at the market. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thang (ID number: 050012) is 43 years old. She wants to borrow 155 USD to buy wood to do carpentry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị N. Thị Phượng (MS: 050013), năm nay 40 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua cám nuôi gà, ngoài ra chị còn mua bát đĩa để cho thuê, tạo thu nhập thường xuyên cho gia đình với mức thu nhập 130.000 VND/ngày. Chị có hai con một đi bộ đội, một còn đang đi học. Chị đã hoàn trả rất tốt ở kỳ I và chị cũng rất thích với việc hoàn trả tuần nên chị tiếp tục tham gia vào chương trình ở những kỳ tiếp theo. Chị Lê Thị Bình (MS: 050008), năm nay 40 tuổi. Chị vay 2.714.000 VND để lấy vốn mua ếch công nghiệp về nuôi. Chị Nguyễn Thị Loan (MS: 050009), năm nay 38 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua thịt lợn vể bán ở chợ. Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngại (MS: 050010), năm nay 49 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Nga (MS: 050011), năm nay 44 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ bán thịt. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thắng (MS: 050012), năm nay 43 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua gỗ về đóng bàn ghế để bán.

loans.use: breed frogs, buy chicken-feed, pig mash, retail at market, carpentry

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Thị Oanh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi Oanh, (ID number: 050005, is 36 years old. She joined the Fund for one installment. Not only her but also her group did very well in repaying for previous installment. This time, she wants to borrow 172 USD to improve her business in collecting plactis products. She and her husband are very hard-working to go to houses and buy plastic wares from them and sell to recycling plants. Her average income is 8-9 USD/day. She has 4 children who are still going to school. She likes this method of payment. Mts. Nguyen Thi Luyen (ID number: 050001) is 37 years old. She wants to borrow 172 SD to improve her business in collecting wasted material. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Khanh (ID number: 050002) is 44 years old. She wants to borrow 172 SD to do business in plastic wares. Mrs. Tran Thi Luc (ID number: 050003) is 52 years old. She wants to borrow 172USD to improve her business in collecting wasted plastic wares. Mrs. Dac Thi Kim (ID number: 050004) is 45 years old. She wants to borrow 172USD to buy chicken-feed and breed fishes. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thuan (ID number: 050006) is 37 years old. She wants to borrow 170 USD to sell breakfast and also general store. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Nhuan (ID number: 050007) is 41 years old. She wants to borrow 170 USD to breed the chicken.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Oanh (MS: 050005), năm nay 36 tuổi. Chị đã tham gia được 1 kỳ, không những bản thân chị mà cả nhóm của chị đã hoàn trả chu kỳ vừa qua rất tốt, tinh thần bảo lãnh của nhóm rất cao. Lần này, chị vay 2.714.000 VND để bổ xung vốn cho việc mua bán phế liệu bằng nhựa. Chị cùng chồng rất năng động và chăm chỉ đi mua phế liệu từ các hộ nhỏ lẻ để bán cho các cơ sở tái chế các vật liệu bằng nhựa. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị là 130.000/ngày. Chị có bốn con vẫn còn đang đi học. Chị rất thích tham gia với nhóm và chương trình vì đã giúp chị trong việc tiết kiệm chi tiêu và hoàn trả vốn nhanh chóng. Chị Nguyễn Thị Luyến (MS: 050001), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị vay 2.714.000 VND để bổ xung thêm vốn đi mua bán phế liệu và bán hàng. Chị Nguyễn Thị Khánh (MS: 050002), năm nay 44 tuổi. Chị vay 2.714.000 VND dùng cho việc mua bán đồ nhựa. Cô Trần Thị Lực (MS: 050003), năm nay 52 tuổi, Cô vay 2.714.000 để bổ xung cho việc đi mua bán phế liệu. Chị Đác Thị Kim (MS: 050004), năm nay 45 tuổi. Chị vay 2.714.000 VND để mua cám nuôi gà và thả cá. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuận (MS: 050006), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị vay 2.714.000 VND để bán hàng ăn sáng và bán hàng tạp hoá. Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhuận (MS: 050007), năm nay 41 tuổi, Chị vay 2.714.000 VND để phục vụ cho việc chăn nuôi gà.

loans.use: business in collecting wasted plastic wares, buy chicken-feed, breeding animals, general store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Thị Thuyet

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thị Thuyết (MS: 070005), 44 years old, is taking out a loan of 2,714,000 VND to buy feed for her pigs. She is a hardworking woman. Beside her pigs, she makes tofu and sells to the grocery stands in the area. Her husband always helps her. All children are grown up, married and moved out. She’s been a group leader before. The group was a successful, that’s why she’s selected to be group leader again. Her group has 7 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • N. Thị Minh (MS: 070011), 34 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs and chickens.
  • N. Thị Liên (MS: 070003), 33 years old, applies for a loan to buy scrap.
  • N. Thị Thơi (MS: 070001), 54 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.
  • N. Thị Chuyên (MS: 070012), 41 years old, applies for a loan to invest in livestock.
  • N. Thị Mến (MS: 070015), 26 years old, applies for a loan to invest in pigs.
  • N. Thị Hồng (MS: 070032), 28 years old, applies for a loan to “đi chợ”
  • N. Khoa Bảo (MS: 070041), 48 years old, applies for a loan to rebuild his sprinkle system.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô N. Thị Thuyết (MS: 070005), năm nay 44 tuổi. Cô vay 2.714.000 VND để mua cám nuôi lợn. Cô là một người rất chịu khó. Cô làm đậu bán buôn cho các hộ bán lẻ. Chồng cô phụ giúp cô trong việc chăn nuôi và làm đậu. các con cô đã đi xây dụng gia đình. Cô làm nhóm trưởng kỳ I rất tốt và cô cũng thấy rất thích với việc hoàn trả tuần, nhỏ lẻ như vậy, cô đã tiết kiệm rất tốt cho gia đình. Cô cũng tiếp tục làm nhóm trưởng kỳ này và vận động thành viên mới tham gia vào chương trình. Chị N. Thị Minh (MS: 070011), năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 về mua cám nuôi lợn gà. Chị N. Thị Liên (MS: 070003), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 để lấy vốn đi mua bán phế liệu. Cô N. Thị Thơi (MS: 070001), năm nay 54 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND mua cám nuôi lợn. Chị N. Thị Chuyên (MS: 070012), năm nay 41 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn chăn nuôi. Chị N. Thị Mến (MS: 070015), năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị N. Thị Hồng (MS: 070032), năm nay 28 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua bán hoa quả ở chợ. Anh N. Khoa Bảo (MS: 070041), năm nay 48 tuổi. Anh vay 2.006.000 VND để lắp đăt hệ thống nước tưới trồng rau.

loans.use: Invest in business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Khắc Cuong

texts.vi:
Mr. N. Khắc Cường (MS: 070006), 37 years old, collects scrap material for living. He’s also a part time construction worker. His wife helps him in collecting scrap and also does rice farming. They have three school ages children. He is requesting a loan of 175USD to buy scrap.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Anh N. Khắc Cường (MS: 070006),năm nay 37 tuổi. Anh vay 2.478.000 VND để lấy vốn mua bán phế liệu, ngoài ra anh còn đi làm thợ xây để có thêm thu nhập. Vợ anh cũng phu giúp anh trong việc mua bán phế liệu và làm thêm đồng ruộng. Anh có ba con vẫn còn đang đi học.

loans.use: Buy scrap material

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Thị Thái
loans.use: Invest in business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Taeleasuasu

texts.en: Taeleasuasu owns a bakery. Her regular customers are students from a local primary school who enjoy the donuts, pancakes, and sausage rolls that she sells. Taeleasuasu initially only sold pancakes, but later on expanded the business.  This is her 5th loan with SPBD. She successfully repaid all the previous loans. Taeleasuasu's husband and her four children provide help in producing the snacks. Her business is the only income for the immediate family. Taeleasuasu earns about US$50 per day and sells her products 5 days a week.  With expenses at about US$200 per week, Taeleasuasu makes a weekly profit of about US$60. This allows her to make on-time repayments, and pay her children’s school fees and other family expenses. With the help of the new loan, Taeleasuasu will purchase flour, sugar, sausages, and other products for her bakery.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, sugar, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Pouli

texts.en: A mother of three children, Pouli lives in the village of Faleasiu and is now receiving her 4th loan from SPBD. So far, she has been able to always successfully make repayments on time. With the help of her 2nd and 3rd loans, Poui improved her Banana and Taro Chip sales business by purchasing new equipment, as well as paid her children’s education fees. The remainder she saved with SPBD. With the support from her husband who is a taxi driver, Pouli has been able to deliver her product around the village. She used her profits for loan repayment, but also covered her family’s home expenses. In addition, Pouli's business was supported by her family members, who farmed their five acres of banana and taro plantations. Pouli is now requesting a loan of US$1,125, which she will use to buy a new stove and repair her other cooking equipment.

loans.use: Purchase of a new stove and repair of cooking equipment

loans.name: Lotosoa Saleimoa Center - Group 1

texts.en:
This is the first group of women from Lotosoa Village located on the Northwest corner of Upolu Island in Samoa to receive the maximum initial loan of $750 Tala each from SPBD.  According to policies and guidelines of SPBD, the first loan must be used to start or improve their businesses.  The second cycle of loans will not only be for the business but they also will have the chance to improve their homes and pay their children’s education fees.  Before they receive their first loan, they were all trained by loan officers from SPBD in how to start a business and budgeting cash especially income and expenses.  

Their businesses (and purchases) include: taro plantations (weed killers, pesticides, chemicals, wheel barrow, shovel), retail shops (hygiene products), pancake sales (sugar, flour, oven), BBQ (soy sauce, mutton flaps), and ice cakes (sugar, plastic bags).

loans.use: Purchase materials, equipment and food for their businesses

loans.name: Lotosoa Saleimoa Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
Lotosoa Saleimoa Centre - Group 2 is the second group of women from Lotosoa Village, located on the Northwest corner of Upolu Island in Samoa, to ever receive the maximum initial loan of about US$300 each from SPBD.  According to policies and guidelines of SPBD, this first loan will have to be used to either start or improve businesses. During the second loan cycle, the women will have the chance to improve their homes and pay their children’s education fees. Prior to receiving their first loan, all of them were trained by loan officers from SPBD in starting a business and in budgeting income and expenses.  

The businesses (and the relevant purchases) of this particular group of women include: taro plantations (weed killers, pesticides, chemicals, wheel barrow, shovel), retail shops (hygiene products), pancake sales (sugar, flour, oven), BBQ (soy sauce, mutton flaps), fishing (boat, spear, boots) and ice cake sales (sugar, plastic bags).

loans.use: Purchase of equipment, materials and food for their businesses

loans.name: Mohammad Rahim

texts.en: Until recently, Mohammad Rahim had lived all of his life in Iran. He is married, and he is the father of two boys. Over the years, he has worked for many construction companies. However, when he came to Kabul, he opened his own constriction company, and he has 5 employees (including himself) working at the company. Currently, he needs money to expand his business, so he is seeking a loan to enter into a lease. More generally, he plans on working extremely hard to allow his family to experience a better life in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand his business and to complete the purchase of a lease

loans.name: Elly

texts.id:
Elly and her husband, Joko Sutanto, sell motorcycle spare parts for several makes of motorcycles. Including selling spark plugs, oil, bolts, and tires of several brands. By and large the buyers are from the community living within the store or incidental passerby. Usually the motorcycle spare parts sold are purchased in Denpasar and also from sales person who are his customers. From this business, he is able to set aside money to cover his home lease for an extended period and also use as further funding. Elly intends to expand her store, thus requiring additional funding.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Elly menekuni usaha jual suku cadang (spare part) sepeda motor untuk berbagai merek sepeda motor bersama suaminya Joko Sutanto. Adapun barang yang dijual antara lain Busi,Oli, Baut, dan Ban yang tersedia dalam berbagai merek. Umumnya pembelinya adalah masyarakat yang tinggal di sekitar tokonya atau yang kebetulan lewat. Biasanya suku cadang kendaraan bermotor yang dijualnya dia beli di kota Denpasar atau ada juga yang dibeli dari sales person yang menjadi langganannya. Dari usaha ini, ia bisa menyisihkan uang untuk membayar perpanjangan kontrak rumahnya dan juga dipakai sebagai modal lagi. Elly berkeinginan mengembangkan tokonya, karena itu dia membutuhkan tambahan modal lagi.

loans.use: Additional Funding for Business (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Whidullah

texts.en: This is Whidullah, son of M. A.. Whidullah is married, and he has six children. He lives in the district of Sorkhrood in the Ningarhar province. He operates a clothing shop in Jalalabad city, though he is quick to point out that he has also served as the shop's tailor for the last two years. Currently, he is hoping to buy more cloths for his shop to improve his business, but he does not have much money on hand to do so. As a result, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghanis ($1,050) through AFSG to enable him to purchase additional materials for his shop.

loans.use: To improve and expand his shop by purchasing additional clothes and materials

loans.name: Luis Francisco

texts.en:
Luis Francisco C.  is 22 years old and is originally from Namaacha, a village bordering Swaziland. Luis is the sixth of eight siblings, married to his wife Rute and has a 2-year-old son. Luis Francisco finished his technical teachers’ education in 2006 and was not able to proceed with his studies due to his  family’s poor financial condition. 

In 2007 Luis Francisco started to work as a primary teacher at a school in Matsequenha, a village in the Namaacha District, and in 2008 he was transferred back to Namaacha village to work as a technician at the District Education Administration. 

Luis Francisco still lives at his parents’ house with his wife and son and dreams of having his own house. He already bought the land and started the foundations. He has decided to apply for his first loan to help start the actual construction. With this $425 loan, Luis Francisco will buy more construction materiasl and will pay the construction worker to start building his 1-bedroom house.

loans.use: Buy Construction Material

loans.name: Muradzay

texts.en: Muradzay, son of A. Q., is a 24-year-old young man. He is the father of two children, and he lives in the third district of the Ningarhar province. Muradzay graduated from class 12, but he was not able to continue on to higher education because he encountered certain economic problems. As a result, he started a small business, and he is currently working as a shop-keeper. He would like to buy certain necessary goods for his shop in order to increase the number of the shop's customers. Therefore, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghanis ($1,050) through AFSG to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To improve and expand his business by purchasing additional necessities for his shop in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Phuon

texts.en: Mrs. Phuon N. is a 43 year-old woman who lives with her husband and their four children in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She makes a living by growing and selling vegetables and can earn approximately $2.60 per day. Her husband is a 44 year-old veterinarian who can earn up to $3.00 a day. Phuon N. requests a $800 loan to purchase a motorbike to help in her business, as well as to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her business and additional pigs to raise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sutinah

texts.id:
Sutinah, who originates from Jawa, has been living in Bali since 1998. Her daily work is selling iced young coconut drinks and chicken soup. Everyday she purchase young coconuts from Badung market then repackaged in glass to be sold. Earnings from this are sufficient to set aside for payment of rent for the land amounting to Rp. 4.000.000 (about USD430) per year. Her husband’s earnings as a farmer are insufficient to cover the family’s expenses. Because of that she assist by supplementing the family’s burden. Sutinah hopes the funding will help her business to flourish.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Sutinah, yang aslinya berasal dari Jawa, sudah tinggal di Bali sejak tahun 1998. Pekerjaannya sehari-hari adalah sebagai penjual es kelapa muda dan soto ayam. Setiap hari dia membeli kelapa muda dari Pasar Badung lalu kemudian dijual lagi dalam kemasan gelas. Keuntungan yang didapat cukup untuk disisihkan untuk membayar sewa kontrak tanah senilai Rp.4.000.000.- per tahun. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai petani tidak cukup untuk bisa memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Oleh karena itu dia juga ikut membantu meringankan beban keluarga. Sutinah sangat mengharapkan bantuan modal untuk usahanya sehingga nantinya bisa berkembang lagi.

loans.use: Additional Funding for Business (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Jamaludin

texts.id:
Jamaludin’s profession is selling used shoes. The shoes he sells are from returns from the surrounding Denpasar. Shoes that are damaged are washed then dried, and then the portions of the sole that are damaged are replaced, sewed and polished. Each day he sells his shoes in Kumbasari market. On every Wednesday and weekend he sells in Bringkit market. From this business, he is able to pay his motorcycle finance installments, and also cover his children’s education. Currently, together with his wife and children live in a leased home on Cokroaminoto road.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Profesi Jamaludin adalah sebagai penjual sepatu bekas. Sepatu-sepatu yang dijualnya didapatnya dari para pemulung dari sekitaran Denpasar dengan membeli. Sepatu-sepatu yang sudah rusak tersebut kemudian dicuci dan dikeringkan, kemudian bagian telapak yang sudah rusak diganti, dijahit lalu disemir. Setiap hari dia menjual sepatu-sepatunya di Pasar Kumbasari. Tetapi pada setiap hari Rabu dan Minggu dia berjualan di Pasar Bringkit. Dari usahanya ini, ia bisa membayar cicilan kredit sepeda motornya, dan juga untuk biaya pendidikan anak-anaknya. Saat ini ia beserta istri dan anak-anaknya tinggal di sebuah rumah kontrakan di Jl. Cokroaminoto.

loans.use: Additional Funding for Business (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Lilik

texts.id:
Lilik has been living in Balun district for a long time, which is densely populated. Her business of selling cold drinks has been in demand because there are many passers-by around the vicinity of her stall. The hot Balinese weather also makes cold drinks popular. Several varieties of cold drinks are sold from cold mineral water and also soft drinks of several brands. These drinks are usually purchased from Bandung market and also delivered to his place of business. Up till now, his earnings is used to pay rent and also his 14-year-old child’s education. His plan, the funding received will be used as additional funding for the business.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Lilik sudah lama tinggal di daerah Balun yang juga merupakan kawasan padat dan ramai. Usaha jual minuman dingin miliknya sampai saat ini masih laris, dikarenakan banyaknya laalu lintas yang lewat disekitar tempatnya berjualan.
