Cuaca Bali yang panas juga membuat minuman dingin sangat diminati. Berbagai macam minuman dingin dijualnya mulai dari air mineral dingin dan juga soft drink berbagai merek. Minuman ini biasanya dia beli dai Pasar Badung dan ada juga yang mengantar langsung ketempatnya berjualan. Sampai saat ini, keuntungan yang didapat dipergunakan sebagai biaya membayar sewa tanah dan juga untuk biaya sekolah anaknya yang berumur 14 tahun. Rencananya, modal yang didapat akan dipakai sebagai tambahan modal buat usahanya.

loans.use: Additional Funding for the Business (Manambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Aenah

texts.id:
The business Aenah is doing daily is to sell packed rice. Her husband's income as a driver is not enough to fulfill household needs. That is why she is also working. Every day she sells packed rice around her house in Mertasari Suwung street, Denpasar. Her customers are mostly workers who works in that area. Afterwards in the afternoon she moves to sell in Danau Tempe street. Her daily income is sufficient to fulfill household needs. Aenah hopes the help could be used to add business capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang dijalani oleh Aenah sehari-harinya adalah sebagai penjual nasi bungkus. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai sopir belum cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Karena itu dia juga ikut bekerja. Setiap hari dia berjualan nasi bungkus disekitar rumahnya di Jl. Mertasari Suwung Denpasar. Pelanggannya kebanyakan para pekerja yang bekerja dikawasan itu. Setelah itu pada siang hari dia pindah berjualan di Jl.Danau Tempe. Penghasilan yang didapatnya setiap hari cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Aenah mengharapkan bantuan untuk dipakai sebagai tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: To add business capital (Manambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Sim Chum Group

texts.en:
Mr. Sim C., the group leader, is a fisherman and firewood seller. He does not have enough fishing nets and has applied for a loan to buy some more. Previously, Mr. Sim C. obtained a loan from AMK to buy firewood to re-sell and purchase fishing nets.

Mr. Sim C. is 60 years old and married with two children, both of whom help with the family business.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets

payments.comment: This repayment is for May 2008; this group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mrs. Lon Em decided to pay $13 as an extra repayment.

loans.name: Hayatin

texts.id:
Hayatin's daily activity is a seamstress, from morning till about evening. In the evening she usually sells fried items. Seamstressing has been done for years, since this is the only expertise she has. She receives many type of orders, individually as well as garment business who order in large quantities. Increasing family needs, makes her works harder . The income received is used for household needs and children's schooling expenses. Hayatin very much hopes that loan help could be used as capital to buy sewing needs like cloth and strings.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan sehari-hari yang dijalani Hayatin adalah sebagai penjahit, mulai dari pagi sampai menjelang sore. Pada sore harinya biasanya dia menjual gorengan. Kegiatan jahit menjahit sudah dijalani selama bertahun-tahun, karena hanya inilah keahlian yang dia miliki saat ini. Berbagai macam pesanan sering dia terima, baik itu perorangan maupun garmen yang memesan dalam jumlah banyak. Kebutuhan keluarga yang semakin bertambah membuatnya semakin giat bekerja. Penghasilan yang didapat selain untuk kebutuhan rumah tangga juga untuk biaya sekolah anak-anaknya. Hayatin sangat berharap diberi bantuan pinjaman untuk dipakai sebagai modal membeli bahan jahitan seperti kain dan benang.

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Neang Oun Group

texts.en:
Mrs. N. O., the group leader, is a subsistence farmer who cultivates rice in monsoon season and vegetables in the dry season. However, without fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel farming is very difficult. She decided to apply for a loan to buy these things because they will improve her rice and vegetable crops. Mrs. N. O. previously obtained a loan from Amret Co.,Ltd to hire a laborer to plow her rice field.

Mrs. N. O. is 51 years old. She is a widow and has eight children, two of whom are farmers while the others attended school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and fuel

loans.name: Chantheourn Monh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantheourn M. is a fish seller and wants to expand her business. She has applied for a loan from AMK to buy more fish to re-sell in the market. Last year, she helped a friend obtain a loan, but now she would like one for herself. 
Mrs. Chantheourn M. is a widow with three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Three months ago, she got in a motorbike accident and had to spend $500 on treatment.
 This loan will be split between twenty-three members in Preak Tanop Village in Kandal Province.

loans.use: To buy fish to re-sell in the market

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally B. lives in Sdao Kanleng Village in Kandal Province. She is a subsistence farmer and pig breeder. Sadly, some of her pigs have died of disease. Mrs. Phally would like to revive her pig breeding business and has applied for a loan to buy more pigs for breeding.

Mrs. Phally B. is 42 years old. She is a widow and has four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other attends school. In addition to running her own business, she works as a laborer (e.g. working on a rice farm, washing clothes, etc.) to earn extra money.

loans.use: To buy pigs for breeding

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth S. is married to Mr. Khon Sem who is a farmer and fisherman. Mr. Khon Sem’s fishing activity is difficult because he does not have his own boat. They would use this loan to buy a boat, while any remaining money would be spent on fertilizers and pesticides to improve their farming.

Last year, Mrs. Sareth S. faced a drought; fortunately, she obtained a loan from Acleda Bank help her family through that period. During the drought, her husband fell ill and they spent $1000 on his treatment.

Mrs. Sareth S. has four children: two work in a garment factory while the others study at a state school.

(Mrs. Sareth S., pictured here with her husband, Mr. Khon Sem, and two of their daughters.)

loans.use: To buy a new boat, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is married with 4 children. She is 45 years old and has been running her business for 8 years, and it is the only source of income for her family. With her previous loan from Kiva, her capital and profits increased. She paid her children’s school fees for this year in cash, unlike before the loan, when she used to pay the fees in installments. She is able to meet her children’s school requirements without as much difficulty as before the loan. She is very grateful and would like an additional loan to expand and diversify her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of jewels and lotions

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Moranak

texts.en:
Mr. Moranak T. works for a private company and lives Kosh Prak Village in Kandal Province. He does not have enough money to build a kitchen in his back yard, so Mr. Moranak T. applied for a loan that would enable him to build one for his family.

Mr. Moranak T. is 40 years old and the father of four children, two of whom attend school; the others are too young to work or study. He previously obtained a loan from Amret Co.,Ltd to buy a new motorbike. His wife, Mrs. Chantheourn Samreth, is a grocer in the local village. Unfortunately, last year she got a gynecological disease and they spent $175 on treatment. The disease is recurring, and because of this Mr. Moranak T. does not have enough money saved to build the kitchen.

(Mr. Moranak T. is pictured with his wife and two youngest children; the other children were at school when the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To build a kitchen in the back yard

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata K. is thankful to Kiva for her previous loan of $200, as her family's income increased. Before the loan, she was hawking door to door, but with the loan she is now able to rent a place in the market and sell her palm oil. She can provide for her family’s needs more than before. Fatmata is the only breadwinner as her husband is unemployed. To expand her business, Fatmata is requesting an additional loan to purchase 90 gallons of palm oil. With this amount, Fatmata believes that she will generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase 90 gallons of palm oil to increase her stock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: Memuna’s previous loan of $175 from Kiva has helped her to increase her stock. She is very grateful for the stock increase because she got many new customers because of new varieties of cosmetics. With 7 children, her income contributes a lot to meeting the family's expenses. She paid the school fees for the children in cash. Memuna is requesting another loan to further diversify her business with the purchase of dozens of lotions, perfumes, etc.

loans.use: Increase stock of cosmetics.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs Thol B. and her husband Mr Bou Sorn were married in 1964 and have five children; three sons and two daughters. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home, one of whom is in the business of selling cell phones. Their youngest son is assisting his sister in selling cell phones. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs Thol and her husband have been in the business of farming for over 40 years. They grow bananas and other kinds of fruits in the farm near their house. They sell them to the middle man who takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh.

Mrs Thol is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer for doing farming and to help her daughter expand her cell phone business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for doing farming and for expanding her daughter's business of selling cell phones.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mrs Lorn C. (pictured with her daughter and grandchildren) is a widow with five children, four sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and live in the family home. The family lives across the Mekong River about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs Lorn has been in the business of selling fruits and dessert in front of the village school for 18 years. Her daughter has been a weaver for seven years. It’s a skill she learned from her sister-in-law. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Mrs Lorn is requesting a loan of US$150 to purchase silk material for her daughter's weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
Mrs Sreytouch V. (pictured), 23, and her husband, Mr Kunthy Heak, were married in 2007. The couple lives with their parents and brothers and sisters. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs Sreytouch has been a weaver for seven years. It’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a motorbike repairer. He does his business at the shop in the village.

Mrs Sreytouch is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband's motorbike repair business.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike spare parts for repair business.

loans.name: Kim-Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. Kim-Oeun C. and his wife Mrs. Kim ROEUNG have been married since 1985 and have five children: four sons and a daughter. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Kim-Oeun learnt to repair radios, TVs and tape recorders after he got married, and started his own repair business in 1986. His wife earns additional income for the family, selling Chinese noodles and coffee at their house. With the combined income from their businesses, the couple is able to send all of their children to school.

Mr. Kim-Oeun is now requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase more tools and spare parts so that he can expand his radio, TV, and tape recorder repair business.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for repairing TVs, Radios, and Tape recorders

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu K. and her family thank Kiva for the previous loan of $175. She said that the loan allowed her to expand her business and increase profits, and she now feels independent and powerful. She would like to expand her business even more, and be able to meet her children’s expenses with less difficulties. She is very happy with the loan program and promises to be an honest Kiva client as far as loan repayment is concerned. She is requesting another loan to purchase 3 boxes of fish to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase 3 boxes of dried fish to increase stock and income

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothea D. and her husband Mr. Thoeun SO have been married since 2000 and have two children: a son and a daughter. Their son is in school, while the daughter is still too young and stays at home. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sothea has been running a grocery for four years. She buys grocery items from the market in Phnom Penh for resale at her store in front of the house. Her husband has been working as an ice seller for the past 7 years. He buys ice from a factory at a suburb of Phnom Penh for resale at his village.

Mrs. Sothea is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for carrying goods from Phnom Penh to sell at her shop.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike for carrying goods from Phnom Penh to sell at a shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Aminallah

texts.en: AminA. is an independent, hard-workering barber. He has been working in this business for the last 5 years, but he is currently looking to increase and improve upon his business. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to re-decorate and expand his shop in order to attract more clients. In turn, AminA. is confident that he will generate more income and will thus be able to help support his family.

loans.use: To re-decorate and expand his barber shop to attract additional clients

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopha P. and her husband have been married since 1971 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home, another one works full time, while three are in school. One of their daughters is a weaver, and Mrs. Sopha's son in-law is a blacksmith. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sopha has been a weaver for over twenty years, but by now has transferred her business to her daughter. Mrs. Sopha's husband is a farmer. He grows many kind of crops in the farm near the house.

Mrs. Sotha is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase silk material for weaving and blacksmith’s material for her son in-law to allow him to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase of silk material for weaving and of blacksmith’s material

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mr. Horn H. and his wife Mrs. Kong CHHOUN have been married since 1988 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Their daughters work in a garment factory, while their sons are in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Horn started his motor Remoque taxi business in 1995. He carries goods and people from his village to Phnom Penh and from Phnom Penh to the village. With the income from the business, he is able to send all of his children to school. His wife does not have a job; she stays at home and takes care of the children. However, by now, Mr. Horn's trailer has become old and is broken, and he therefore needs to buy a new one. He is requesting a loan of US$1,000 for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase of a trailer for a motor Remoque taxi business

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Madam Yeabu C. thanks KIVA for improving her business and life. KIVA’s loan brought a lot of joy to her life. With the profits she earned, she bought new clothes and shoes for the children and she has saved some for their future school fees. Her plan is to diversify her business to provide more income. She is therefore requesting another loan to purchase 50 gallons of palm oil and other food stuffs.

loans.use: Purchase stocks of salt, tomato paste, onions and palm oil

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married with two kids. He lives in Uzhgorod, Ukraine where he works as a VIP taxi driver. Andrei owns an expensive car and mostly provides transportation services for elite levels of society. Competition in this sphere of business is relatively low. Moreover, Andrei’s hard labor, the help of his family and his flexibility have helped his venture grow and become profitable.

Andrei has been in this business for seven years. Currently, his turnover capital is about $1600 a month. Andrei is requesting a loan of 4000 Grn ($US850) for technical maintenance on his prestigious automobile. Some repair work needs to be done on it and Andrei wants to have it done in a timely manner.

Andrei likes his job because it sustains him and his family really well. He doesn’t want to go back to his previous job as a truck driver which didn’t bring him much success. Andrei is hoping that one day his hard work and determination will pay off and help him fulfill all his entrepreneurial dreams.

loans.use: For  vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya has two daughters. She lives in Otradokamenka, in the Kherson region. Natalya is an active entrepreneur selling clothing items in the local market. She has a circle of loyal clients and a variety of merchandise in her kiosk. Natalya has gained rich experience working in this sphere of trade for the last 10 years. All of her business endeavors have been characterized by commitment and reliability. Presently, Natalya makes about $500-$600 in profit each month.

Natalya tries to please each of her customers’ tastes. She is always seeking to expand the assortment of inventory she offers for sale in her kiosk. Moreover, Natalya travels to distant towns and villages offering her merchandise at the local markets. Villagers always look forward to her coming. Natalya started this business on her own, but now her children are actively helping her run this family venture.

Today Natalya is requesting a loan of 2500 Grn ($US525) to re-stock her inventory and continue expanding her trade.

loans.use: To increase inventory and expand clothing sales.

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
Nikolai is single. He lives in Novaya Kahovka, in the Kherson region of Ukraine and sells books in the local mall. Nikolai is the only entrepreneur who managed to open a vending department in this store recently. His business is growing, providing him and his parents with stable income.

Nikolai is a Christian. He has set up honest working policies which help him attract customers and keep his business running. Nikolai is also very hard-working and focused. He is planning to increase his working capital and expand assorted merchandise in his vending place. That is why he is currently requesting a loan of 5000 Grn ($US1050).

loans.use: To increase his book inventory.

loans.name: Ildika

texts.en:
Ildika is divorced with two children. She lives in Uzhgorod and sells groceries in the local market. In addition, she also has a vending facility selling knitted wear in the same marketplace. Ildika is Hungarian and speaks the language fluently. This skill helps her get some good deals as she travels across the border into Hungary to re-stock her inventory.

Ildika is very experienced and focused. She has been in this trade for 4 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about $4000. Her monthly net profit is about $1200. Ildika has benefited from loans through Nadiya Ukraine. She has been able to increase her income considerably and even purchase a vehicle that she uses to travel to remote wholesale centers to buy inventory. Ildika has always been very responsible and has submitted all loan payments promptly.

Today she is requesting a loan of 3500 Grivnas ($US750) to purchase additional grocery items for her food kiosk. We are hoping that consistent expansion of Ildika’s business will help her achieve her dream of eventually opening her own small grocery store in the city of Uzhgorod.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Nangialy

texts.en: This is Nangialy, the son of R. D.. Nangialy lives in the district of Shewa in the Ningarhar province. Nangialy operates a retail food shop near his house, but he does not generate enough income to solve his economic problems because there are not enough products for sale in his shop. As such, he is hoping to increase his income by purchasing more food for his shop. Specifically, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghanis ($1,050) through AFSG to resolve the issues he faces in connection with his small business.

loans.use: To generate more income by purchasing additional food and materials for his shop

loans.name: Cristo Vive Group

texts.en:
Paulina R. is a dedicated and vivacious woman who lives with her 4 children (ages: 16, 14, 12, 3) in San Pedro de Macoris. Currently, Paulina sells shoes and slippers by walking around her community all throughout the day. She will use this loan to continue making small improvements to her business by purchasing better quality items and developing a consistent client base. Her goal for the future is to open a proper store in her neighborhood so that she doesn’t have to walk from place to place every day. She told us that it is very hard on her knees and back to carry around her merchandise for 10 hours every day. Paulina wants to use any extra profit from her business to help her children with school and necessities.

On behalf of Esperanza, thank your for your generous support and we look forward in joining with you to watch these women succeed! God Bless.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Dios Puede Group

texts.en:
Elise is a 37 year-old woman who lives with her 2 children (ages 2 and 10) in Padre Granero. Her husband, Alexi, works at a nearby store called “Casa Nelson” which sells clothing and household goods. This will be the 2nd loan for Elise, and she told us that she is very excited because her business has already improved so much over the past 6 months. She has been selling clothes for 15 years, but has never had the capital to expand or improve her business. Her dreams for the future are to own a home and a proper business.

For 10 of the women in Padre Granero this will be their 1st loan with Esperanza, and for the other 10 this will be their second. It has been such a joy and an honor for us to work with these women over the past 6 months, and we are excited to add more to the group. On behalf of Esperanza, thank you for continually supporting and encouraging these women. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en:
Marie came to our office with her precious 1-year old son and 9 other women from her community to learn more about the loans that we could give them. She has lived in Basurero, on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, with her husband and two children for 15 years. Her husband works in a small jewelry shop, but she has not been able to work because of her two small children, and the lack of opportunity. With this loan she wants to buy clothes, shoes, and hair products to sell in her community. Her dream is that if her and her husband work hard they can provide a better life for their children, and send them to University.

Esperanza is so privileged to work with these women, and we want to thank Kiva lenders for their support. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, shampoo, and conditioner

loans.name: Trabajadoras Sociales Group

texts.en:
Juana D. J. is a beautiful young Haitian woman, who moved to the Dominican Republic with her family in hopes of finding more opportunity and a better life for her children. She is a single mom, and lives with her two children (ages 3 and 8). Her 8 year old son attends school, but her youngest child spends every day with her, either at their house or working. With this loan Juana wants to buy a large supply of shampoo, conditioner, and other hair products to sell. She will start by selling these items on the streets, but eventually wants to have a small shop to run her business out of. Juana told us that when she isn’t working, she loves reading and going to the beach!

Esperanza wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for supporting this group of amazing women. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy hair products.

loans.name: Sharifa's Mutakuja B Group

texts.en:
Sharifa O., age 32 is married, with one 14-year-old child. In 2005, she began her business of selling food. She works from 6am to 3pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $50. Sharifa appears in the picture standing in the middle of the back row.

Sharifa is requesting a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase sales in her food business. Sharifa plans to share this loan with her subgroup members, who have a salon that also sells food, sell charcoal, and a clothing shop.

loans.use: Increase food sales

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
The Banco Comunal Maria D. Los Angeles is a new communal bank that has 20 members.

The members work in different businesses such as the sale of sweet treats, groceries, natural products, prepared food, cereals, salchipollo (french fries and fried chicken), vegetables, newspapers, crafts, clothing and preparing fresh juices.

The members need loans in different amounts. Some of the amounts are 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles for a total amount of 9,700 soles in loans at the Banco Comunal.

The loans will be used to purchase chompas (Peruvian alpaca sweaters), blouses, rice, sugar, cooking oil, wheat, barley, squash, carrots, oranges, tangerines, cookies, candy, chocolates and natural products.

The dreams of the members are to improve their businesses, establish their business, that their children become professionals and owning a home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Maria D. Los Ángeles es un banco que recién inicia con 20 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. golosinas, abarrotes, productos naturales, comidas, cereales, salchipollos, verduras, periódicos, artesanías, ropa y preparación D. jugos naturales.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 9,700 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. chompas, blusas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, trigo, cebada, zapallo, zanahoria, cebolla, naranja, mandarinas, galletas, caramelos, chocolates y productos naturales.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar poco a poco su negocio, establecer su negocio, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener casa propia.

loans.use: The loans will be used to purchase chompas (Peruvian alpaca sweaters), blouses, rice, sugar, cooking oil, wheat, barley, squash, carrots, oranges, tangerines, cookies, candy, chocolates and natural products.

loans.name: Mujeres Fuertes Group

texts.en:
Rosa is an ambitious 37-year-old woman who lives with her husband, Jose Luis, and her 6 children (10, 12, 14, 17, 19, and 21). Rosa has been selling food for almost 14 years, but she barely makes enough profit to just sustain her business like it is. With this loan she wants to buy a new supply of food, and also add new things to her store. In her free time she enjoys spending time with her friends, and watching TV. Her dream for the future is that she would be able to own a successful restaurant.

This will be the 2nd loan for 10 of the women in Tamarindo, and the 1st loan for the other 5. Esperanza looks forward to watching them grow and succeed, and we want to sincerely thank you for your support! God Bless.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
I have a construction in progress at my dwelling; I have the necessary material to place windows, plaster and paint, but I request a support of $1,000 to be able to place the concrete slab which is necessary to finish the building of this room.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo una construcción sin terminar en mi vivienda, cuento con el material necesario para colocar las ventanas, enjarrar y pintar, pero solicito su apoyo con” $ 1,000.00 dlls, para poder colocar la losa de concreto, ya que es lo único que me es necesario en este cuarto que estoy construyendo, para su terminación.

loans.use: Place concrete slab to finish building a room.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ebenezer En Cristo Group

texts.en:
The women from Pancho Mateo have completed paying back their first loan, and are now re-applying with a larger group! Teresa is one of the new women in this group, and she is excited to experience the same success as the other women in her community. Teresa is 48-years-old, and a single mother of 2 children. She wants to sell clothes and shoes once she receives her loan. She told us that her favorite food is lentils and that in her free time she loves listening to music. In the future, she would love to own a home and have a safe place for her kids to continue grow up.

We are so blessed to continue working with this group of women, thank you again for your generosity!

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes for retail.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
The floor at my house is cement; I would like to improve the aspect and the comfort of my dwelling. To do so I need to place Vitro flooring and therefore I request a loan of $1,200 in order to finish the room and give more comfort to my family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Cuento con una casa la cual el piso es de cemento, me gustaría darle una mejor vista a mi vivienda y mayor comodidad, para ello tengo la necesidad de poner Vitro piso en mi casa, por lo mismo les solicito el préstamo de $1,200.00 dll. para poder llevar a cabo la terminación de dicho cuarto, y dar un mejor confort a mi familia.

loans.use: Place Vitro flooring.

loans.name: Amador

texts.es:
Behind my dwelling, houses are being built very close to mine and there is no fence in between. I would like to give more security to my family as the house has no protection, as you can see, and access is easy from behind, so putting up a fence I protect my family more and I would feel more at ease when at work and my family is alone at home, and therefore I request a loan of $700.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

En la parte de atrás de mi vivienda se están construyendo casas, estas casas están muy pegadas a la mía, y no cuento con una barda en ella. Quisiera darle mayor seguridad a mi familia, puesto que la casa no tiene protección como pueden ver y es de fácil entrada por la parte de atrás, así que poniendo una barda protejo más a mi familia y me sentiría más tranquilo en el momento de ir a trabajar cuando mi familia se quedara sola en la vivienda, de esta manera solicito el préstamo de $700.00 dll.

loans.use: Put up a fence behind a dwelling.

loans.name: Jesus Valentin

texts.es:
I wish to improve the aspect of my house and offer more security to my family building a wall and fences in front of my house as there is a lot of insecurity in the area where I live and we have suffered several mishaps. Therefore I request a loan of $500 to be able to build the fence of my dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Quiero darle una mejor vista a mi casa y dar una mayor seguridad a mi familia, colocándole una barda y rejas al frente de mi hogar, ya que en donde vivo hay mucha inseguridad, y ya hemos tenido varios percances, de esta forma les solicito la cantidad de $500.00 dlls, y poder llevar a cabo la terminación de la barda de mi vivienda. o la terminación de la barda de mi vivienda.

loans.use: Build a fence around a house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
I wish to make some improvements in my home. In the dining room area I have a wall that is not finished. I would like to remodel the dining area, I have been trying to do it for sometime now. For this purpose I am requesting a loan in the amount of $800.00.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Quisiera dar a mi vivienda una mejor estabilidad; en la parte del comedor tengo una pared con sus fachadas sin terminar, me gustaría remodelar la parte del comedor ya que tengo tiempo intentando su remodelación, solicito el préstamo de $800.00 dll. Para pder terminar la remodelación de mi comedor.

loans.use: Remodel the dining room of my home.

loans.name: Juan Martin

texts.es:
I've just purchased a piece of land in which I would like to build a room I can inhabit soon. As you can see I have nothing built yet. For this reason I am requesting a loan in the amount of $700.00 to start building my home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Acabo de obtener un terreno en el cual me gustaría empezar a levantar un cuarto y poder habitarlo pronto, como pueden ver no tengo nada hecho aun, por ello solicito el crédito de $ 700.00 dlls. Para poder iniciar la construcción de mi vivienda.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en:
Maximina M. Santa is a young woman, of 37 years, who has formed a beautiful home with her husband Carlos de la Rosa, with whom she has two children. She lives in the small town of El Seibo, a province of the Dominican Republic, and she specifically lives in the community of Los Cajuiles. It is in that community that she has her business selling clothes, clothes, and ladies’ accessories; the past 6 months have been very successful for her and have permitted her to dedicate extra income to her family.

She is now asking for a loan of 15,000 Dominican Pesos to buy more merchandise for the upcoming summer season, and to expand her business. She hopes to increase her sales and continue developing her business in this way.

Her goals are always be a productive person, and to maintain her physical health, and the growth of her business. She also hopes to continue moving forward with her life so that her children can continue their education and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for summer clothes, and to increase inventory in her store.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
In the neighborhood where I live the houses are very close together. I am in need of installing a fence around my house so that my family can be more protected. We will feel more comfortable knowing that we are more secure. I am requesting $500.00.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

En la colonia donde vivo, las casas están pegadas unas a las otras y tengo la necesidad de colocarle una barda a mi vivienda para tener más protegida a mi familia y obtener una mayor comodidad en ella a sabiendas de tener mayor seguridad, de esta manera solicito la cantidad de $ 500.00 dlls.

loans.use: To build a fence

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is38 years old and married with 7 children. Her husband is also a fish monger and both have been running their fish business for 18 years but on a very small scale.  With the previous loan from SMT, Fatmata increased her stock and income, and she was able to assist her husband in meeting the family income.  Fatmata would like to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase 6 baskets of fish.

loans.use: She needs to purchase more stock of fish and maximize profit.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 40 years old and a widow with eight children.  She sells tomato paste, salt, onions etc.  She used to purchase the goods on credit and with her previous loan from SMT, she increased the stock and built her own capital.  45% of her current stock was purchased on credit and she could only make marginal profit as the goods were very expensive.  With eight children, Fatu needs to generate more income to meet the family expenses as she is the only breadwinner for the family. She also needs to build her own capital and is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: She needs to increase stock and build her own capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Marta Mayra

texts.es:
Ms. Marta C. is a 49-year-old widow who lives in the Sabana Grande neighborhood. She has a 30-year-old daughter who lives with her and helps out with the family expenses. She makes “cosa de horno” (sweet corn bread) for a living. With 35 years of experience, this delicious corn bread business has become a tradition in her family.

She started making the bread at a young age. Her mother passed on her cooking tools to her so that she could get ahead in life, and she has been able to do so despite the difficulties that always emerge along the way.

With this loan, she intends to purchase the ingredients necessary to make her sweet corn bread, thus increasing her sales. One of her short-term goals is to repair the oven she currently uses since it has been in use for over 50 years. She would also like to help her daughter raise her grandson and give leave them a good inheritance.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Marta tiene 49 años de edad, habita en el barrio Sabana Grande, es viuda y tiene una hija de 30 años de edad que vive con ella y con quien comparte los gastos familiares. Su actividad es la elaboración de cosa de horno, ella tiene 35 años de experiencia en el negocio que ha sido tradicional en la familia la elaboración de este rico hornado.

Comenzó desde muy pequeña y su mamá le heredo las herramientas para que siguiera adelante, y lo ha podido hacer pese a las dificultades que siempre salen en el camino.

Con el préstamo pretende comprar materia prima para ampliar el nivel de venta. Uno de sus planes a corto plazo es poder remodelar el horno que actualmente usa, porque éste ya tiene más de 50 años de uso. También desea poder ayudar a su hija en la crianza de su nieto, y poder dejarles un buen patrimonio a ambos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make sweet corn bread

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: asdfsdf

loans.name: Marisol De Los Santo

texts.es:
Ms. Marisol de los Santos, who lives in the La Primavera neighborhood, is a 37-year-old married mother of a 10-year-old boy. Her husband is a contractor who helps with the household expenses.

Ms. Marisol owns a cosmetics business. She started out with loans from microfinance institutes and now has 7 years of experience with these banks. Wit this loan, she intends to expand her inventory so that she can reach other areas and increase her profits, thus being able to advance in life.

She would like to finish the construction of her house, as well as give her son the best education and show him the value of hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Marisol habita en el barrio La Primavera, tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de diez años, su esposo es contratista y ayuda a los gastos del hogar.

Doña Marisol tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos. Ella comenzó con prestamos de bancos comunales, ya tiene siete años de experiencia con financieras, con el préstamo pretende ampliar su inventario para poder extenderse a los departamentos y obtener más ganacias, para así poder salir adelante.

Desea terminar de construir su casa, al mismo tiempo desea darle la mejor educación a su hijo, y enseñarle el valor del trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to expand business and increase sales

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es:
Mr. Calixto V. is a 52-year-old married man who lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. He and his wife live alone now that their two children are married adults who lead their own lives.

Mr. V. is a security guard who works very hard to support his wife. His greatest wish is to be able to finish construction of his house, which is why he is requesting this loan. He would like to purchase construction supplies and finish building his home little by little, just as he has been doing for many years.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Calixto tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y habita en el barrio Laureles Sur de la ciudad de Managua, vive solo en su casa de habitación ya que sus dos hijos son mayores de edad, están casados y tienen una vida independiente a él.

Don Calixto es guarda de seguridad, trabaja muy duro para mantener a su esposa, su mayor sueño es poder terminar de construir su vivienda, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construción y seguir levantando su vivienda poco a poco, a cómo lo ha venido haciendo desde hace muchos años atrás.

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies to finish building his house

loans.name: Iysha

texts.en: Aysha is 55 years old and a widow with 2 children under her care.  She is a state trained midwife who owns a small private clinic in the outskirt of Makeni town. She provides prenatal care to expectant mothers who  cannot afford the service from the hospitals.  She also deliver babies in her clinic.  With her previous loans, she improved her clinic and purchased delivery beds and other necessary items.  Iysha now has many mothers who come for the service but she lacks some materials to provide the service efficiently.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $1200 for that purpose.

loans.use: Iysha would like to purchase a bed and bedding, medicines and sanitary items

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia began with the sale of sodas, fried snacks, frozen popsicles, ball point pens, and sweet bread in a small room of her home. After this, with the small profits that came from the sales and with the help of her family, she built a bigger location and began the sale of groceries. This has created good profits, but she wants to have her store well stocked in order that all the clients that come in needing something will easily be able to find it in her store.

She needs a loan of $300 that she will repay in 6 months. In order to buy merchandise and display cases and in order to have a sign in front of her business and thus gain publicity. She tells us that with the help of Kiva she will be able to attain her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Amelia inicio con la venta de refrescos, frituras, paletas de nieves, bolis y bollos, en un pequeño cuarto de su hogar. Después con las pocas ganancias que le dejaba la venta y con la ayuda de sus familiares construyo un local más amplio e inicio la venta de abarrotes lo que le ha dejado buenas ganancias, pero ella desea tener su tienda bien surtida para que todos los clientes que lleguen a su tienda y necesiten de algo lo encuentren fácilmente con ella.

Ella necesita de un crédito de $300 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de mercancía, compra de exhibidores y para rotular la parte de enfrente de su negocio y así tener publicidad, ella confía que con el apoyo de Kiva podrá lograrlo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and a sign

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol has two children, one 3 years old and one 4 years old. She decided to begin her business in order to ensure the future and economic well-being of her children. The earnings of her husband were not sufficient, and so she began the business with some savings that she had. She began selling jewelry and later beauty products. She did well with this activity, and so she decided to rent a location where she currently has her business.

Now she is asking for a loan of $575 that she will repay in 6 months in order to remodel her business and air condition a sales area that will permit her to give better service to her clients. With your help, she will be able to make this a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Marisol tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 4 años, ella decidió emprender su negocio para asegurar el futuro y bienestar económico de sus hijos, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente por lo que inicia el negocio con algunos ahorros que tenia, empezó vendiendo joyerías y después productos de belleza, le fue bien con esta actividad así que decidido rentar un local donde actualmente tiene s su negocio.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local y acondicionar un área de ventas que le permita dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu poyo esto podrá hacerse realidad

loans.use: To remodel a business

loans.name: Ungwana Elgon Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Jane S. is an average Kenyan woman. She is 43 years old, and married with four children. She also lives with the two orphaned children of her late sister, who perished two years ago.

Jane started her second-hand clothes business two years ago after accumulating savings from her previous job in Eldoret town. She sells ladies’ wear but would like to diversify by adding men’s and children’s clothing as well. Every week, Jane purchases four bales of clothing from a local clothes wholesale market and then sells them to her regular customers. With the little profit that she gets from her business, she is still able to feed, clothe, and educate her children. With the help of her loan, Jane will be able to purchase many bales of clothes and increase her monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Jane would increase her stock of used clothing with her portion of this group loan.

loans.name: Sandra Elva

texts.es:
Sandra is single and she sells shoes from catalogs. She began doing this so as to have an income, since she had to sell a gift shop that she owned (which had been her only source of income). She began selling shoes in November 2005 and little by little she has managed to increase her clientele and currently has good sales.

She is requesting a loan of $500.00, which she will pay back in 6 months, to remodel and expand the sales area in her shop. With your help, Sandra can achieve her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra es soltera y se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, actividad que emprendió para tener ingresos, ya que tuvo la necesidad de traspasar su tienda de regalos que era su única fuente de ingresos. Inicio en noviembre del 2005, poco a poco ha logrado incrementar su cartera de clientes y actualmente tiene muy buenas ventas.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que esta dispuesta pagar 6 en meses para remodelar y ampliar el área de ventas de su local. Con tu apoyo Sandra podrá cumplir sus objetivos.

loans.use: To remodel her shop

loans.name: Royal Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Julius L. is a 43 year old Kenyan father of four children. He also lives with the two orphaned children of his late sister, who perished two years ago.

Julius started his business three years ago after accumulating savings from his previous job. He currently operates a small posho mill (maize grinder) in his neighborhood, and stocks maize that he sells to his customers. He occasionally also sells millet and sorghum to better enable him to support his family. With the little profit that he gets from the business, Julius still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate his children and to pay the rent for his house. But with the help of his loan, he will be able to purchase more bags of maize to sell to his customers and boost his sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Julius would purchase more bags of maize with his portion of this group loan.

loans.name: Norma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Norma is single and sells women’s shoes and purses for a living. She started this business in order to cover some of the expenses she had because she was not able to help her family with the salary from her job. She started her business 5 years ago with the help of her mother, who lent her some money so that she could buy merchandise. Her business is going well since she now has a business space in which to sell her products.

She needs a loan of $975.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can remodel her business space because she would like to expand it. With your support, she will achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es soltera y se dedica a la venta de zapatos y bolsas para dama inicio el negocio para cubrir algunas necesidades económicas que tenia, ya que con el sueldo que percibía en su trabajo no le alcanzaba y ella deseaba ayudar a los gastos familiares. Inicio hace 5 años con la ayuda de su mama quien le presto dinero para que empezara a comprar mercancía. Actualmente le va bien ya que cuenta con un local donde vende sus productos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para la remodelación de su local, ya que desea ampliarlo. Con tu apoyo ella podrá hacer esto posible.

loans.use: Remodel business space

loans.name: Patricia Ernilda

texts.es:
Patricia realized that in her community many people work at selling clothing and other common items. She decided to offer a periodic transportation service so that people in her community who work in sales could have the opportunity to go the free trade zone in Santa Elena, since there is a greater assortment of clothing and other items at a good price. In this way she can help her people and at the same time have a business that will earn her a good profit.

She needs a loan of $250.00, which she will pay back over 6 months, in order to make a trip to Santa Elena for this season. The town fair is coming up, and people are able to make a lot of sales. So, they want to take advantage of the opportunity to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia al darse cuenta que por su comunidad, mucha gente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa y otros artículos de uso común, decidió ofrecer una excursión para que la gente de su comunidad que se dedica al comercio tuviera la oportunidad de ir de compras a la zona libre (Santa Elena), ya que ahí hay mayor surtido de ropa y artículos, a un mejor precio, y así ayuda a su gente y al mismo tiempo iniciar un negocio para ella y que le dejaría buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para poder hacer una excursión para esta temporada ya que en estas fechas es la feria del pueblo y hay muchas ventas, por lo que sus clientes quieren aprovechar para ir a comprar mercancía..

loans.use: To make a trip to transport people from her community so tht they can get better prices for merchandize in a free trade zone.

loans.name: Freddy Rene

texts.es:
Freddy is married and a father of an eleven year-old boy. He began his business when he saw that he wasn’t covering his family’s expenses. He bought a piece of land on the outskirts of the city and there he constructed pens for raising pigs. Little by little he has improved his situation. The demand has been so high that now he wants to begin raising sheep, for which he needs to invest in buying some sheep and food to make more sales.

Freddy is requesting a loan of US $250, which he will pay back in six months, to invest in the animals. With your support, it will be possible for him to do it.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Freddy es casado y es padre de un niño de 11 años. Empezó su negocio al ver que no alcanzaba a cubrir sus gastos familiares, compro un terreno a las afueras de la ciudad y ahí construyo chiqueros para la crianza de cerdos, y así poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante, tanto ha sido su demanda que ahora quiere empezar con la crianza de borregos, por lo que necesita invertir comprando algunos de estos animales borregos y comprándoles alimento para tener mas ventas.

Por ello Freddy solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para poder invertirlo en animales. Con tu apoyo el podrá hacerlo posible.

loans.use: Buy animals

loans.name: Maria Maurica

texts.es:
Mauricia has been in the hammock business for over 10 years. She learned how to make them when she was a young girl. Thanks to her mother’s teachings, she now makes hammocks and sells them, thus allowing her to help cover the family expenses as a mother of two children ages 4 and 14.

She currently needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase the materials needed to make more hammocks. With your help, she can keep her business running.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mauricia tiene mas de 10 años dedicándose al negocio de las hamacas, ella desde muy pequeña aprendió a elaborarlas gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, por lo que ahora aprovecha de lo aprendido para elaborar sus hamacas y luego venderlas y así tener un apoyo para el gasto familiar, ya que es madre de dos hijos de 4 y 14 años.

Ahora ella necesita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y así poder elaborar mas hamacas. Con tu ayuda ella podrá seguir con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase hammock materials

loans.name: Elsy Fabiola

texts.es:
Elsy is a married mother of 3 daughters ages 4, 15, and 20. She has worked in the hammock business since she was young. After much hard work and with her husband’s help, she managed to save up some money that she used in making and selling hammocks, which allows her to earn a living and help her husband with the household expenses.

She is currently requesting a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase the materials needed to make hammocks. With your help, you can contribute to the development of Elsy’s business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Elsy esta casada y es madre de 3 mujeres de 4, 15 y 20 años; desde muy temprana edad se dedica al comercio, y a base de mucho esfuerzo, y con ayuda de su esposo, logro juntar un pequeño capital el cual puso a trabajar en la elaboración y venta de hamacas, lo cual le permite tener un ingreso para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $ 250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y elaborar mas hamacas. Con tu apoyo podrás contribuir al desarrollo del negocio de Elsy.

loans.use: Purchase hammock materials

loans.name: Erika Mercedes

texts.es:
Erika is a mother of two children, one is 10 and the other one is 6 years old. She began her business after she got a divorce from her husband. She needed a way to make a living and she decided to work for herself, that way she would not have to depend on anyone. Everything turned out as planned because she was able to pay her daily expenses and provide for her children. She began her business about eight years ago and little by little she has been able to succeed. She started out just selling just food items and other household items. Then, she decided that since she had enough space, she would open up an internet cafe in her store. Erika was able to invest her money in the internet café and then earn more money since she always has paying customers using the computers.

She needs a loan of $975 dollars. She will pay it back in 6 months. That way it will help her upgrade her computers with better programs and to stock her little store with more items. All this will make her store compete better against all the other local businesses around the block. With your help Erika’s business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Erika es madre de dos hijos de 10 y 6 años, inició el negocio cuando se divorcio y no tenia como salir adelante por esa razón se puso a trabajar por su cuenta para no depender de nadie y le dio resultado porque pudo cubrir sus necesidades y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Comenzó hace 8 años con el negocio y poco a poco lo ha ido mejorando, en un inicio solo vendía abarrotes y ya después lo habilite también como cibercafé para poder prestar mas servicios y aprovechar el espacio que tenia en el local. De esa manera pudo invertir el capital que tenia y sacar mas dinero ya que casi siempre tiene gente y sus ganancias se han ido incrementando con las cosas nuevas que le va incorporando al negocio.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses. El cual le va servir para poder actualizar mis pcs con mejores programas y poder surtir un poco de abarrotes el lugar. Todo esto para poder estar a la vanguardia y poder competir con los demás locales que están cerca del suyo. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: Update her computers

loans.name: Kisumu Ndogo Upendo Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Millicent A. is a mother aged 43 with 3 children. She lives with 1 orphan child of her late brother who perished 2 years ago.

Millicent started her shoes business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from her former work place in a local hospital located in Eldoret town. She currently deals in ladies’ shoes but would like to diversify to children’s and men’s collections as well. As she is the bread winner for the family, it would enable her to support both her children and her husband, whose job is low-paying.

With the little profit that she gets from the business, Millicent still struggles to pay her house rent and to feed and clothe her children. But with the help of her loan, Millicent will be able to add more stock and increase her monthly sales.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand shoes in bulk

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.es:
Nicasio is married and has 2 kids. He began his business because he didn’t have any other resources to rely on. Every single time he tried to look for work, people rejected him, making it difficult. That’s why he decided to open up his own business. He owns a store to help his family. He started his store at his home and has been doing it for 6 years now. He started with fruits, candy, and then slowly increased his merchandise. Now he has a greater variety of everything. His business has increased constantly. He likes his job because he’s his own boss.

He needs a loan of $300 and he will pay it in about 6 months. This credit will help restock more merchandise. It’ll be possible with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Nicasio es casado y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 18 años. Inició el negocio porque no cuenta con estudios por lo que le cerraban las puertas de los trabajos constantemente siendo muy difícil que lo contrataran, por esa razón se propuso abrir su propio negocio y así lo hizo. Puso una tiendita de abarrotes para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Comenzó hace mas de 6 años con el negocio lo inicio en su propia casa solo con mercancía de frituras y dulces y después poco a poco fue surtiendo de tal manera que ahora ya tiene mas variedad para que la gente que vive por allí lo busque y compre su mercancía. su negocio poco a poco ha ido creciendo y le gusta este trabajo porque es su propio jefe y tomo las decisiones que mejor le parecen para hacer crecer su tiendita y con esto mis ingresos.

El necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses. Este crédito le servirá para poder surtir más mercancía. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Marcos Guadalupe

texts.es:
Marcos began his business with the knowledge his last job gave him painting houses. He was good at what he did so he thought it would be better if he opened his own business. Hiss goal was to satisfy his costumers like he did at his old job but even better and at a lower price. He has had his own business for 2 years and it has been going well. Now he has an office space for his business where he personally attends his customers. He also has hired workers to help him so he can finish the jobs more quickly. He has been getting better and better at what he has been doing and been getting it done more quickly and for a more affordable price.

He needs a loan of $350, which he will repay in 6 months. This loan will help him to pay for advertisements that he has planned to do this months. He wants his business to be known in other sectors of the city because he wants to increase his business. This will be possible with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe Robles of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Marcos inició el negocio porque cuando estuvo trabajando en otra parte aprendió el manejo de las pinturas y el impermeabilizado, ya después le pareció mejor idea abrir su propio negocio con los mismo servicios pero a mejor costo. Comenzó hace 2 años y le ha ido bien, ahora ya tiene su propio local donde atiende personalmente a los clientes, y tiene a más personas que le ayudan a sacar el trabajo más rápidamente. Incluso los tiempos de servicio se han ido perfeccionando de tal manera que ahora el trabajo queda rápido y a un precio accesible.

El necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses. Este crédito me va a ayudar a pagar publicidad que tiene proyectada para este mes ya que quiere darse a conocer en otros lugares de la ciudad porque quiero incrementar mi mercado. Con tu apoyo esto será posible.

loans.use: Pay for advertisements

loans.name: Kapsaos Women's Group

texts.en:
Rose A. is an average Kenyan woman aged 44 and married with 4 children. She also lives with 2 orphan children of her late brother who perished 2 years ago.

Rose started her second-hand clothes business 6 years ago after accumulating savings from her former work place in a local hO. in Eldoret town. She purchases at least 5 bales of clothes every week, which she sells to her regular customers at the municipality market. With the little profit that she gets from her business, Rose is still able to feed, clothe and educate her children. With the help of her loan, Rose will be able to purchase more bales of clothes to enable her to increase her monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Tuinuane Youth Group
loans.use: To increase his cereals stock

loans.name: Sam Eourn

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Eourn S. lives in Trauk Leak Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and her family is in poor condition because they live in an old house. During rainy season, Mrs. Sam Eourn S.’s family finds life very difficult. Thefore,  Mrs. Sam Eourn S. has decided to ask for a loan to build a new house to replace the old one. She is 38 and married with four children, all the four of whom are attending state school. Her husband, Mr. Theng Dul, is a subsistence farmer. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem S. is farmer and soup seller in Rong Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her soup selling business is facing some problems because the prices of ingredients have increased. Additionally, on her plantation, Mrs. Yem S. has insufficient animals to plough her rice field. She has therefore asked for a loan to buy cows to work in the field. Mrs. Yem S. is 40 and married with four children, all of whom are attending school. Her husband, Mr. Man Chin, is a subsistence farmer. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: to buy cows to work in the field in order to cultivate a rice plantation.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Mrs. Vuthy S. is rice farmer and Khmer noodle seller in Kork Sandek Village in Kampong Speu Province. Mrs. Vuthy S. needs to buy a cow so that she can plough her field and this is way she has asked for a loan. Mrs. Vuthy S. is married with two children, one of whom is enrolled in school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mon Thaov, is a subsistence farmer. Previously, Mrs. Vuthy S. obtained a loan to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds for her plantation. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cows in order to plough her rice field.

loans.name: Sophakdie

texts.en: Mrs. Sophakdie S. lives in Chrork Russey Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a subsistence farmer and a broker who buys rice to re-sell for a profit. Mrs. Sophakdie S. usually cultivates rice during rainy season and vegetable in dry season. As the rice business has improved, Mrs. Sophakdie S. now wants ask for a loan to buy huge rice stock to re-sell it. Mrs. Sophakdie S. is 30 and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband, Theang Suong, is a farmer and he always helps his wife to buy rice and transport it. Last year, Mrs. Sophakdie S. has obtained a loan to start a rice business. Additionally, during that time Mrs. Sophakdie S.’s husband fell from a palm tree and she spent $75 to cure him. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy huge rice stock to re-sell it.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Aun S. is a subsistence farmer and tailor in Au Krom Village in Kampong Speu Province. Even though she has the two business activities, Mrs. Oun S. cannot support her family expenses. Additionally, her family live in an old house and it has a bad roof. Mrs. Oun S. has therefore decided to ask for a loan to fix the roof. Her husband, Mr. Sokhun Hang, is a farmer and construction worker. Mrs. Oun S. has two children both of them are enrolled in school. Last year, Mrs. Oun S. obtained a loan to buy a sewing machine to start her tailoring business. During that time, her youngest child got ill and she spent unforeseen expenses. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to fix the roof.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly N. is a subsistence farmer and she also sells farming equipment. Aside of these activities, she is a Khmer noodle maker in Svay Phluos Village in Kampong Speu Province. Last year, she  obtained a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Ly N. now would like to buy one more cow  to plough her rice field during rainy season. Thus, she would like a loan for this purpose. She is 54 and a widow of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to plough her rice field during the rainy season.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Mrs. Lun O. is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Chheourn Thou, is also a farmer. They have four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is studying in state school. All the business activities in Mrs. Lun O.’s family still do not provide enough money to build a new house in order to replace their old house. Thus, Mrs. Lun O. has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Last year, Mrs. Lun O. was ill and the family spent $100 to cure her. In the photo, you will see some timber and house construction workers. Mrs. Lun O.’s husband is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To build a new house in order to replace their old house.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en: Mrs. Sinat P. is a rice and vegetable farmer in Kraing Thnorl Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Sophat Hun, is a farmer and construction worker. Additionally, he is a pig breeder but in this business he is facing some problems as his pigs have disease and some have died.  Thus, Mrs. Sinat P. now would like to obtain a loan to buy more pigs and pig feed. The remainder of the money she intends to use to buy some medicine to cure his pigs. Mrs. Sinat P. has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one is a car taxi-driver, two  attend school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig feed and the rest of money she will use to buy some medicine to cure her pigs.

loans.name: Savuth

texts.en: Mrs. Savuth S. is a farmer in Prey Beng Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Chanthuon Suong, is a farmer. They have three children, one of whom is car taxi-driver while the others are studying at school. Although the members in the family have different business activities, they still have insufficient money to build a house. Thus, Mrs. Savuth S. has decided to ask for a loan to add to the money that she has been saving for many years so that she can build it. In the picture, you will see the new stairs that have just built. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: to build a new house.

loans.name: Muhammad Arif

texts.en: Muhammad Arif, son of A. J., is a 50-year-old man. Muhammad Arif returned to his home country, Afghanistan, several months ago, and he is currently living in the district of Sorkhrood in the Ningarhar province. There are 6 people in his family, yet he is the family member who must support the entire family. Therefore, he opened a retail food shop in the Sorkhrood bazaar. Nevertheless, he wants to improve this business by buying more materials for his shop. Accordingly, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 30,000 Afghanis ($625) through AFSG to achieve his goals with respect to his shop.

loans.use: To improve and expand his shop's operations by purchasing additional materials

loans.name: Neurn

texts.en: Mrs. Neurn E. is a farmer in Taing Russey Village in Kampong Speu Province. In the dry season she grows vegetables and during the monsoon season she grows rice. Last year she hired a cow to plough her field but it was very expensive, so she is now asking for a loan so that she can buy a cow for herself. She is 44 and married with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in state school. Her husband, Mr. Ron Chuon, is a farmer. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow to plough her land.

loans.name: Joyo

texts.id:
Joyo S. is a person who is in the recycling business. He has been in this business for 5 years. With this loan, Joyo S. would use as capital to expand his business. From current business he could save Rp10,000 (about US$1.10)/day. Since he is not yet married, the business income is sufficient to pay for his own needs, like paying house rent and also for daily food and drink expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Joyo S. adalah seorang yang mempunyai usaha sebagai pemulung. Usaha ini sudah ditekuni selama 5 tahun. Dengan pinjaman kali ini, Joyo S. akan menggunakannya sebagai modal untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Dari usaha ynag dijalaninya dia mampu menyisihkan Rp.10.000 per hari. Karena saat ini dia belum menikah, penghasilan dari usahanya cukup untuk kebutuhannya sendiri seperti membayar biaya sewa rumah dan juga untuk makan dan minum sehari-hari.

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Keurn

texts.en: Mrs. Keurn H. lives in Kork Char Village in Kampong Speu Province. She and her husband, Mr. Yea Sat, are farmers. They have five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending school. Even though the family’s members have different business activities, they still have insufficient money to build a new house. Thus, Mrs. Keurn H. asked a loan to add with her profit to build the house. Recently, Mrs. Keurn H.’s youngest child got typhoid and she had to spend $38 to cure that disease.  Her husband is presented in the left of the picture.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
H. Eunice sells cosmetics and palm oil. She is married and has 2 children. Her business is doing very well, and she wants to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

She is requesting a loan so she can buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
A. Margaret sells used clothing. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. Her business is doing very well, and she wants to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

She is requesting a loan so she can buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mrs. Hun K. is a subsistence farmer and owns a small grocery store in Taing Russey Village in Kampong Speu Province. She manages her grocery business well and it is growing fast. This is why she has asked for a loan to buy more grocery goods. Mrs. Hun K. is 45 and married with three children, two of whom are construction workers while the other one is enrolled in school. Her husband, Preourng Hang, is a farmer. Last year, Mrs. Hun K. got appendicitis and she spent $500 for her disease. Her husband is on the right of the right of the picture.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Nadya

texts.id:
The business of Nadya U. is selling packed rice daily. Her husband's income as a driver is not enough to fulfill household needs. That is why she is also working. Every day she sells packed rice around her house in Mertasari Suwung street, Denpasar. Her customers are mostly workers who works in that area. Afterwards in the afternoon she moves to sell in Bdung's market, since in evening that place is packed with visitors. Her daily income is sufficient to fulfill household needs. Nadya U. hopes the help could be used to add business capital., and also to buy an oven and other cooking utensils.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang dijalani oleh Nadya U. sehari-harinya adalah sebagai penjual nasi bungkus. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai sopir belum cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Karena itu dia juga ikut bekerja. Setiap hari dia berjualan nasi bungkus disekitar rumahnya di Jl. Mertasari Suwung Denpasar. Pelanggannya kebanyakan para pekerja yang bekerja dikawasan itu. Kemudian pada sore harinya dia berjualan di Pasar Badung, karena pada sore hari tempat ini sangat ramai pengunjungnya. Penghasilan yang didapatnya setiap hari cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Nadya U. mengharapkan bantuan untuk dipakai sebagai tambahan modal usaha dan juga untuk membeli kompor dan peralatan masak.

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en: Mrs. Yeang M. lives in Samparn Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer but she cannot make much revenue because her patch of land is so small. Mrs. Yeang M. now wants to expand her plantation so she asked a loan to buy a piece of land in order to cultivate her rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Son Chhim, is a farmer and pig breeder. They have one child who is attending school. Previously, Mrs. Yeang M. has obtained a loan to buy cows to do plough the field. Her husband is presented in the picture with Mrs. Yeang M..

loans.use: to buy a piece of land in order to cultivate her rice and vegetables.

payments.comment: Mrs. Yeang Meas has paid off her loan 7 months in advance! AMK and Kiva would like to thank you for lending to her and we hope you lend again soon! We\'ll do a journal on her very soon!

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Mrs. Phal P. is a farmer in Prey Tachap Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Paok Yin, is a farmer. They have four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and one generates an income from making palm tree juice. The youngest child is studying at state school. These family members have different business activities but they still do not have enough money to build their new house. Mrs. Phal P. has a plan to build a new house so she has decided to ask for a loan to achieve her goal. Last year, Mrs. Phal P. obtained a loan from AMK to buy cows to plough her rice field. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to build a new house for the family.

loans.name: Jitro

texts.id:
Every day from 5:00 AM, Jitro starts to work collecting for used and broken items. After collected, he brought the items to a storage place where it was weighed and sold. Sometimes he also bought used items from houses at a low price, to be sold to the storage place for a small profit. Before being sold, those used and broken items were first cleaned and sorted according to type. Each type has a different price/kg. The profit obtained is used as capital, household expenses, and to pay house rent.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Setiap harinya, mulai dari jam 05.00 pagi Jitro sudah bekerja mencari barang-barang bekas dan rongsokan. Sesudah terkumpul, dia kemudian membawa ke tempat penampungan dimana nantinya akan ditimbang dan dijual.
