Kadang juga dia membeli barang-barang bekas dari rumah- rumah dengan harga yang cukup murah lalu kemudian dijual ke tempat penampungan dengan keuntungan sedikit. Sebelum dijual, barang bekas dan rongsokan dibersihkan dulu dan dipisahkan menurut jenisnya. Setaip jenis berbeda harga per kilogramnya. Keuntungan yang didapat selain dipakai sebagai modal, juga untuk kebutuhan rumah tangga dan untuk biaya bayar sewa rumah.

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.id:
Ni Ketut S. lives at Wibisana street in Denpasar, Bali. She sells Canang for living. Canang is one of the most common religious article in Hindu faith used as an offering. It usually made of basket from coconut leaf where people put some rice grain, sugar cane and flowers in it.

Ni Ketut S. sells these canang local Badung market. She has to work hard as she has 3 children that need support. Her husband already passed away so she is the sole source of income for her family.

She hopes she can get the loan to add her working capital.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut S. yang beralamat di Jl.Wibisana Denpasar, kesehariannya adalah sebagai penjual canang (alat sembahyang umat Hindu) di Pasar Badung. Ibu yang memiliki 3 orang anak ini menekuni usaha ini sejak suaminya meninggal dunia. Dia harus bekerja keras untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup anak-anaknya dan juga membiayai sekolah mereka. Dengan penghasilan yang tidak begitu besar, Ni Ketut harus bisa menyisihkan sedikit untuk tabungan. Saat ini dia membutuhkan pinjaman yang bisa dipakai sebagai tambahan modal bagi usahanya.

loans.use: to add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Ni Nyoman

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman S. has been in the business of tailor since 8 years ago. She gets the job orders from her regular customers and nearby garment businesses which usually gives her orders with big quantity. From this she can help her family financial needs and she can even saves some money for IDR 5,000 - IDR 10,000/ day (Around USD 0.5 - USD 1/ days).

She hopes to get the loan to enable her to buy more cloth/ fabric and thread/ yarn.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman S. sudah menekuni usaha ini sejak 8 tahun yang lalu. Sehari-harinya dia menerima pesanan jahitan dari pelanggannya yang sudah sering menjahit ditempatnya ataupun dari garmen yang memesan dalam jumlah banyak. Dari hasil usaha ini S. dapat membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga sehari-hari dan bisa menyisihkan tabungan sebesar Rp.5.000 – 10.000 per hari. S. mengharapkan diberi pinjaman yang nantinya akan dipakai sebagai modal membeli kain dan benang untuk bahan jahitan.

loans.use: to add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
B. Ibrahim buys eggs in large quantities and sells smaller quantities to his costumers. He is married and has 3 children. His wife sells food items. His business is doing very well, and he wants to increase sales. He is running out of stock.

He is requesting a loan so he can buy more eggs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: Mr. Orn P. is a farmer and palm juice collector in Kork Meanchey Village in Kampong Speu Province. His wife, Mrs. Tak Mom is also a farmer. Mr. Orn P.’s plantation has faced a problem because he does not have  animals to plough his rice field. In order to improve his plantation, Mr. Orn P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy cows to plough his rice field. Mr. Orn P. has four children, one of whom is construction worker, one is employed in a garment factory, one is attending school and the youngest child is too young to work or study. Previously, Mr. Orn P. has obtained a loan to buy a new motorbike so his oldest child can start a motorcycle taxi-driver. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cows to plow his rice field.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Mrs. Khim P. lives in Kork Char Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is married with seven children, three of whom stay at home to help their mother, one studies at state school and the  other three are employed in a garment factory. The garment factory is far from the family home and the family have been spending a lot of money on taxis. Mrs. Khim P. has asked for this loan so that she can buy a motorcycle which the three children will use to go to work, saving money in the long run.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her three children.

loans.name: Vantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Vantha T. and her husband, Mr. Sokun Vorn were married in 1997 and have one daughter who is in primary school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Vantha has been selling vegetables for over twenty years. She bought them from Ta Khmao market (the district market) for resale at Toul Tumpoung Market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a taxi driver in Phnom Penh. They are in the process of repairing their house and  are short of money to finish it.

Mrs. Vantha is requesting a loan of US$600 to add to her own money for finishing her house.

loans.use: For repairing her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon P. and her husband, Mr. Mot Ma, were married in 1978 and have seven children: one son and six daughters. Two of their daughters are married and live outside the family home.  Of their other four daughters, two work in a garment factory, one is in school, and one stays at home. Their son is a construction worker and helps his father raise cows. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Mon has been selling corn for four years. She buys from farmers in her village for resale at Chba Ampov market in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises cows for resale.

She is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase cows for her husband to raise and sell. According to her business so far we are sure that she will have no problem in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa Yaquelin

texts.en:
R. Yaquelin sells shirts, pants, and undergarments in Monte Plata. This activity is the main source of income of the entrepreneur’s family. R. explains that she needs capital to invest in the business. She wants to buy a collection of fashionable goods, which are in high demand in her community.

The entrepreneur hopes that she’ll get this loan in a short time so that she can reach her goals and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To get a collection of clothes to add to her stock in order to increase her sales volume.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambo C. and her husband, Mr. Va Mao, were married in 1985 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Of their children, two work full time, one is a singer, one is in school and the youngest stays at home. The family is along National Road Six, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sambo and her husband have been in the business of selling Chinese and Khmer noodles, coffee, and  soft drinks for two years in their restaurant in front of their house. Beside of running a restaurant with his wife, Mr. Va is a chef for wedding ceremonies as well. The couple is in the process of expanding their restaurant to support more customers.
 
Mrs. Sambo is requesting a loan of US$700 for expanding her restaurant and builds a restroom.

loans.use: For expanding her restaurant and to build a restroom.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap K., 33, and her husband, Mr. Tunh Chun, 38, were married in 1992 and have one daughter who weaves silk at home. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sopheap has been a weaver since she was sixteen years old. It is a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is a weaver as well. He learned his skill from his wife and started weaving in 1992. The couple sells their finished products to a middle man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. Sopheap is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk material for weaving and to build one restroom for family use.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to build one restroom.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Mrs. Vin R. and her husband, Mr. Savet Soung were married in 1993 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of their children are in school and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Vin has been a weaver for over ten years. It is a skill she learned from her parents. She sells their finished products to a middle man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. 
Her husband has been a mason for fifteen years and he also raises cows. 

Mrs. Vin is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase silk material for weaving and to buy another cow for raising. According to her business so far we are sure that she will have no problem in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to buy a cow for raising.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokchea O., 49, and her husband, Mr. Phan Tem, 57, were married in 1979 and have four sons. One of their sons is married and lives outside the family home. Of their other three sons, one works in a garment factory, one helps his parents in raising pigs and producing rice wine at home, and one is in school. The family lives across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sokchea and her husband have been in the business of raising pigs and producing rice wine for over two years. They buy piglets from farmers in the same village and nearby villages and sell the raised pigs to the middle man who will take it to sell in another place.

Nowadays, pig has a good price so Mrs. Sokchea wants to expand her farm and buy more piglets for raising. She is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase piglets for raising.

loans.use: To purchase to purchase piglets for raising.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sam Ath

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sam-Ath and her husband, Mr. San Touch were married in 1985 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. One son works with his father and other three children are in school. Their two daughters  also weave silk at home when they are free from their studies. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. C. Sam-Ath has been farming and raising cows for many years. She grows papayas, bananas, eggplant on the farm not so far from her house. Her husband runs boat service that runs goods such as vegetables from the island to Phnom Penh. Now his boat is broken and he needs money to repair it.

Mrs. C. Sam-Ath is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase silk material for weaving and to repair the boat.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to repair a boat.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance S.  sells used clothing. She is married and has 6 dependents. Her husband is a driver. Business is doing very well but  she wishes to increase sales. 
	
She is asking for a loan of $500 to buy more used clothing for sale.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Fautina

texts.en:
Fautina O.  sells used clothing. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. Business is doing very well but  she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.
	
She is asking for $200 as additional capital to buy more used clothing for sale.

loans.use: As an additional capital to buy more clothing for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Joana Estevão Langa

texts.en:
Joana M. is 48 years old and originally from Gaza Province. She has been a widow since 1997. She was married for more than 18 years and had 4 children: a man of 25 years old, a woman of 23 years old, a woman of 21 years old and a boy of 11 years old. The two oldest children are already working as primary teachers and the second woman will become a nun in the Catholic convent this year. Joana is responsible for her younger son and a niece who is an orphan (her mother, Joana’s sister, died a few years ago). 

In 1993 Joana moved with her family to Namaacha, a village bordering Swaziland, because her husband was transferred there. She also requested transfer and was hired as a permanent teacher at Namaacha’s Primary School, where she works until today.  Currently Joana has also been doing overtime work at night. 

Joana decided to expand her house from a 1-bedroom to 2-bedroom using a loan from BIM, the local bank, but with the the exorbitant interest charged she wasn’t able to conclude the expansion. In 2007 Joana heard about Hluvuku through a friend that was already a client, and has requested a loan to keep expanding her house.

This will be Joana’s second loan with Hluvuku, Kiva’s first one. The first was used to buy construction materials and this loan will be used to pay the construction worker and finish the expansion. In the future Joana would like to ask for a new loan to build a wall around her house to give more privacy to her family.

loans.use: To pay a construction worker and for construction materials.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en: Faridah is a businesswoman who sells traditional attire called Kanga and Vitenge in Kariakoo.  She has been in business for the past five years, and her profits have helped her to place her five children in school, build her own house and sustain her living. She is now in need of a loan in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Nazirjon

texts.en:
Nazirjon Khudoinazarov is 29. He’s a father of two children. He’s married and his wife, Bibijamol, helps with farming. Nazirjon is working hard on the farm and his business includes growing and selling of agricultural products such as onion, garlic, potatoes and maize.

He wants to buy chemicals and seed and so he needs a loan of $900 for a term of nine months. After gathering his harvest he wants to sell it to local inhabitants with lower prices than in the market.

Nazirjon is promising to be accurate with paying the loan. Nazirjon and his hopeful wife are counting on your help. Be an important part of Nazirjon’s business.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and chemicals.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is an entrepreneur from the Kherson region of Ukraine. She runs a business selling women’s outer wear in the Dneprovskyi market. Antonina plans her business policies and strategy very thoroughly. She handles all challenging situations with sheer optimism and enthusiasm. Antonina has been in this trade for three years and she has already invested about $19,000 in her business.

Antonina has always tried to stay away from any conflicts and competition. She doesn’t envy her fellow vendors. On the contrary, she tries to be an example of helpfulness and friendliness to all those around her.

Currently Antonina doesn’t have her own place to live. She lives in a dorm facility and is dreaming about having her own apartment or house which would give her certain economic independence.

Today Antonina is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas ($US1050) to increase assorted merchandise in her kiosk. We are hoping that one day Antonina will be able to generate more profits so she can save enough to afford her own apartment.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory.

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat is married with one daughter. He and his family live in Kherson. Marat is a private entrepreneur who sells sports footwear in the central city market. Marat is very disciplined. One of his strong characteristics is his ability to listen and persuade which helps him in his work with customers. Marat has been in the market for 10 years. Today he has about $3000 invested in his business.  

Marat‘s main goal is to provide his family with a decent life and stable future. He has always tried to achieve financial and economic independence and make a career. Marat is hoping to see his business flourish and succeed. He believes this loan of 2500 Grivnas will be one of the steps towards his goal. Marat has repaid 12 previous loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a grandmother (babushka) and great-grandmother from Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine. She has three children, eight grandchildren and one great-grandchild. A widow, Anna helps to support herself with a small market business selling meats and sausages. She currently has two sales locations, one in a bulk sale market and one at a regular retail market. Anna has been in this type of business for 16 years. Loans received through Nadiya Ukraine have helped her establish a successful, profitable business.

Anna has requested a loan of 5000 Ukrainian Grivnas ($US1050) to help purchase a new supply of meat and sausages called “kalbasa”. This loan will allow her to purchase 150 kilograms of meat so she can increase her inventory and continue earning a good income.

loans.use: Purchase more meat for her market sales.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan works as an attorney’s assistant in legal proceedings, in court, in city hall and all legal related matters. He resides in the Villa Copacabana neighborhood of La Paz. He is married and his wife is employed. He has two daughters that are of school age. This is the second time that Juan requests a loan in Impro and the second time that he asks for Kiva’s help. The loan will be used to purchase school supplies for his two daughters and for their monthly tuition. His hard work and his desire to get ahead allow him to assume this loan. His prior loan from Kiva has been paid in full and according to the required terms.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Juan trabaja como asistente de abogados realizando trámites legales, en el juzgado, alcaldía, Derechos Reales y Todo lo referente al área legal. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz. Es casado y su esposa es empleada, Tiene dos Hijas en edad escolar. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva; el crédito será destinado para la compra de material escolar de sus dos hijas como también el pago de las mensualidades del colegio. Su trabajo y las ganas de superación le permiten acceder a este crédito. El crédito anterior conseguido a través de Kiva ha sido pagado en su totalidad y de acuerdo a los plazos establecidos.

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies and payment of tuition for his daughters.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: La Restauracion (Restoration) Group

texts.en:
Berty Cristóbal is a young woman who lives with her husband and three children, aged 14, 16 and 21 years old.  They all live in small farming town called Hato Mayor, and Berty has started a small business selling used and new clothing, as well as small home decorations.

She is asking for this loan so that she can increase the merchandise she is able to have on hand, and thus be able to sell more.  She would also like to buy some pots and pans to begin selling as well, for a little bit of variety.

Although life can often be challenging and difficult Berty is optimistic that this loan will help her improve her life and her family’s lives.  It is her goal to one day own her own home, and also have enough money to buy and build her own big store to sell her products from—and above all, it is her dream to have enough money to pay for her children to study at the local  university.

On behalf of the entire team at Esperanza International, as well as Berty and her entire group—we thank you for your support and generosity!

loans.use: To buy more merchandise,  and expand the variety of products she is able to offer.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos lives in his own home with his children and his wife. His home is located in 18th Street in the Bajo Llojeta neighborhood of the city of La Paz. Both he and his wife dedicate themselves to selling charcoal and their business is going well. He is requesting a loan to increase his working capital in order to reach more clients especially in supermarkets. His prior history is good and he qualifies for a new loan. Juan Carlos obtained a prior loan through Kiva which is paid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Juan Carlos vive en casa propia con sus hijos y su esposa, su domicilio esta en la calle 18 de la zona de bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de carbón vegetal, tanto él como la esposa se dedican a este negocio el cual está funcionando muy bien. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y así poder llegar a muchos más clientes, en especial a los supermercados. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Juan Carlos obtuvo un préstamo anterior vía Kiva, al cual está pagado en su totalidad.

loans.use: Capital to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Leonarda Martha

texts.es:
Leonarda lives in her own home with her young daughter in Ricardo Bustamante Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosi neighborhood of the city of La Paz. Her business is selling fruit on the sidewalk of Buenos Aires Avenue (in the city of La Paz, as well as in the interior of the country, many fruit and vegetable vendors sell their products in stalls located on the sidewalks in the streets of the most populated neighborhoods). She is requesting a loan to increase her capital and purchase a greater variety of fruits to offer her clients. This is the second time Leonarda requests a loan through Kiva. Her prior loan has been paid in full without a problem. Her prior history is good and she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Leonarda vive en casa propia con su hija menor en la calle Ricardo Bustamante de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de fruta en la acera de la Av. Buenos Aires (en la ciudad de La paz, así como en el interior del país, muchas vendedoras de frutas, hortalizas y otros, venden sus productos en puestos ubicados en las aceras de algunas de las calles de los barrios más populosos). El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más variedad de frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes conocidos y también a nuevos clientes que caminan por su puesto de ventas. Esta es la segunda vez que Leonarda solicita un préstamo a través de Kiva. El crédito anterior ha sido pagado en su totalidad sin ningún problema. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit to attend to her clients.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo lives in a rental and his home is located on Iriarte Street in the northern section of the city of La Paz. His business is making food for events as he studied and is enrolled in hotel school. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase the necessary ingredients to make home made fruit jams (fruit, sugar, containers, etc.) which will result in additional revenue for him. Gonzalo is an old client of Kiva’s as he obtained his first loan in 2007. This loan has been paid in full. His prior history is good and he qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Gonzalo vive en anticretico, su domicilio esta en la calle Iriarte de la zona norte de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la elaboración de comida, para eventos particulares pues él estudió y es egresado de la escuela Hotelera. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de mermeladas caseras de fruta (frutas, azucar, containers,etc.), que será un ingreso adicional para su subsistencia. Gonzalo es cliente antiguo de Kiva, pues él ya obtuvo un primer préstamo el año 2007 y a la fecha dicho préstamo está pagado completamente. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to prepare and sell fruit jams

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
I need to expand the front of my house in order to have more room in my home as this house is very small. With the expansion my family would be more comfortable. I am asking for $600 dollars in order to carry out this expansion.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo la necesidad de ampliar en el frente de mi casa, para tener mas espacio en mi vivienda ya que esta casa donde habito es muy pequeña y de esta manera mi familia podría tener mejor comodidad en ella, solicito $600 dll. Y poder realizar la ampliación.

loans.use: Expansion of home.

loans.name: Judith's Jega Group

texts.en:
Judith K., age 38, is married and has 3 children (ages 18, 15 and 11). She owns two businesses: selling stationary and is a decorator of halls for functions. She started her business 10 years ago and is able to make a monthly profit of about $162.

Judith has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase both businesses. She hopes for a new loan to buy better quality materials for decorations. Judith will share this loan with her loan group, which totals 15 members.

In the picture, Judith is the 1st on the right standing, with a black scarf

loans.use: to buy good materials for better hall decoration

loans.name: La Restauracion (Restoration) Group

texts.en:
Santiago is middle aged man who lives with his wife and four children in the farming town of Hato Mayor, in the Dominican Republic.  He has asked for this loan to buy used and new clothing for his small business; in his community there are no businesses that sell both new and used clothing, so demand is often higher than what he afford to supply.  This loan will allow him to buy a larger quantity of clothing, and consequently, earn more income.

His biggest challenge right now is to enjoy his health while he has it by walking, and taking time to enjoy being active, as well as being able to pay for his five children to continue studying.  He says his dream is to own his own house, own his own land plot to put his business on, and to one day in the near future have enough savings to buy his own vehicle or motorcycle.

On behalf of the entire team at Esperanza International, as well as Santiago and his entire group—we thank you for your support and generosity!

loans.use: To buy more merchandise so that he can better meet the demand of his clients.

loans.name: La Fuerza Divina Group

texts.en:
Rosa is a lively and energetic young woman who lives with her husband and three children (aged 16, 14, and 12 years) in the rural farming town of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. For a few years now she has run a small business selling clothes and shoes, but she says that often she lacks the necessary capital to buy as much merchandise as she would like. She is asking for this loan so that she can purchase a larger variety and greater quantity of clothes and shoes.

Rosa say she dreams of seeing her children go to college so that they can enter a profession and enjoy a more comfortable life than she has been able to. She hopes that with the extra income this loan will allow her to generate she can save money and buy her own house; in the Dominican Republic those who can buy the title to their own land and house are viewed with great respect.

On behalf of the entire team at Esperanza International, as well as Rosa and her entire group—we thank you for your support and generosity!

loans.use: To buy used and new clothing, and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing utensils and electrical appliances for her kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing more products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Including other kinds of items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing wood so that she can complete her furniture orders

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris is twenty-six years old and still lives with her mother. She studies Computer Science at the university. To pay for her studies and help her family, Iris sells shoes, pants, and costume jewelry in her community. The entrepreneur explains that her customers include her university teachers, people of her church, friends, and people of the neighborhood.

Now, Iris is looking for capital to expand and diversify her inventory. The entrepreneur hopes that in a short time she’ll be able to graduate from the university and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy shoes, costume jewelry, and other goods for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.en:
Rosa María is the proud mother of two children, both in school. Her husband works as bus conductor for a private company. Rosa María has been cooking for two years, and she has attracted a faithful clientele in her sector. Each day, a lot of people visit Rosa María’s cafe to enjoy her delicious dishes. She carefully prepares sandwiches, hamburgers, and fried dishes in the morning. For lunch, she prepares typical Dominican dishes and natural juices. The entrepreneur says that her business is growing and more people are visiting the cafe.

Rosa María is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for the dishes she prepares so that she can attract more customers and move her business forward.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meals served in her cafe.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana María is a diligent and loving mother who constantly watches out for her family’s well being and tranquility. That’s why she has worked countless jobs over the years to provide for her children while they finished their secondary studies. Now, thanks to all her persistent work at these jobs, she has the good luck to see her children professionally employed.

Five months ago, Ana decided to rent a space and open a small bodega (grocery store) in a strategic location in Juliaca city. Because of the great variety of merchandise she offers – as well as the great service she provides to her customers – her store is filled with customers.

In addition to this work, Ana makes beautiful curtains, bedspreads, tablecloths and decorations in her free time. She sells these items, which are often requested by her customers, in her small store.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Ana María, es una diligente y amorosa madre que en todo momento vela por el bienestar y tranquilidad de su familia, es por esa razón que a lo largo de su vida se dedicó a innumerables actividades para tratar de mantener sin limitaciones económicas a sus queridos hijos mientras concluyan sus estudios superiores. Actualmente tiene la dicha de ver a sus hijos ya profesionales gracias a las actividades a las que se dedicó y a las que le puso mucho empeño.

Doña Anita hace 5 meses decidió alquilar un local y abrir una bodeguita en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad de Juliaca, gracias a la variedad de su mercadería y sobre todo a la buena atención que brinda en su pequeña bodeguita está siendo muy concurrida.

Adicionalmente a esta labor en sus hora libres doña Ana se dedica a confeccionar hermosas cortinas, cubrecamas, manteles de mesa y adornos decorativos que en muchos casos son solicitados por sus clientes y ofertados en su tiendita.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase supply of products in her small business

loans.name: Rebecca Tida

texts.en: Mrs Rebecca Tida S. is a teacher in an orphanage school. She is  42 years old and married with four children. She has been teaching for the last 18 years but her income is insufficient to meet the family's expenses.  Although her husband works with and NGO on a contract basis, he earns meager income and the employment is unsustainable.  The family has no house of their own.  To diversify the family source of income, Rebecca started a business of selling agricultural products.  With little savings, she purchased rice, beans, palm oil and chili pepper and distributed to her customers during weekends and collected the income bi weekly.  When Rebecca heard about kiva program, she approached SMT and requested a loan of $700 to expand her business which she would be able to repay from her salary.

loans.use: Expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Norah

texts.es:
Norah and her two children live with her in-laws’. Norah sells clothing and has seven years of experience in the retail sector. Her husband works in the city of Cochabamba as a locksmith. The competition in the clothing market is high and Norah depends on the orders placed by her clients. Norah travels to different places in order to buy wholesale clothing articles, she sells to other smaller retailers who are her clients. The loan Norah is requesting is to purchase more clothes to increase her capital and merchandise. The price of the items she sells is between 70 to 85 Bolivians. Norah currently has another loan at a third financial institution and in Agrocapital she counts with 5 years of good credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Norah es una señora que vive en la casa de sus suegros y vive con sus dos hijitos. Norah se dedica a la venta de ropa y tiene una experiencia de 7 años en este negocio, por otra parte su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Cochabamba como cerrajero. La competencia en el mercado es elevada y depende mucho de los pedidos de la clientela por los diferentes productos que ofrece Norah, ella viaja a diferentes lugares donde la ropa llega al por mayor y posteriormente la vende a las minoristas por lo que no cuenta con un puesto fijo de venta, se rije exclusivamente a los pedidos de las mismas. Con el presente crédito comprará ropa para aumentar su capital y mercadería, el precio de las prendas que trae varían entre 70 a 85 Bolivianos. Norah tiene actualmente otro crédito en una tercera institución financiera y en Agrocapital cuenta con una experiencia de 5 años con un comportamiento crediticio bueno.

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr:
Mrs. Edith A. was born in 1977 in Blitta. She is married and has two (2) children. Her main business is the purchase and sale of charcoal and maize in the Agoè area in Lomé. She started this business in 1991. The first loan she obtained allowed her to enlarge her stock of charcoal, to increase her revenue, and to contribute to meeting her family's financial needs. The loan she is currently asking for will allow her to buy 25 bags of charcoal and 2 bags of maize.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Edith est née en 1977 à Blitta. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale l'achat et vente de charbon de bois et de maïs dans le quartier d'Agoè à Lomé. Elle a démarré cette activité depuis 1991. Le premier crédit qu'elle a obtenu lui a permis d'agrandir son stock de charbon, d'accroître son chiffre d'affaires et de contribuer aux charges financières de sa famille. Le crédit qu'elle sollicite actuellement lui permettra d'acheter 25 sacs de charbon et 2 sacs de maïs.

loans.use: To buy and sell charcoal and maize

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: Abu S. is a primary teacher who earns less than $100 a month.  With skills in tie and dye, he started a small business.  He could produce the materials  during weekends and sell to retailers.  The news about the Kiva program reached S. and he approached SMT with a request of a $525 loan to purchase more materials, (ink and caustic soda) to increase the production. S. will repay his installments from his monthly salary.  Abu S. is 30 years old and single.

loans.use: Expansion of his stock of tie and dye business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es:
Bonifacio is a 55 years old man and lives with his family in the Community of Calamarca in the Province of Aroma. Bonifacio and his wife harvest tuber crops that they sell in the fairs at Villa Remedios, Vilaque since 30 years ago. At present his son has a cattle business in which he has three years of experience. Although there is competition, Bonifacio’s advantage is his excellent customer service and above all his extensive experience in the area allows him to work with responsibility, generally his sales stand is in the main plaza of Remedios. The present credit will be for the acquisition of cattle to help in the business of his son. Bonifacio does not have negative credit history in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Bonifacio tiene 55 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en la Comunidad de Calamarca en la Provincia de Aroma desde que nació. Se dedica a la comercialización de papa, chuño y tunta, que vende en las ferias de Villa remedios, Vilaque desde hace 30 años atrás junto a su esposa. Actualmente su hijo tiene un negocio de ganado vacuno donde cuenta con una experiencia de tres años. Si bien existe competencia en el mercado la ventaja de Bonifacio es su excelente trato a los clientes y sobre todo su amplia experiencia en el rubro lo que le permite trabajar con responsabilidad, generalmente su puesto de venta es en la plaza principal de Remedios. El presente crédito será para la adquisición de ganado vacuno para ayudar en el negocio de su hijo. Bonifacio no tiene antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Martha De

texts.es:
Martha is a 38-year-old lady. Her main business activity is the harvesting of vegetables (such as carrots, lettuce, etc…) in her land and property which is located in the locality of Marquiviri of Achocalla and subsequently sells her crops in the different markets of La Paz and El Alto. Marta lives in the province of Murillo and lives with her husband Justino, who helps with the harvesting of the vegetables, and their children who go to school. Martha more than 18 years experience in this business sector by harvesting and commercializing vegetable crops. Competition in the market exists, but due to Martha’s developed business skills while dealing with her clients, she has gained their loyalty. The price of the vegetable sold is not fixed since it depends on the variety of the crops and the merci of the weather. The present loan request will be used to purchase fertilizers for the land where she grows the vegetables. Martha does not have negative credit history in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Martha de 38 años de edad, se dedica a la actividad de remosión y plantación de hortalizas (zanahorias, lechugas y nabos) en su propiedad que se encuentra ubicada en la localidad de Marquiviri de Achocalla y posteriormente vende su cosecha en los diferentes mercados de La Paz y el Alto. martha radica en esta provincia de Murillo y vive junto a su familia que está compuesta por su esposo que se llama Justino quién ayuda al cultivo y cuidado de las hortalizas y los hijos que se encuentran todavía estudiando. Martha tiene una experiencia de más de 18 años en este rubro del cultivo y comercialización de hortalizas. Existe competencia en el mercado y si bien la misma es elevada, Marha ya cuenta con clientela propia que por su forma de atender y por su puntualidad en la entrega de sus productos es que se gano la confianza y preferencia de la misma. No existe un precio fijo para las hortalizas ya que el mismo varia dependiendo la variedad y también al clima. La presente solicitud será para la compra de abono par el terreno donde cultiva sus hortalizas. Martha no tiene antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: Purchase Fertilizers

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila a 64-year-old lady, owns with her husband a refrigeration appliances repair shop. They also receive additional income from the rent of 10 rooms. Teofila has a 30-year-old son, who helps out in the repair shop. Teofila and her husband have more than 5 years experience in the refrigeration appliance sector. They do not have much business competition since they fixed client and regarding the renting of the rooms, there is always demand. The present request is to open a small grocery store which they plan to build at their own residence. They will have a good variety of products, with different price offerings and quantities .This it is the sixth loan of Teofila with our institution and she has always showed to be punctual and responsible for the on time payments of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Teofila de 64 años de edad junto a su esposo tiene un negocio de taller de reparaciones de heladeras, refrigeradores, y por otra parte también perciben alquileres por la renta de 10 habitaciones. Teofila tiene un hijo de 30 años de edad, que ayuda en el taller a sus padres. teofiula y su esposo tienen una experiencia de más de 5 años en estos negocios. No tiene competencia ya que cuenta con clientes fijos y en cuestión a las habitaciones siempre existe una demanda por habitaciones. La presente solicitud es para abrir una tienda de abarrotes la cual la montará en su propio domicilio, los productos que entran en una tienda son varios y de diferentes precios estos se diferencian por producto, procedencia, cantidad, etc. Esta es la sexta secuencia de Teofila con nuestra institución y siempre demostró ser una persona puntual y responsable con sus pagos.

loans.use: Open a small grocery store

loans.name: Elba Aurelia

texts.en:
Elba Aurelia is thirty-six years old, and she and her husband have two daughters and two sons, all in school. Elba is an experienced entrepreneur. She's been selling clothes since she was a teenager. Currently, she owns and operates a small shop which she started a couple of years ago in the Trinitarios community of San Cristobal.

Elba sells silver jewelry, jeans, blouses, perfumes, beauty suplies, and the like. The entrepreneur explains that she also keeps some stock at home, and people go there to buy when the store is closed.

Elba Aurelia will use her loan to remodel the store and diversify her stock. The entrepreneur hopes that her business will allow her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, jeans, and other goods for resale.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is thirty-nine years old and a single mother of four school-age children. She lives in the Trinitarios community of San Cristobal. Natalia separated from her husband four years ago, and since then she has had to fend for her family by herself. She says that seeing to the needs of four kids is no easy job, and that some nights she doesn’t get a wink of sleep, thinking about what she can do to keep supporting her family.

Currently, Natalia sells garments to people in her community, and she says that her business has been a great help in paying for her children's schooling. With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy more garments to increase her sales volume and thus her revenue.

Natalia wants to become one of the most well-established suppliers of these goods in her sector.

loans.use: To by clothing in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Jesucita

texts.en:
Jesucita is an experienced entrepreneur. She and her six children live in the Trinitarios community of San Cristobal, where she sells an assortment of perfumes, cosmetics, shoes, and other items.

Jesucita explains that she had started the business previously, but she had to stop for a while because she didn't have easy access to capital to make the business profitable. Recently, she took out a loan from FSMA, which she invested in restarting the business. Through hard work and persistence she has made it profitable, and she repaid the first loan.

Now, Jesucita is requesting a second loan to buy more goods to increase her sales volume and her revenue. She hopes that her business’ growth will allow her to give her children a better life.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Margarito Antonio

texts.es:
Margarito lives in the town of Ticuantepe outside the city of Managua. He has worked in agriculture for thirty years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. He began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life.

Margarito is 48 years old. He is married and has three children, only one of whom is still under his care. Margarito’s wife is a vendor and helps support the family.

Margarito would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and for improving production, and thus increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of sale.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Don Margarito habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe de la ciudad de Managua, se dedica a la Agricultura desde hace treinta años, tiempo en el cual ha adquirido experiencia y amor por su tierra. Empezó a cosechar sus tierras con esfuerzos propios y ha ido saliendo adelante poco a poco.

Don Margarito tiene 48 años de edad, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solamente uno de ellos se enuentra a su cargo. La esposa de Don Margarito es comerciante y aporta al sustento de la familia.

Con el préstamo pretende comprar insumos para su cosecha, para mejorar la producción y así aumentar la calidad de sus frutos y también sus ganancias al momento de las ventas.

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural supplies for the harvest

loans.name: Omar De Jesus

texts.es:
Omar is 48 years old and married. He has four children, one of whom is financially independent. His wife is a homemaker and spends time looking after the home and the other three children.

Omar grows pineapples on land that he owns. He has made a living cultivating pineapples for several years now, and has used previous loans to successfully improve the quality of his product.

The pineapple harvest is now approaching, and Omar is requesting the present loan so that he can purchase the last supplies he needs for the harvest and ensure that his product will be of the best quality.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Don Omar es casada y tiene 48 años de edad. Su familia está compuesta por 4 hijos, de los cuales sólo uno ya es independiente a él. Su esposa es ama de casa y se dedica al cuido del hogar y de sus otros tres hijos.

Don Omar se dedica al cultivo de piñas unas tierras de su misma propiedad. Ya tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad y por medio de préstamos ha ido mejorando la calidad de su productos.

La cosecha de piña está próxima, y solicita el préstamo para comprar los últimos insumos necesarios para aplicárselo al producto y que este salga 100% de buena calidad.

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural supplies for the harvest

loans.name: Madeleyni

texts.es:
At 22 years old, Madeleyni is an enterprising and very responsible young mother. Since she was a teenager she has worked as a temporary cosmetics seller. But now that she is a mother and has more responsibility, she has decided to convert this business into her main source of family income. Currently she sells products to her neighbors, friends, relatives, and to anyone who wants to place orders for cosmetics. Because of her charisma and talents for persuasion, dedication and devotion, she has had the satisfaction of earning a considerable percentage for every product she sells. Madeleyni’s wish is to have more products in stock. She believes that making this investment will enable her to provide products upon request and thus improve her sales.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Madeleyni de 22 años de edad, es madre joven emprendedora y muy responsable. Desde adolescente se dedicó a vender productos cosméticos en forma eventual, pero ahora que ya es madre y tiene una gran responsabilidad ha decidido convertir este negocio en su principal sustento familiar. Actualmente ofrece sus productos a sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y a todas aquellas personas que desean adquirir sus cosméticos por pedidos, gracias a su carisma, don de persuasión, dedicación y entrega tiene la satisfacción de obtener un considerado porcentaje de ganancias por cada producto que vende.El deseo de Madeleyni es tener más productos en stock, ella considera que haciendo esta inversión podrá ofrecer sus productos al instante y así mejorar sus ventas.

loans.use: Additional capital for acquiring a greater quantity of products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Malam

texts.en: Malam M. is 30 years old and married with a child.  He is a teacher in an orphanage school in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  With a low salary that could not sustain the family, Malam decided to learn a skill in the afternoon after teaching.   He learned to repair phones and is now providing service to the public.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $700 to establish a workshop and purchase cell phones for sale. Malam  would repay the loan from his salary and business income.

loans.use: Expand business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
Angel works constantly to create a source of income through sales of collectable books and a variety of kitchen utensils. With lots of perseverance he is able to find unique items in Lima and, as a street vendor, sell them in Juliaca city. For many years his success has enabled him to cover his basic expenses and pay for his children’s education. This enterprising father has a lot of plans for his business, but to finalize them he needs an investment. With this goal in mind he is turning to you and hopes to receive your support.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Don Ángel, trabaja constantemente creando su propia fuente de ingreso mediante la venta de libros de colección y variedad de utensilios de cocina, gracias a su perseverancia y a los novedosos artículos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y los oferta en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Juliaca. Durante muchos años su desempeño le ha permitido cubrir sus necesidades más urgentes y la educación de sus hijos.Este emprendedor padre tiene muchos planes en su negocio, pero para concretarlo necesita inversión, con ese fin recurre a vosotros con la esperanza de recibir tu apoyo.

loans.use: Additional capital for expanding his business

loans.name: Domingo Enrique

texts.es:
Mr. Domingo Z. has a business selling seafood which is based out of his home in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua. For the past 8 years he has had this business, which is currently what sustains his family composed of his wife and two small children. It is important to note that he knows a lot about seafood because his home is located very close to the Pochomil beach where he acquires these products for their respective commercialization.

. We cannot overlook the fact that Ceprodel has been a very important factor in his business due to the fact that it has provided him with credits to improve it. Today the credit that he is requesting will be utilized for the purchase of seafood, allowing him to continue to provide for his family that so greatly needs his support.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio que se dedica el señor Domingo Z. es la venta de mariscos el cual atiende en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace 8 años y hoy en día es el único sustento para su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos pequeños hijos. Es necesario destacar que este señor conoce mucho de mariscos por el hecho de que a cercana distancia de su hogar se encuentra ubicada la playa de Pochomil que es donde adquiere estos productos para su respectiva comercialización.

No podemos pasar por alto que Ceprodel ha sido un factor importantísimo en su negocio por la razón que le ha proporcionado créditos para mejorar su negocio. Hoy en día el crédito que está solicitando será utilizado para la compra de los mariscos y de esta manera continuar con el sustento de su hogar que tanto necesita de su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of Seafood

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juanita is well loved and respected in her community. Despite her age she remains eager to get ahead and support her daughters and granddaughters. Through her work she aims each day to improve their quality of life. She is coming to you today to kindly request a loan for expanding her beauty salon, a small business she opened with her daughters. A courageous mother, Juanita believes that expanding her beauty salon and providing good service will enable her to increase the number of clients and, at the same time, her income. Your contribution will enable her to make her dreams come true.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Doña Juanita, es muy querida y respetada en su localidad, pese a su avanzada edad sigue ansiosa D. seguir adelante y apoyar a sus hijas y nietecitas en sus actividades con el fin D. buscar día a día mejorar su calidad D. vida.La razón por la que se presenta ante vosotros es para solicitarte gentilmente un préstamo para implementar su salón D. belleza, pequeño negocio que abrió en sociedad con sus amadas hijas.Esta valerosa madre considera que implementando su salón y brindando un buen servicio logrará ampliar la cantidad D. clientes y por enD. sus ingresos económicos.Tu aporte permitirá cristalizar los sueños D. esta querida madre.

loans.use: Capital injection for expanding her beauty salon

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy is adept and skillful at repairing and selling photocopiers. Thanks to the connections he has made over many years, his repair services are in high demand in the cities of Juliaca, Aqyaviri and Puno. Percy is originally from the department (state) of Arequipa, but he moved to Juliaca for the greater employment opportunities there. In Juliaca he decided to rent a space and open a small company called Copier Computer Services SRL* with the goal of providing repair services and selling photocopiers. Percy would like to increase his investment capital to improve his revenues.

* Sociedad de Responsabilidad Limitada (SRL) is equivalent to Limited Liability Corporation (LLC)

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Percy, es muy ágil y hábil para la reparación y venta de máquinas fotocopiadoras, gracias a los conocimientos que adquirió durante muchos años es que sus servicios de reparación están siendo muy solicitados en la ciudad de Juliaca, Ayaviri y Puno.Percy es natural del departamento de Arequipa, pero por falta de oportunidades de trabajo radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde decidió alquilar un establecimiento para abrir su pequeña empresa denominada “Copier Computer Service S.R.L” con el fin de brindar sus servicios de reparación y ofrecer sus máquinas fotocopiadoras, el deseo de Percy es aumentar el monto de su capital, él considera que haciendo tal inversión mejorarán sus ingresos.

loans.use: Additional capital for improving his business

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
For a long time Elizabeth del Carmen B. has had a business selling food and drinks in her own small establishment in the municipality of San Rafael of the city of Managua. With two children to support as a single mother she seeks a way to put food on the table and for that reason she works hard to improve the economic situation in her home.

She now seeks support in Ceprodel through credits that will allow her to acquire the ingredients and drinks to sell them as well as to invest in increasing the size of her business’s storefront. It is necessary to highlight that through the approval of this credit both Elizabeth as well as her family are greatly benefited.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elizabeth del Carmen B. se ha dedicado desde hace mucho tiempo al negocio de la venta de comida y bebidas el cual atiende en su pequeño establecimiento en el municipio de San Rafael de la ciudad de Managua. Con dos hijos que atender y siendo madre soltera ella busca la manera de llevar el sustento a su mesa y para ello se esfuerza grandemente para mejorar su situación económica en su hogar.

Hoy en día ella busca apoyo en Ceprodel por medio de créditos que le permitan adquirir los ingredientes y bebidas para comercializarlas. Además para invertir en la ampliación del local de su negocio. Es necesario destacar que por medio de la aprobación de este crédito tanto la señora Elizabeth como su familia son beneficiadas grandemente.

loans.use: Improvement of her storefront and purchase of raw materials for food production

loans.name: Sheiku

texts.en: Sheiku S. is 52 years old and has been working as a teacher for 35 years.  With his small salary, he could not save enough to build a house for the family.  It took him years to save to be able to purchase the blocks.  A friend  who accesseda loan from Kiva told Sheiku about the Kiva program and he approached SMT and  requested a loan of $350 to purchase Iron sheets and doors to complete the construction.  He  hopes is to complete the house for the family to have sufficient living space.  Sheiku will repay the loan from his monthly salary.  He is married with eight children.

loans.use: Purchase Iron sheets and doors for completing the construction of the family house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Elvira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elvira del Carmen S. is a hard working woman who, for the past 5 years, has worked selling cooking fuel in her home-based business in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua. The sales process begins when she requests that the cooking fuel company bring full cylinders to her house. Her business cycle is that after receiving these and selling them she places new orders and returns the empty cylinders when the new ones are delivered.

It is necessary to highlight that Elvira has been supported by Ceprodel to improve her business through the acquisition of higher quality cooking fuel tanks. She is currently seeking the support of Ceprodel again and trusts that her credit application will be approved so that she can obtain a higher income and invest it in the education of her young daughter and household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Elvira del Carmen S. es una esforzada dama que desde hace cinco años se ha dedicado al negocio de la venta de tropigas para la cocina vendidos en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua. El proceso de venta del negocio inicia cuando ella solicita que la agencia de Tropigas le lleve los cilindros llenos a su hogar luego al obtenerlos y venderlos realiza nuevos pedidos los cuales al serle entregados ella de igual manera entrega los cilindros vacíos siendo este un ciclo en el negocio.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Elvira se ha apoyado de Ceprodel para mejorar su negocio en la adquisición de mayores tanques de tropigas para la cocina. Hoy en día una vez mas busca el apoyo en Ceprodel confiando que su solicitud de crédito será aprobado para así obtener mayores ingresos e invertir en la educación de su pequeña hija y en los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of cylinders of liquid gas to sell them in homes

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
In order to finish my home I only need the front gate and finishes.  I am asking for a loan in the amount of $600 dollars.  The installment of the gate will ensure that my home and my family are more secure when I am not home.  Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Para tener terminada mi casa solo me esta haciendo falta el portón de enfrente y los acabados. Solicito un préstamo de $600.00 dlls. Para la colocación del portón y  así estar mas segura la casa y mi familia cuando yo no esta en la casa.

loans.use: Finishes and gate for home.

loans.name: Luisa Del Rosario

texts.es:
Luisa C., a resident of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, is well known for the delicious cakes that she makes and sells out of her home. Through her own mini-bakery she sells cakes and other pastries which she prepares in her own oven. It is necessary to point out that the income that she receives through the sale of her cakes and pastries allows her to pay for the studies of her three children who so greatly need her support.

The greatest need that this humble woman is currently is the acquisition of economic resources to purchase the raw materials for the elaboration of her cakes and pastries. It is for this reason that she is seeking support from Ceprodel to obtain the credit necessary that will permit her to acquire these raw materials to continue with her economic activity in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luisa C. habitante del municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua se ha caracterizado por elaborar deliciosos pasteles que vende en su casa de habitación teniendo su propia mini repostería la cual atiende por medio de la venta de pasteles y otras repostería que ella misma prepara en su horno. Es necesario destacar que por medio de los ingresos que percibe de la venta de sus pasteles y reposterías ella mantiene los estudios de sus tres hijos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo.

La mayor necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa esta humilde dama es la pronta adquisición del recurso económico para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los pasteles y reposterías. Es por este motivo que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita adquirir esta materia prima para continuar con su actividad económica en su localidad.

loans.use: To purchase raw material

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
For the past seven years Maria Auxiliadora E. has worked selling food and drinks to her clients in her establishment in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua. She is a very hard working woman who with time has been improving her economic condition and that of her family thanks to the great efforts she has made to improve her business.

Today, like all businesses, she needs to invest economic resources in the purchase of food ingredients as well as drinks, and for this reason she has confidently applied to Ceprodel to obtain the credit necessary that will allow her to obtain such items and continue carrying out her home-based sales.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La dama Maria Auxiliadora E. desde hace siete años se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de comida y bebidas en su establecimiento donde atiende a sus clientes en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua. Es una dama muy esforzada que a través del tiempo ha venido mejorando su condición económica y la de su familia gracias a los grandes esfuerzos para mejorar el negocio.

Hoy en día como todo negocio, ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir recursos económicos en la compra de los ingredientes para la comida y además en la compra de las bebidas, por este motivo muy confiadamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita dicha adquisición y así continuar llevando a cabo sus ventas en su localidad de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of Food Ingredients

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
My house is missing a fence around it and in the back. But, at this moment I do not have the money necessary to buy the materials . For this reason, I am requesting a loan of $1000 in order to buy the materials to build a fence for the security of my house and kids.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

A mi casa le esta haciendo falta las barda al rededor y los acabados del exterior. Pero por el momento no tengo el monto que necesito para comprar el material es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls. Para la compra del material de la barda y que así este mas segura la casa y mis hijos.

loans.use: To build a fence around the house

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Martha del Socorro is originally from the city of Managua of the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. She works very hard in her business of renting out a food processing mill which serves her clients in the milling and crushing of corn, cocoa, rice etc. This is how she has earned a living to be able to pay for her two children to attend school and supplement household expenses.

Now she has applied to CEPRODEL with the goal of obtaining credit that will allow her to repair one of her food mills. As it is already in bad condition her business has been suspended, causing her to lose clients and not have income to improve her situation. It is necessary to point out that currently she has three credits with CEPRODEL that have been paid on time and according to the terms established.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Martha del Socorro es una dama originaria de la ciudad de Managua del municipio de San Rafael del Sur. Se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de alquiler de molino el cual atiende a sus clientes en el molido y triturado del maíz, cacao, arroz, etc. De esta manera es como se gana la vida para mantener los estudios de sus dos hijos y para suplir los gastos de su hogar de habitación.

Hoy en día ha acudido a CEPRODEL con el propósito de obtener un crédito que le permita la reparación de uno de los molinos ya que al estar en mal estado da lugar a un estancamiento en el negocio lo que hace que los clientes se retiren y no perciba ingresos para mejorar su condición. Es necesario destacar que actualmente ella tiene tres créditos con CEPRODEL pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Repair of Food Mill

loans.name: Maybel Maxcen

texts.es:
Senora Maybel works at your business of selling lime and sand. Her business is located in a room of her house and has been working out of it for the past 5 years. She began this business because her her husband's income was not enough to cover the needs of the house and she needed to better the the conditions of her life and her children's (who are of school age.)

Actually, Senora Mayble is already known in her area and has various clients. She sells her products to small and large truck drivers who then import them to their destinations.It should be emphasized that Ceprodel (the city) has been a solid place of business. In the past, she has received loans to commercialize her products. Today she requests a loan to buy more lime, sand and for construction.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

La señora Maybel se dedica al negocio de la venta de cal y arena en su casa de habitación dedicándose a este negocio desde hace cinco años el cual incursionó a este negocio por el hecho de que los ingresos de su cónyuge no cubrían con las necesidades de su hogar y para ello necesitaba mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y sus hijos en edad escolar.

Actualmente la señora Maybel es muy reconocida en el municipio ya que tiene varios clientes que llegan a comprar los productos en camiones o camionetas para llevarlos a destinos específicos donde se construye con esto productos. Es de necesidad destacar que Ceprodel ha sido un fundamento sólido para el negocio por haber dado créditos que le han permitido adquirir estos productos para la comercialización. Hoy en día una vez mas solicita los créditos confiando en que al ser aprobados le servirán de mucha ayuda para la compra de la cal y arena para la construccion.

loans.use: To buy lime.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Between my husband and I we've been able to build the house where we currently live. But, we have not been able to complete it because we need to finish some bedrooms for our children. For this reason we request a loan of $1,200 to buy materials needed to complete these rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Entre mi esposo y yo hemos construido la casa donde vivimos. Pero no esta total mente terminada nos esta haciendo falta la terminación de unas cuartos los cuales son para mis hijos. Es por eso que solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para comprar del material para la terminación de los cuartos.

loans.use: Completion of construction

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
In Managua, capital city of the beautiful country of Nicaragua, Mercedes M. owns a beauty salon where she provides services to her clients doing haircuts, cosmetic services and facials. She is a professional of the beauty business because she has done this for 30 years, this is why her clients are satisfied with her services.

We can't forget that Ceprodel has been key in the business by providing loans to expand the beauty salon. Today she comes to Ceprodel for a loan that allows her to buy cosmetics like hair brushes, gels, powder, lotions and hair color. With this loan her family will benefit, which consists of Mercedes and her small son.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

En Managua capital del bello país de Nicaragua, la señora Merceds M. posee su propio negocio de salón de belleza donde atiende a todos sus clientes brindando los servicios de corte de cabello, confección y limpieza facial. Es una profesional en el ramo de la belleza ya que se ha dedicado al negocio desde hace 30 años y por este motivo es que sus clientes se sienten satisfechos con sus servicios.

Nop podemos obviar que Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en el negocio habiendo proporcionado créditos para el crecimiento del salón. Hoy en día ella acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de los cosméticos como lo son peines, gelatinas, talco, colonias y tintes para el cabello. Con este crédito se beneficia ella y su amada familia que consta de su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for beauty salon.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra A. is a lady that for a long time has worked in the business of breeding chickens and hens, having her own pen in the back of her house, in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua.

The business consists in breeding these animals to then sell them when grown and also selling eggs produced by the hens.

To improve her business, it is necessary to install a converter that provides power to the pen, this is the reason why she has come to Ceprodel to get a loan that allows her to buy the converter.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra A. es una dama que por mucho tiempo ha trabajado en el negocio de crianza de pollo y gallinas teniendo su propio corral en su casa de habitación en su patio en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua.

El negocio consiste en la crianza de estos animales para luego venderlos cuando están crecidos y de igual manera en la venta de los huevos cada vez que estos son puestos por las gallinas.

Para el mejoramiento de su corral le es necesario instalar un transformador que proporcione energía a la gallera, por este motivo es que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir el transformador el cual será instalado con el propósito de que pueda proporcionar energía eléctrica a la gallera para así llevar a cabo el proceso de crianza de estas aves.

loans.use: Purchase of a converter that provides power to chicken pen.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Caminando Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
21 people are part of the association “Walking to the Future” that belongs to the focal centre of Villa Exaltacion in the city of El Alto.

There are different activities in the group, for example clothes sales, hand knitted sweaters, general stores, but the main activity is food.

Francisca sells beef meat, Teresa prepares a variety of lunches, Julia sells fast food (burgers and French fries with sliced hot dog sausages). However, with the sale of these items they can only make the minimum income to cover their daily expenses and rent, not only for their houses but also for their businesses; they need more working capital to hire helpers and expand their businesses and this way make more income and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Veintiún personas forman parte de la asociación “Caminando al Futuro” que pertenece al centro focal de Villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto.

Existen diferentes actividades dentro el grupo por ejemplo la venta de buzos, chompas tejidas a mano, tiendas de consumo, pero la actividad principal se centra en la comida.

Francisca vende carne vacuna, Teresa prepara almuerzos variados, Julia vende comida rápida (hamburguesas y salchipapas). Pero con la venta de estos alimentos solo consiguen ingresos mínimos para cubrir gastos diarios y alquileres tanto de sus casas como de sus negocios, necesitan mayor capital para contratar ayudantes y ampliar sus negocios de esta manera conseguir mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Working capital to expand their business

loans.name: Uriel

texts.es:
Uriel S. is the owner of a small carpentry shop in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, where he stands out for being a good worker manufacturing molds, doors, windows, frames and all types of furniture. He is the father of two children and together with his spouse they make an effort to provide for the studies that their children deserve and improve their education.

Since he started his business 11 years ago he has gone through financial difficulties, but has overcome them thanks to the support given by Ceprodel, who has helped him to supply his carpentry, attracting more clients.

The reason why he asks for a loan today is to buy wood to work with and to repair his tools. He waits confident knowing his loan will be approved.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Uriel S. es dueño de una pequeña carpintería en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua donde se destaca por ser un buen trabajador en la elaboración de moldes, puertas, ventanas, marcos y todo tipo de muebles. Es padre de dos hijos que junto con su cónyuge se esfuerzan para proporcionarles los estudios que ellos se merecen para salir adelante en su educación y preparación.

Desde que inició su negocio hace once años ha atravesado difíciles circunstancias económicas pero a través del tiempo las ha venido superando gracias al poyo proporcionado en Ceprodel el cual le ha beneficiado de manera que ha logrado suplir su carpintería atrayendo mas clientes.

Hoy en día el motivo por el cual solicita el crédito es para la compra de madera parar trabajar y a la vez para la reparación de sus instrumentos de trabajo. Por esto es que espera muy confiadamente sabiendo que su crédito será aprobado.

loans.use: Repair tools and purchase wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Bit by bit I've been able to build my house. But, in order for me to be able to live in it, I need to add some safety features and complete the exterior. This is why I request a loan of $1,000.00. I wish to finish all these projects in order to be able to live in it.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Poco a poco he construido mi casa. Pero para poderme ir a vivir, pero me esta haciendo falta las protecciones y los acabados del exterior de la casa. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls. Para la terminación de los acabados y protecciones en mi casa y así poder vivir en ella.

loans.use: Completion of the exterior of his house and safety additions

loans.name: Zayda De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Zayda is a hard working woman who has dedicated her life to the store she runs with her two children. Her children are school-aged and she has some humble needs for her home.

Nowadays, she's been able to improve her living conditions thanks to the loans she has acquired through Ciprodel. She currently qualifies for two loans which she has paid on time and has helped her improve her life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Zayda es una persona muy trabajadora el cual se ha dedicado al negocio de pulpería con el que mantiene a sus dos hijos en edad escolar y suple las necesidades de su humilde casa de habitación.

Hoy en día ha mejorado en parte la situación de su pulpería debido a que a través de los años ha invertido en el mejoramiento por medio de la diversificación de sus productos. Para esto se ha avocado a Ceprodel el cual le ha proporcionado créditos que han sido utilizados directamente en la adquisición de los productos para el negocio. Actualmente ella posee un record de dos créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma según lo establecido por la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for her store

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
"It's been a short time since I got my modest home in the city of Nuevo Laredo. These homes are given out without windows or doors. In order for me to be able to live in my new home I need a loan of $700. This way I will be able to add what I need and have my family be able to move in and live in it. This way my family will also be safer when I'm not home."

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo poco tiempo que adquirí me vivienda económica en la Ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Esta casa las entrega sin protecciones en ventanas y puertas. Para poderla abitar necesito un préstamo de $700.00 dlls. Para ponerle las protecciones en las ventanas y puertas y así poder irme a vivir hay con mi familia y dejar de pagar renta. Y mi familia estará un poco mas segura cuando yo no este.

loans.use: Addition of windows and doors

loans.name: Thy Phlang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
