Mrs. Thy P. is the Village Bank President in Popeal Khaer Village, Kandal Province. There are 33 members in her group.

She is 34-years-old and has two children, both of whom are too yO. to work or study. Mrs. Thy P.’s second child has malaria and takes frequent trips to the hospital. Thus, Mrs. Thy P. has unforeseen expenses.

She is a subsistence farmer and her husband, Mr. Heourn C., is a farmer and fisherman. Mrs. Thy P. is requesting a loan to purchase a fishing net and would use additional money to buy more fertilizers and pesticides for her plantation.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net, fertilizers and pesticides for crops

loans.name: Kakeda Sun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirty five members have formed a group in ChrO. OmpE. Village in Kandal Province with  Ms. Kakeda S. as the Village Bank President. She is 25-years-old and a single woman in the village. Last year, Ms. Kakeda S. got appendicitis and she spent $300 to cure herself. 

She is a scarf weaver, a profession she learned from her mother. Her business is doing very well and she would like to increase her scarf inventory by purchasing additional thread.

loans.use: To obtain a loan to purchase  more thread to weave scarves

loans.name: Thị Thơm

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Thơm (MS: 09010005), 37 years old, is a seamstress. Her husband farms egg laying chickens. They have a school aged child. Their daily income is 150,000-180,000 VND. She would like to take out a loan of 2,006,000 VND to buy feed for the chickens. Her group has 6 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers. (There is an extra man in the picture due to Lê Danh Dị has moved to other group.)
  • Lê Đắc Chỉnh (MS: 09010007), 37 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for chickens.
  • Hoàng Thi Nhung (MS: 09010008), 37 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for chickens.
  • Hoàng Thị Tuyển (MS: 09010009), 37 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for chickens.
  • Hoàng Thị Hường (MS: 09010010), 32 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her grocery stand.
  • Lê Thị Hằng (MS: 09010012), 33 years old, applies for a loan to “đi chợ”
  • Lê Duy Sơn (MS: 09010013), 33 years old, applies for a loan to buy fertilizer for rice paddy.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Thơm (MS: 09010005), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị làm thợ may, chồng chị chăn nuôi gà đẻ trứng. Anh chị có một con đang đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 150.000-180.000 VND/ngày. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho gà. Anh Lê Đắc Chỉnh (MS: 09010007), năm nay 37 tuổi. Anh vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho gà. Chị Hoàng Thi Nhung (MS: 09010008), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua thức ăn cho gà. Chị Hoàng Thị Tuyển (MS: 09010009), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho gà. Chị Hoàng Thị Hường (MS: 09010010), năm nay 32 tuổi. Chị vay để lấy vốn mua hàng bán ở chợ. Chị Lê Thị Hằng (MS: 09010012), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để có thêm vốn đi bán hàng. Anh Lê Duy Sơn (MS: 09010013), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua lân đạm bón lúa. ( Ảnh nhóm: Thừa Bác Lê Danh Dị vì đã chuyển sang nhóm của cô Thu)

loans.name: Thị Thu

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi Thu is 51 years old. She is taking orders to make "Chung" cake (Vietnamese special occasion cake for Lunar New Year), while her husband is the owner at a small restaurant. Her son already married and moved out. Mrs. Thu's family income is about 100,000 - 150,000 VND per day (equivalent to about $6 - $9). She wants to borrow 2,006,000VND (about $125) to buy rice to make "Chung" cake and run the restaurant. What Mrs. Thu like most about this program is that she is allowed and encouraged to pay back w/ small installments :). Ms. Vu Thi Hoa is 33 years old. She also wants to borrow $125 to fund for her small stall at the market. Mrs. Hoang Thi Mai is 38 years old. She also needs $125 to run her small stall at the market. Mrs. Le Thi Nhan is 45 years old, and she would also love to have $125 to buy goods for her stall at the market. Mr. Le Danh Di is 49 years old this year. He also wants to borrow $125 to buy chickend food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Cô Lê Thị Thu (MS: 09010001), năm nay 51 tuổi. Cô làm nghề gói bánh Trưng để bán theo đăt hàng của khách, chồng cô bán hàng ăn. Cô có con trai đã lập gia đình. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô khoảng 100.000-150.000 VND. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn mua gạo làm bánh Trưng và bán hàng ăn. Cô thích vay vốn của chương trình vì được trả góp. Chị Vũ Thị Hoa (MS: 09010002), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để có thêm vốn bán hàng ở chợ. Chị Hoàng Thị Mai (MS: 09010003), năm nay 38 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ. Cô Lê Thị Nhân (MS: 09010004), năm nay 45 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi bán hàng ở chợ. Bác Lê Danh Dị (MS: 09010011), năm nay 49 tuổi. Bác vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho gà.

loans.use: retail and breeding animals

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Thị Thoa

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Thoa (MS: 09040042), 32 years old, sells fruit at the open market. Her husband is a laborer. They have two school aged children. Her daily income is less than 10USD. She is applying for a loan of 125USD to invest in her business. Nguyễn Thị Út (MS: 09040043), 56 years old, is applying for the same amount to help her “đi chợ”.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Thoa (MS: 09040042), năm nay 32 tuổi. Chị bán hoa quả ở chợ, chồng chị làm công nhân. Chị có hai con đang đi học. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 150.000 VND/ngày. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn bán hàng. Cô Nguyễn Thị Út (MS: 09040043), năm nay 56 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

loans.name: Thị Phiên

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thị Phiên (MS: 070019), 50 years old, has been a loan group leader before. The loan was paid in full. She is a seamstress and her husband is a construction worker. Their income is about 80,000 VND a day and they have 2 school aged children. She feels comfortable with theweekly repayment plan. She is applying for a loan of 2,478.000 VND to buy material for her job. Her group has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • N. Thị Huế (MS: 070009), 37 years old, applies for a loan to invest in egg laying hens
  • N. Thị Bắc (MS: 070016), 34 years old, applies for a loan to invest in refreshment stand.
  • N. Thị Dung (MS: 070020), 50 years old, applies for a loan to buy fertilizer.
  • N. Thị Tý (MS: 070025), 51 years old, applies for a loan to invest in pigs.

Cô N. Thị Phiên (MS: 070019), năm nay 50 tuổi. Cô đã tham gia được một kỳ 6 tháng, cô và cả nhóm đã hoàn trả rất tốt. Cô làm thợ may, chồng cô làm thợ xây. Mức thu nhập của gia đình khoảng 80.000 VND/ngày. Cô có hai con hiện đang đi học. Cô thấy trả tuần sẽ giúp mình năng động hơn và tiết kiệm hơn. Cô vay 2.478.000 VND mua vải may quần áo để bán. Chị N. Thị Huế (MS: 070009), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị vay 2.714.000 VND để nuôi gà đẻ trứng. Chị N. Thị Bắc (MS: 070016), năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua nước giải khát về bán. Cô N. Thị Dung (MS: 070020), năm nay 50 tuổi. Cô vay 2.478.000 VND để mua phân về bón cây trồng. Cô N. Thị Tý (MS: 070025), năm nay 51 tuổi. Cô vay 2.478.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn.

loans.name: Thị Quý

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thị Quý (MS: 070002), 49 years old, has been a loan group leader before and trusted by her group members. She sells pork at the open market. Her children are grown up and have jobs. She like this type of loans. They are convenient and encourage her to save. That’s why she volunteers to be a group leader. She is applying for a loan of 2,478.000 VND to buy bean for selling back to tofu makers. Her group has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hiền (MS: 2.478.000 VND), 33 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her grocery stand.
  • Nguyễn Văn Minh (MS: 070010), 30 years old, applies for a loan to invest in his electronic shop.
  • Chương Thị Duyên (MS: 070007), 25 years old, applies for a loan to buy wood for making furniture.
  • Nguyễn Khắc Ngọc (MS: 070013), 37 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for chickens and buy scrap.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô N. Thị Quý (MS: 070002), năm nay 49 tuổi. Cô làm nhóm trưởng của kỳ trước, được các thành viên trong nhóm tín nhiệm nên cô lại tiếp tục làm nhóm trưởng của kỳ tiếp. Cô bán thịt lợn ở chợ. Cô có con đã lớn và đã đi làm. Cô rất thích với việc trả góp sẽ giúp mọi người tiết kiệm, Chính vì vậy cô làm nhóm trưởng để khuyến khích mọi người tham gia. Cô vay 2.714 để mua đỗ tương về bán cho các hộ làm đậu. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền (MS: 2.478.000 VND), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND về để bán hàng tạp hoá. Anh Nguyễn Văn Minh (MS: 070010), năm nay 30 tuổi. Anh vay 2.478.000 VND để mua đồ điện về bán. Chị Chương Thị Duyên (MS: 070007), năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua gỗ về đóng bàn ghế để bán. Chị Nguyễn Khắc Ngọc (MS: 070013), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua cám cho gà, và đi mua bán phế liệu.

loans.name: Thị Yến

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thị Yến (MS: 050021), 37 years old, has had a loan before. The loan was paid in full. She enjoys the repayment plan and that’s the reason she would like to apply for a loan this second time and also going to be group leader. She is a shift worker. She also sells fruit at the open market for extra income. Her husband helps her to tend livestock. The income is about 120.000 VND a day. They have 3 school aged children. She is taking out a loan of 2,242,000 VND to buy feed for her pigs. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • N. Thị Bính (MS: 050014), 43 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her grocery stand.
  • Lê Thị Miến (MS: 050019), 51 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for chickens and buy rice to resell.
  • Trần Thị Hải (MS: 050020), 44 years old, applies for a loan to buy fruit to resell.
  • N. Thị Ngọc (MS: 050022), 30 years old, applies for a loan to buy eye glasses and hats for her store.
  • N. Thị Hậu (MS: 050023), 41 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her pork stand at the open market.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị N. Thị Yến (MS: 050021), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị đã tham gia được một kỳ, và đã hoàn trả rất tốt. Chị rất thích với việc trả dần sau này không phải trả cả một khoản lớn, nên chị tiếp tục tham gia kỳ 2. Chị đã nhận làm nhóm trưởng vì tinh thần trách nhiệm của nhóm rất cao. Bản thân chị làm công nhân, ngoài giờ ở nhà máy chị còn đi bán hàng hoa quả để kiếm thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Chồng chị giúp chị rất nhiều trong công việc chăn nuôi. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 120.000 VND/ngày. Chị có ba con vẫn đang đi học. Chị vay 2.242.000 VND để mua cám và lợn về nuôi. Cô N. Thị Bính (MS: 050014), năm nay 43 tuổi. Cô vay 2.478.000 VND để mua và bán hàng tạp hoá. Cô Lê Thị Miến (MS: 050019), năm nay 51 tuổi. Cô vay 2.478.000 VND để nuôi gà và mua thóc gạo bán. Cô Trần Thị Hải (MS: 050020), năm nay 44 tuổi. Cô vay 2.242.000 VND để mua bán rau quả ở chợ. Chị N. Thị Ngọc (MS: 050022), năm nay 30 tuổi. Chị vay 2.242.000 VND để mua kính và mũ bán ở chợ. Cô N. Thị Hậu (MS: 050023), năm nay 41 tuổi. Cô vay 2.242.000 VND để mua bán thịt lợn ở chợ.

loans.use: Invest in business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Jinja Agency Women's Group

texts.en:
K. Rashidah, the Chairperson for Jinja Agency Lending group, is an exception. She is a “hawker” and sells new clothes for young girls without a fixed location, but walks around busy markets and taxi parks carrying and selling them, a job she has done for 6 years. She is 50 years and married with 7 children, as she caters for 2 stepchildren and 4 grandies. Rashidah says life is good now, compared to when she was trading in used clothing, and she has been able to buy a fridge with the previous loan, stocked it with soda, and placed it in a friend’s shop.

With her portion of the group loan, she plans to buy more new girls’ clothing to sell, which she buys from Kampala, the capital city, as well as stock the fridge with more soda, beer and juice. She is really business oriented and respected as the group leader, and she has a 6 years’ experience with loans. Her dream is to be able to rent a store as her shop because moving around is not an easy job now that she is growing old.

loans.use: Kayingo Rashidah plans to buy more new girls’ clothing to sell, as well as stock the fridge with more soda, beer and juice.

loans.name: Kiwala Harriet, Baligenwa Group

texts.en: K. Harriet is married with children, the eldest being 14 years old while the baby is 6 months. For the past six years, she has been selling used clothing for women, men and children from Jinja Market. She buys her stock from the large market in Kampala at a discount and then brings the items for sale at a higher price. For the stall in the market, she pays a daily fee to the authorities and with her loan, she plans to buy a bale of used clothes now that a store has been opened up in Jinja that sells the same clothes in bales, hence saving the transport costs. By buying in larger quantities, Harriet can get a larger discount, hence more profits. She is a member of Baligenwa lending group for 6 years.

loans.use: Kiwala Harriet plans to buy a bale of used clothes for her stock with her loan.

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Sarswati M. is a 43 year old unmarried woman who lives in Dhalko, Kathmandu. She lives with her father, mother and one brother. Her father is a farmer and her brother works at the computer institute. 
Sarswati M. is a tailor in Dhalko. She opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. She took 6 months of training for tailoring work. She prefers to make ladies clothing like blouses, Kurta-Sulwar, etc. She also makes school uniforms for boys and girls. Due to lack of capital, she cannot expand her business.  She is requesting a $150 loan to buy raw materials for her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunita L. lives with her husband and one daughter in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. Her husband's name is Mr. Arjun L. and he works in gardening. 
Mrs. L. makes different types of candles in her own home factory. She supplies her product to grocery stores. She took one month training for the work. The demands for candles are increasing rapidly in Nepal because of power load-sharing. Nowadays here in Nepal we have 3 hours of power cut daily.  So Mrs. L. is requesting her first loan of $150 to buy the necessary raw materials to meet the demand of candles.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. Sainbu-Bhaishapati is one of the developing villages of the Lalitpur district. Most people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband's name is Shiva Ram K. and he is an electrician. Her daughter and her son are studying in grade 6 and 2 respectively. 
Mr. K. is engaged in goat farming. At present she has 6 goats. She sells goats’ milk in the local market. Now she wants to buy a few more goats to meet the increasing demand for milk. So she is requesting for $450 loan to buy more goats for her business.

loans.use: To buy goats for her business

loans.name: Ambica

texts.en:
Mrs. Ambica K. is 35 years old and lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati with her husband and two children. Her husband name is Kapil K. and he works in private office. Her son is studying in grade 8 and daughter is studying in grade 5. The economic condition of her family was not good because her husband's income is not enough to fulfill family needs.
So Mrs. K. started goat farming 3 years ago. At present she has 4 goats. She sells goats’ milk in the local market daily in the morning and in the evening. Now she wants to buy a few more goats to meet the increasing demand for milk. So she is requesting for a $450 loan to buy more baby goats for her business.

loans.use: To buy baby goats

loans.name: Krishna Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Krishna kumari M. lives with her husband and three children in Thecho Village. Thecho is one of the developing villages in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in seasonal farming. Mrs. M.’s husband's name is Mr. Ratna Kazi Maharjan and he is engaged in handicraft work. Her daughter is studying in grade 9 and her sons are studying in grades 6 and 1 respectively.
Mrs. M. opened her poultry firm three years ago to upgrade her family's standard of living. She sells her chicken in the local market.
Now Mrs. M. is requesting for a $150 loan to buy more small chickens to sell.

loans.use: To buy small chickens.

loans.name: Baligenwa Women's Group

texts.en:
N. Grace is the chairperson of Baligenwa women’s group in Jinja. She prepares local brew known as “malwa” for sale using millet that is fried on a large metallic tray, milled, mixed with water, and after a few days, it’s ready. She is 42 years old and married with 7 children, and also cares for 1 grandchild.

The group has been together for 6 years and all members agree that with the loans, life has improved a lot and this has enabled them to send their children to school. Grace would like a loan to expand her business by buying more millet since she is now able to sell 4 jerry cans of malwa in a day at $6, yet other customers enjoy the drink at her home where she has constructed shelter for them. Customers come with their jerry cans and her job is to fill them.

loans.use: Nayigu Grace would like a loan to expand her business by buying more millet for making more malwa.
